3.description: I didn't like the drink I ordered, but their food is really good. Nice place to go after work. They also have slot machines.

1.description: Of course it's not for everyone, hidden on the corner of Western. I can't say I am a fan of course, but it was fun for what it was. Co workers wanted a "cheap" drink, and let me tell you it was far from it. A hard liquor glass was almost $9 and for a place like this that is just, well: A DIVE, that shouldn't of been the case. I was rather surprised but at the same time I thought maybe its becuase we were dressed rather conservative and this place seems to cater to a less dressed crowd. Water Hole, hmmmm we should've really thought of that before entering do rained libations. But on the plus side, they serve a hell of a great fried chicken wing! Of course you have to order the food and really know what southern fried chicken is, yes they don't play when it comes to the fried chicken. It's been one of the least known spots to have it made this way. But again, is the bar part of this joint what I would keep coming back to? Nope.

2.description: Randomly ended up here after the laguinitas brewery closed. The ambiance was amazing-a lot of soul and the drinks were strong. Some of the regular clients were a little less than friendly but overall it's def a southwest side treat.

5.description: Visited Fri night several times to watch a friend play, and we really enjoy this place.  Can't be beat for being a great dive joint with live blues, warm friendly people that make you feel like family.  Very informal and comfortable atmosphere, not too loud, no one's shushing you if you talk, but why would you?  Mary Lane and her band are entertaining, and it's really fun when she invites guests up (lotta musicians there, and they all know each other.)  The regulars are a trip!  Mr. Sat. Night DJ, you da bomb.  We'll have to drop by to hear what you're spinning.It's split into two rooms, bar in front, and music in the back room with another bar.  You can order fried chicken or catfish, comes with fries and a slice of white bread.  Cook is very tall - and funny.

6.description: I visited this place sometime ago with my sisters and I have to say this was one of my memorable evenings. I never been in a place like this before, which made it exciting.The name says it all, "Water Hole Lounge".  It has a southern-like feel to it.Older crowd seemed to be in the front and younger crowd in the back, which had a DJ. The drinks were decent and easy on the wallet.  I recently found out they serve food. Overall we met new people and had a nice time.

7.description: a great place to hang out. reminds me of chances r, just no peanuts  to throw  on the floor, great music , food and fun.live blues some nights, comedy others, darts and bid whist.always ask about drinks speicals, you don't ask, you may miss out.grown ass fun  for grown ass people.ps. i heard thid place will be a part of the chicago blues tours.  kk.

0.description: super hospitable, very friendly, the jerk chicken wings and dirty rice, OMG so good. My friends wanted to leave, but Elmore James Jr. was going to play. This is a preliminary review based on one visit, but it was a very good experience. I'll be back.This is in a crappy location. People probably pass by a lot and think, maybe I should stop and see it, maybe it looks threatening, like a bar in the hood someplace. I wanna visit more and get a better sense, but I think it probably deserves more love than it's getting. If you've been driving by or taking the bus by on Western for years, going 'hm, what about that place?' like me, you should swing by sometime. I hear they do amazing sets during Blues Fest.

4.description: My coworkers and I had lunch from Chef Armando, and let me just say it was so delicious!! I had the turkey sliders and they are the best I've had yet! Beats Bacci's turkey burger for sure!!

1.description: I was told to check this place out by a good Co Worker of mine.I'm so happy that he told me about this place.The atmosphere is just great And this place is very nice and clean.This is a family owned and operated business.Lucy is a smoothie master.This is a place where you can just go and relaxWith free WiFi.This place has a great variety of smoothies, with many different flavor's to choose from, hot/cold teas, coffee Drinks protein bars and much more.You can even call before you come and Ms. Lucy will have it ready for you when you get there.

0.description: This place is great I found it through another website and it said this place is good. I must say it is awesome when I came in the door I was greeted by Joey who is manager there and he was really friendly and knowledgable about everything on the menu. He was able to take time to answer questions and explain everything. The teas are good and the shakes are really good also. Prices are really reasonable too. I wish this place was closer to where I live I would be there everyday.

3.description: Hands down the best meat around here. Carnitas are delicious, tamales are soooooo good. Ay ya me dio hambre

1.description: Great place. All of the food is made to order and delicious. The dining area is a bit small, so I mostly just get it to go. Definitely a hidden gem and it's super close to my house which is awesome.

2.description: Definitely a hidden gem in McKinley Park. I've lived around the corner for many years and never knew they had a little restaurant inside. Tacos are so delicious! Green and red sauces are spicy, so be careful if you don't like spicy. Burrito is huge! I couldn't even finish it all. And the tortas are amazing as well! A must try if you live near! Prices are not bad either.

5.description: Yesterday I paid  $8.54  ($7.75 plus tax I think) for a veggie burrito at La Placita. This is highway robbery as a steak burrito would have only been $5.25 plus tax. If the ingredients cost less then the whole package should cost less. It the end product was outstanding or even very good I would have been fine with it, but the burrito was just ok.

6.description: I've had their steak tacos a few times so far, and I must say, they're very good. It's a small side restaurant in a local grocery store. But they're friendly, and quick, and did I mention good? Definitely somewhere to grab a good quick lunch or dinner.

7.description: I think this place has the best steak tacos. I usually order mine with just cilantro and onions, the traditional way. Their steak is grilled with just the right taste, not too salty and has just enough flavor and is smoky too. Tacos used to be only $1.25 several years ago but now it's $2.25/ each, which is now double, but I think it's reasonable since it's so good!

8.description: La PLacita is a small market on 35 and Honore st.  This place is very handy in for smaller grocery items when you're in a pinch.  They offer the usual fare with chip, snacks, candy and soda pop. Although their produce may at some times leave a little to be desired, I have found them to be avery good and quick source for the random potato, green pepper, onion, etc.  needed to finish that recipe.  La Placita's  strength is it's meat counter in the back.  They offer all the cuts of beef, pork, and no chicken( sorry on fish).  Stop in on the weekends for hot, and fresh carnitas bought by the pound.  It's also  hard to find a cheaper morning\ coffee snack than their pan dulce (Mexican sweet bread) 59 cents a piece.     La placita is a true"carniceria" being that it offers a small restaurant offering fresh tacos, sopes, and other Mexican treats.  This small restaurant is the perfect bet to grab something on the run or just quick stop before getting on the 35th st. bus.  Or on your home from the orange line.  I find the "convenience fee" offset by their selection and quality.  La placita like the many other small "tiendas" around Chicago offer a quick service and are in fact a true asset to their customers.  Also the old lady who works calls me "El gaupo" all the time.

0.description: I live walking distance from this place and just discovered it recently. I've been addicted ever since. The food is made to order and is always delicious. Particularly the tacos. I can do without the tortas though. I usually take out since the dining area is small. $10 minimum on cards if I'm not mistaken. I strongly recommend!!

4.description: Delicious burrito. Tons of flavor from this small spot inside a market.  Green sauce is nice and spicy and among the best I've had. My new go to place in the area.

1.description: I used to cook eggs in a sauce pan, boil water for tea in the same saucepan, cook roasts in the same sauce pan, boil eggs in the same sauce pan, use  fat skimmers to pull fried foods out of oil, use the table top as a cutting board, etc..  Are these statements embarassing?  No, seeing as I knew exactly well what it is I was doing rather it was the fact that I was broke as a joke and couldn't afford real kitchen ware.  So when I started making some moolah I needed to start cooking in something else besides my trusty sauce pan a.k.a. "rusty buttum".  I went here for the first time four years ago.  I picked up some brand,  new shiny stainles steel pots and pans.  They also offer some really useful utensils if you like to cook alot.  Remember, ina good kitchen you need at least four pairs of kitchen tongs.  You can get glasses and silverware there too, but I think you have to get like  a dozen of them in one shot. The woman who worked there was very helpful and even ordered me a smaller pot than the one they had in the store.  Good kitchen ware at decent prices.  As for "ol rusty buttum" we still have him.  Sometimes I tell the other pots that they don't know me likr "ol rusty buttum" does.  He is semi retired, now he is used to catch the water from the radiator= put out to pasture

0.description: This is such a fun store! A little cramped, but fun and very reasonably priced.  I love purchasing "restaurant" items for my home.  Things like cute napkin dispensers, pancake syrup dispensers, half-sheet baking pans, etc.,  this place has a lot of that kind of product.  I love it!  It's a restaurant supply company that is open to the public.  Now there are others out there, but this one is a little cheaper than others I have been to.   Yeah, I found a few items here and there that were maybe a little on the pricier side - so I won't get those.  But I look at it as a treasure hunt - so much fun to see what I will find next!

12.description: Clean, big aisles and friendly staff. Too bad it's not 24 hours, but then again if it was, it probably won't be the way it is now.

7.description: The whole store is just nasty to look at. Smells like spoiled milk. Bake shop is sad to say the least. Deli never seems to have what I want. Caters way to much to the area it's in. Sorry but true.  Empty shelves, always out of what yeah need. No matter what area your in. If they feel the need to compete with Pete's congrats......Pete's is just as nasty to shop in. I walked out. Employees at this Jewel are older then dirt and should have retired 20 years ago. And if yeah ask for help, your on your own. Not helpful or friendly. They all seem sooooo bitter.  I was raised on Jewel....Sad to see this one. I go over to the bigger one on Canal. Better location, more products and way safer parking lot.....They really need to think about either closing it or redoing the entire store even dump the ancient employees.....Cater to all races......The one on canal does and clean too......'Mariano's is way better as well... it is way more also customer friendly. Great products line etc. This Jewel is just nasty....in side and out!

3.description: Dominick's abandoned the south side of Chicago ages ago & Jewel wanted to focus on only offering their gas stations to us but somehow, a few stores remained.  This one seems to rarely have anything that I need though from time to time, booze is sometimes cheaper here

1.description: WHERE IS THE HUMANITY?! Customer service is extremely terrible, and racial profiling is at an all time high at this location. I moved to the area a couple of years ago and to my dismay this was the most convenient location to me, BUT after 2 years of being "causally" followed around by security and other employees I have had enough. You would think those ignorant employees would get that I am a regular customer therefore I'm not going to steal. I even have exchanged smiles and words with the so called security they have, because I constantly see them in every aisle I turn, VERY awkward and borderline creepy. The cashiers are also very rude, on multiple occasions I have locked eyes with a worker and asked for assistance and they just look away as if my eye contact and verbal words were invisible. The last time this happened another store employee saw how frustrated I got and apologized for her red neck coworker and proceeded to to tell me she's hard of hearing....WTF is she working in customer service if she hard of hearing, and even if she was I was 2ft. away so it's nothing but utter BS. Then the same red neck checked me out but not after having a good 5 minute conversation with her other hill billy co-worker, it took ME to say something for them to stop and proceed with my check out( all the while giving me a dirty look). Every time I entire the store I feel like I am entering another dimension were segregation still exists and I am most definitely not welcome. I am not even African American but I guess a racist can not see past skin color. No one deserves such crude and an inhumane experience for some damn groceries. Like I previously stated this is the closest grocery store to me but I discovered a fabulous ALDI's a bit farther then I would like, but I will be eagerly going that extra distance and its WAY cheaper than Jewel-Osco! I'll be taking my money there.

2.description: They close at 11 not 1am. Clean store poor customer service. They have everything you need

9.description: I don't go to this Jewel unless I absolutely have to.  I only go here in an absolute emergency, and even then I consider my options.  The last time I was in here, the whole store smelled like expired milk, and there were 2 checkers for about 30 people in line.  Also, the milk they had was all expired.  Pass...

18.description: This Jewel was built in the 1980's so it is now one of the older Jewel stores.  It's always been a little crowded, had an ethnic flavor like a city market, not a suburban store.  It's enjoyed good success, so it stayed open whereas the newer, more modern store at 4938 S. Kedzie closed a few years ago.

10.description: Ehhhhh shady and next to the L station.... pass by and go to the domincks.  Also the TCF bank inside contains the rudest employees.

13.description: This used to be my go to jewel with lots of parking, and friendly staff.

16.description: We do some of our shopping here. Mostly their generic brands and anyhting that might be cheaper than pete's market prices(which usually isn't alot).  Regular super market fare but they do have a Tcf branch in there which is a plus because they also have  one of the better liqour store dept in the area.  Which actually may not be a good thing but, fvck it.

17.description: Nice staff. Great store. Open til eleven pm. Has Redbox outside. Would never shop there for produce (Petes Market is way better) but good show. =)

15.description: After the remodel just recently I am still adjusting, but this is a close market that I can get just about anything my heart desires.There is a friendly crew of folks that run the joint and I never have an issuse finding anything on sale or otherwise.  Clean sales are and restrooms (bonus)ATM/Bank on inside is handy if you are a TCF fan

0.description: Jewel-Osco holds a special place in my heart since I am a Chicagoan. Many of my friends, family members, and neighbors had their first jobs at Jewel. Consequently, Jewel feels like an extended member of the family and neighborhood. Moreover, Jewel is like your older reliable aunt so to speak.  It's convenient, sometimes more affordable than other supermarkets, and has great store brand goods.In efforts to compete with Mariano's, Pete's Fresh Market, and other new grocers, this Jewel has undergo a facelift and offers new products. The deli and meat counter have increased their selections, there are more organic veggies and fruits, and more prepared foods.  I look forward to more improvements.

5.description: A jewel is a jewel I guess. I prefer shopping elsewhere, but not much else that's close in this neighborhood.

11.description: I don't go here that often.  Now, I mostly buy fruits and veggies, and in my 'hood, there are many cheaper places to get fresh fruit.  I really only go to Jewel if I need something I can't get anywhere else in the neighborhood (or if it's something that is overpriced at a supermercado):  hummus, cereal, orange juice, sorbet, soy milk.  Bread is cheaper here too than the supermercados, but I have a breadmaker now.What saddens me is that while other Jewel's I have visited include an aisle or two of all hippie-organic stuff, this one does not.  Even Kroger in Memphis had an organic section!  Come on!  Memphis is more modern than McKinley Park's Jewel? Now, I don't buy all organic, but when you're vegan, a lot of the stuff you eat is organic.  They don't have organic produce either.  I do try to buy the dirty dozen fruits and veggies organic (see the Environmental Working Group's site).  So I have to make a monthly trip to Whole Foods on Canal Street.  I'd make a bimonthly trip if Jewel would bother to sell more organic stuff.

8.description: I come here once in a while when its only for an item or a few. I don't generally shop here for all of my groceries because they are a bit pricier than their competitors. Their store is pretty well presentable and maintained well. I use this primarily for flowers and random things I may need through the week or so.

4.description: Great alternative if Dominick's on Ashland is closed.I don't think this is the cleanest Jewel that I've ever been to. I don't think it helps that the neighborhood is a bit shady, but they can't help that. I bought some value pack beef and when I opened it at home, 1/2 was already brown. Awesome.

14.description: Recently remodeled. They did such a thorough job, they even stripped wallpaper covering old signage from when I was a kid.Produce prices are ok(go to petes for cheaper produce), but the Deli is solid and the hot foods are decently priced.Meat dept has alot of good items. Too bad they dont have as many manager's special(closeout meat) like dominicks.Prices are typical of all Jewel locations. The booze dept was upgraded when they rennovated, so a lot of good choices for beer and other booze.It's walkign distance to my house, so I just get stuff on my way home from work. Advice? Go there EARLY. The old ladies scoop up all the super sale items when most people are at work.

6.description: If you are in need of tamale making supplies this is the store for you. The advertisements are all over the store. If you need anything else you are in big big trouble.1) Wanted Lorraine swiss cheese from the deli. Very scary situation as NONE of the meat and most cheese is NOT plastic wrapped so it is subject to the other flavors and odors in the cooler. Asked for a piece to taste and why it was not wrapped. Clerk claimed someone had just bought some and she just hadn't re-wrapped it. The cheese tasted like ass, weird deli meat, more ass and feet. NO thank you on that...2) Vegetable bins were virtually empty. Almost like the apocalypse had occurred. There were many bannana's though. So I bought some.3) The seafood cooler was very very warm and the shrimp in the cooler were 'sweating'. Gross. I hope noone gets sick from them.4) Enough pop aisles to satisfy a diabetic coma but no real 'food' choices. Like bread. Or anything but tamale making supplies.Oh, but wait, there is an alcohol section that takes up as much of the store as the food. What does that say about this Jewel? Well you do the math, you want booze go here. You want food, don't.This place made me feel really dirty in my special spots. I was nervous to even buy the dog food that I needed.....

12.description: I've lived so close to McKinley Park for all these years yet have never tried Nicky's. Our HR Manager actually came to me and said "You've never had a Big Baby?!" She thought I was joking but I really had no clue. So we ordered lunch from Nicky's and brought it back to the office. For the price of the items on their menu, the portions were huge and delicious.I, naturally, had to try a Big Baby for the first time ever and it was delicious - reminded me of Maxwell Street burgers but bigger. The fries were good too. The second time I had Nicky's, I ordered a gyros and man was that thing massive. Tons of onions and tomatoes and extremely generous on the tzatziki sauce too.Great and inexpensive place for lunch, but not very friendly on the waist! It's ok though, I'll just spend an extra 30 min on the treadmill!

7.description: Finally got around to trying this place out.Ordered a big baby, beef with sweet peppers - dipped, gyro and 2 large fries. I had the gyro. Decent size and the meat was flavorful. Pita was a bit thinner and harder than most places. My guy had the beef and I took a bite (not a big Italian Beef fan) and thought it was too salty. He thought it was a bit salty and he likes salty food. Fries were meh! I've definitely had better.My sister had the big baby and she said nothing special this place.It was quick though. I'll come back for a quick meal if I'm in the mood.

20.description: Had a big baby (double cheeseburger) and a polish from here, both with ketchup and grilled onions. Total came out to be around 5.50 or so.The polish was OK, but not the best I've had. It seemed a little small and not up to the same level as the polishes at Jim's original or Johnny's. The bun had poppy seeds on it, which is a plus.The big baby was a winner, though. Nice soft bun, flavorful meat.There are three booths and a counter by the window. I was in and out within four minutes. This place is not open on Sundays.If you're in the neighborhood, this place is worth stopping by, but don't go out of your way to eat here.P.S. This place has no relation to the Nicky's on 58th and Kedzie. Apparently there are a lot of "Nicky's" out there.

19.description: If you're from the McKinley park area, you heard the phrase "You can't go wrong with Nicky's". Friendly service who remembers your orders if you're a regular. The infamous "Big Baby" is the best thing there. Fast & very good on your pockets. You get filled up & feed the family.

1.description: This place is great. Great food at decent prices. The people taking the orders are attentive and very kind. Overall great place. nothing bad to say.

2.description: Having a plate full of gyro meat thats insanely plentiful as well as delicious was crossed off of my bucket list today. They have a gyro plate for 750 or something, and its insane. Like manhattan halal cart level.You can get a veal parm sub for 2.95 its amazing, and that price well, it's not a typo. Enough said. Stay black Chicago

9.description: Great place in the neighborhood!!! Big baby and shrimp basket is what I got. It's the best greasy fast food around

6.description: Don't expect anything fancy - just expect good greasy food in large quantities at excellent prices.  That's Nicky's Carry Out in a nutshell.And once you crack open that nutshell and step up to the counter to place your order, you'll be addressed by a no-nonsense employee who is on a mission to get food to you in as short a time as possible.  You say the word, and your order is on the way.  You make a payment, and your food soon arrives.  I have never had to wait more than 3 minutes total from order placement to food-bag handover.Note (not just from me, but also plastered a few times on their walls): CASH ONLY.  They luckily have an ATM on-site if you're desperate for cold hard cash, but fair warning needs to be given.  Even more luckily, you won't need a whole heckuva lotta cash to get your food.  The prices are quite good and the portions are a decent size (I'm a fat guy - that should translate to "possibly too much" to any skinny folk out there).The Big Baby is one of their star attractions.  It's a double-cheeseburger with ketchup, mustard, grilled onions, and pickles.  You can get other toppings like lettuce and tomato if you're not a purist or if you are a salad afficionado or something.  The cost (without doing the combo and getting fries and soda) is only $3.15.  Keep in mind that they're not the largest of patties, but again - I found it to be a decent size.  I had the Big Baby combo with fries and a drink today for lunch and it didn't make me all logey/sleepy at my desk the rest of the afternoon, so I'm glad.Their gyros were also pretty good the last time I had one of those - and I haven't ordered the Italian Beef, but someone else in the group did a while back and I recall that looking hefty in size and not so hefty in price as well.  Smelled dern tasty as well!The fries - they're more of a shoestring variety, so there's a lot more surface area to therefore be grease-laden.  They had an okay taste, given the price.  I will have to remember to ask for them well-done next time to 1) see if they will do it and 2) see if it takes the fries from OK to OMG like I've experienced at other establishments who understand what "well-done fries" are supposed to be.I can't say much else for the place.  There are some booths if you feel like eating in at a place called Nicky's Carry Out.  Given the fact that they have an A/C in the room, I'd consider eating there - if it weren't for the fact that my office is just a few blocks away to eat in our lunchroom.All in all, I have to say that I recommend Nicky's to anyone who can stand eating at a greasy-type foodery without being a worry-wart or calorie-freak.Just get in there, fork over the cash, and get yourself a heaping helping of greasy love in a paper bag.

18.description: This is our lil lunch spot and if you don't know what a BIG BABY is I suggest you find out. But I'll give you a lil clue it's a greasy double cheeseburger W/ grilled onions on it and don't even get me started on there Italian beefs they're better than Portillos yeah I said it big bad Portillos they skimp on their meat but Nicky's sure don't and they're fries are really good man I'm getting hungry just talking bout it !!

10.description: I came here with a group of Chicago land Musicians for a pre-gig dinner. Since we were kinda in a rush we ordered a hot dog special that consisted of two hot dogs with a large trey of French fries, well I believe it was a special (since the place doesn't accept credit cards, one the guys bought me dinner.) The service was great and the food was decent (you known hot dogs!) I believe their main thing is Polish and Gyros. It's a great place to grab a quick bite.

13.description: ***[DISCLAIMER] Nostalgia-laden review of EPIC proportions!***If you grew up within two miles of McKinley Park, you've eaten at Nicky's on Western...no exceptions.  I don't care about Nicky's on Kedzie, and you know what?  We never even HEARD of Nicky's on Kedzie, so take that, Nicky's on Kedzie!  THIS was the place to go for the best in neighborhood Chicago cuisine!Cheeseburgers, gyros, chicken sammies, the Polish dogs...think "Chicago" and you have it right there!  Huge portions, greasy food, greasier fries and for carry-out, a nearly translucent bag by the time you get home...oh man...I just ate a little while ago and already I wish I was back in ChiTown for a Polish and strawberry shake!I know that parking on and near Western Blvd is a joke - it always has been - but that's no excuse.  I walked from W 34th St and Western as a kid every other day!  ;)

16.description: The best!Have a Big Baby or the Beef or the Gyros or the Hot Dogs or the Chicken Sandwich, it doesnt matter its all good! You cannot get better prices anywhere else.I would RECOMMEND this business.

17.description: The absolute worst! Service sucks, food is worse, place is substandard in terms of cleanliness.

15.description: It was a delicious beef sandwich.  Right up there with portillos. Good healthy sized sweet peps.  Beef had an extra saltyness that left me wanting more.  In all I wouldn't drive more than three miles to come here.  But for a greasy spot the beef was as advertised.

0.description: First time here. Good food. Big portions. Reasonably priced. Friendly Service.  I'll be back!!!

5.description: Been going to this place for years. There are many Nicky's in the city, but this one blows them out the water.  Why? They keep it simple.  The menu is just right.  Up until now, I have tried every item. My go to is typically, well I really don't have a go. It's all a go.  As a matter of fact, I just finished a beef/sausage combo, dipped with hot giardiniera. If around the neighborhood, stop in.  You won't be disappointed.

11.description: Had a big baby (double cheeseburger) and a polish from here, both with ketchup and grilled onions. Total came out to be around 5.50 or so.The polish was OK, but not the best I've had. It seemed a little small and not up to the same level as the polishes at Jim's original or Johnny's. The bun had poppy seeds on it, which is a plus.The big baby was a winner, though. Nice soft bun, flavorful meat.There are three booths and a counter by the window. I was in and out within four minutes. This place is not open on Sundays.If you're in the neighborhood, this place is worth stopping by, but don't go out of your way to eat here.P.S. This place has no relation to the Nicky's on 58th and Kedzie. Apparently there are a lot of "Nicky's" out there.

8.description: So glad it's down the street  when I want a good eat,

3.description: i usually always enjoy these little burger/gyro joints.. but this one.. not so much.. service a little slow.. took them a while to take my order..i ordered the big baby because of all the reviews on here.. also ordered a polish hot dog and a gyro..big baby - i thought it was something special.. but its basically a cute name for a double cheese burger because thats exactly what it looks like when i open it up.. it had grilled onions in there with 2 slice of cheese and 2 patties.. the meat was really thin and it didnt taste that great.. i think it the quality of the patties..polish hot dog - also didnt enjoy it.. meat again tasted very generic for some reason...gyro - the gyro wasnt too bad.. actually the meat tasted good and it came in a big portion too.. but the pita bread on the other hand.. its a little hard  and it made it hard to eat..i much rather go to maxwells to get my burgers and polish.. way way better there... and the gyro .. there is other options around the area for it that makes it better..

14.description: The big baby is my jam, but you can't go wrong with anything here and it's all a bargain!

4.description: The chicken tenders/strips from here aren't actually that bad. Pair em up with the fries and I think the cholesterol rise is really worth it - You get a choice of ranch or BBQ dipping sauce. I always get my cheeseburgers from these type of stands with grilled onions. Whatever you put on your burger, from this place, it'll taste like it wasn't sitting on the grill for more than what it should be. Hot dogs and all that other good stuff on the menu are good to order too! It's a cool spot to have a quick bite, as long as it's not during break times. Or maybe it is. I guess it depends on whether or not peeps are on the go or not.

1.description: If I could give this crap place less than a star , I really would. They tattooed me when I was underage and was too naive to know what the procedure was. I had no idea that they had to stencil and once approved that they would then transfer the stencil onto my  skin. For twenty dollars, I received what I paid for at the age of 16: an abysmal free-hand black widow with a skull. Now that I am older, I hate to look at the thing and even feel embarrassed. Take your money somewhere else.

0.description: A really good place to go!!!I have been there twice and I got 7 tattoos, I really like it!

58.description: Dear Lindy's,I love you so much.  I love you and I don't want to tell anyone about you, but I just can't help it.  I get this way with boys and apparently favorite secret holes in the wall.  Chili is amazing and you can get it in a cup, bowl, or crock.  Beans?  No Beans?  No problem.  Add some cheese, onions, or sour cream.  The onion is super strong and meets my onion breath needs.  This chili is good.  I forgot to mention you can buy it in a bucket for party needs or a 55 gallon drum (for around $2,300) if you're planning to start a militia in Wyoming or something.  You can add chili to any of their sandwiches, both on the sandwiches or as a side, in order to create a dream meal.  Just stick with the chili though, it blows the other goods out of the water.  By sticking with straight up chili goodness, you can save room for the ice cream.  I suggest the Sweet Sixteen Sundae.  The description says "never been kissed" but the whipped cream and toppings on that monster made me feel more than a little bit dirty.  Chili, ice cream, and waitstaff straight out of the cast of Gummo.  I need this like I need brick of solid gold thrown straight through the windshield of my car.

56.description: If you are planning on coming here for a meal I highly suggest that you hide the bathroom scale for when you get back home.  God, what is wrong with me?!  I come in for a cup of chili and walk out with a belly full of onion rings, patty melts, turtle fudge sundaes, and yah some pretty hearty chili.  I don't even know why I am admitting to my gluttony for the entire internet to read.  I was bad, but the food was good.  Maybe not so much the patty melt, that was just ok.  Maybe next time I will opt that out.  Also I do need to mention that the onion rings were exquisite.  You can bite into them without fear of the whole ring sliding out and slapping you in the face.  How do they do that?  Is David Copperfield working some magic in the kitchen?  Service was ok considering we were in a chili shanty.  The girl got all huffy because we wanted to order a dessert after she closed our tab without even asking.  Plus there is a charge for all the toppings (cheese, onion and sour cream) so keep that in mind when ordering.  Or just bring your own??????

29.description: The place has a unique, "no frills" atmosphere so if you're expecting something else you will be disappointed.  That said, the chili is just awesome.  Philly steak, chicken strips, sliders, are all pretty good.  They also keep a nice selection of beers and have free wi-fi.

42.description: I love this place.  Not only is the service nice.  The food is excellent.  I find it very hard to find chili w/o beans anywhere.  This is the place to get it.  Though I find it odd it costs more to have no beans versus w/ beans.  Meh, no matter.  Plus, the chocolate/peanut butter shake is delicious.  I bought the chili pasta and it's delicious.  Looks like they do a lot of catering so you can by different size containers of chili if you want.

23.description: I love the chilli here!! You can get a 5-way like they do at Skyline! The food us great, the ambiance is not so great!! It looks really dirty and out dated inside, but like I Saud the food makes up for the looks!!

47.description: Came here tonight with my guy. Waitress was wiping down the tables and chairs and the place a stench to it. Place looked a bit dirty.Ordered a Miller Lite on tap and he got Modelo. He ordered the cheeseburger special and I just got a burger with fries. Both of us were not impressed with our meal. Burger had no taste to it and it was dripping with oil. The fries were hard. Had to drench it with ketchup to eat it.

8.description: Closed for remodeling! It's been 2 months Lindy's when will you reopen?! I'm getting nervous over here. I'd like a cheeseburger dream meal and a vanilla shake before it gets too cold to walk the few blocks over.

31.description: had to bump my review back up to 4 stars based on my last few visits. The service was really improved. They also have a frequent diner punch card, fyi.try a marshmallow shake!

34.description: I believe that everyone is entitled to their opinion, and I kind of happened to pop in this place all of a sudden and it was one of the best places I have had chili at, it may not be the best as far as appearance is concerned, but they make up for it with the chili. The service was good, I like the fact I was able to pick between Turkey and Beef Chili, and it was very filling for the price. I seen a few negative remarks on here, and everyone is entitled to their opinion, but I found it to be a great place to happen to stop in for a meeting. The server was a Latina, she was very courteous, and she was very sweet, great experience, not 5 stars, but it was well worth the visit. I didn't try the ice cream, I guess I will save that for next time :)

16.description: I have been going to this location for over thirty years. Yikes I can't believe it has been that long but it has. I don't think the decor has changed in thirty years but that's a whole different post. It used to be packed solid at lunchtime but now there was just me and three other tables. I always get the same combination which is a cheeseburger and a cup of chili Mac and no matter what time of the day or what time of the year the quality is always the same. You can't beat the chili Mac. The fries were actually better than previous times but that may just because they cooked them a little longer just like I like them.There is a parking lot and free parking on the park side of the street.

13.description: This place is just a cool as it was when I first came here. Before Yelp.The servers are always nice - surprisingly so, as a matter of fact. You need more cheese? More crackers? You got it.If I had a complaint, it would be that the decor hasn't changed since I first came here. Before Yelp. But I go here for the food, not the decor, so who cares?But the fact that you can simultaneously get beer AND ice cream ... Makes this place freaking amazing.

11.description: Sad not what it used to be.  Time for the new owner to open his eyes once the construction out front is done.

39.description: The chili was really good, and so was the banana shake. However, the eggplant sandwich completely failed! it was greasy and too cheesy.

37.description: Really good chili. Probably perfect cure for a hangover. Clearly a local favorite. Be sure to drop in if you find yourself in the neighborhood.

0.description: Stopped at Lindys during a long walk through the city. Excellent chili and ice cream. The chili is rather mild but with hot sauce I'm able to get it the way I like it.Service was rather unfriendly and actually kind of surly and slow. If the service improved to average Lindy's would have gotten five stars.

38.description: This place is great! I had my order to go, so I can't really say how the staff is, however the lady that helped me at register was kind. I ordered a BLT turkey breast sandwich, (you should know I dislike bacon veryyy much) so why I did this, im not sure. Well im extremely glad I did because I ate the whole thing with no complaints! Delicious sauce, ingredients were fresh, and they even have wheat bread choice! Ill be back again to dine-in this time!

51.description: LOVE THE CHILI!! the Shakes are great to. Honestly you can't go wrong with the food!

27.description: One of my usual lunch options when I'm in court at 26th and California.  Decent service and the food is always consistently good.Chili and a dog for me.

32.description: Zero stars if I could. Revamping of the bar area and new ownership had not helped this placed at all. Tables were half full and short on staff. On e we were seated, it took 10 minutes to get water, 15 minutes to get out order and when it finally came my ice cream had a roach in it. My kids were upset when I told them we had to leave. Waitress was no where to be found! I walked out, put kids in the car w/spouse and asked for the owner. Waitress thought I skipped out on the check...she never even came back to give me one. The owner was apologetic, but I will never go back, nor can recommended it to anyone. It's a shame, because I use to love it as a kid.

54.description: When it comes to chili there is only one restaurant in town that is worth the drive.  Lindy's Chili on Archer is hands down the best chili in Chicago.  Lindy's has a meat and a meatless chili.  Chili extras are also available, such as shredded cheese, sour cream, crackers, diced onions.  Also, available at Lindy's are chili cheese fries and chili cheese dogs.If you choose to eat in, you will enjoy a no-frills experience.  And by no frills I mean no frills.  Not even hot water in the bathroom sinks.There is also a tiny bar often patronized by south siders who are constantly yelling at whatever game is on the tube.On our last trip to Lindy's we got a root beer float that was so good, because it was made with Gertie's ice cream.If you're craving chili, head to Lindy's.

48.description: This was the most disappointing meal I have had in years.  I had been looking forward to going to this restaurant for a long time.  I was near one this past Saturday and sat down with some friends.  We ordered Chili fries, Chili Mac, and 2 "soon to be famous" Italian Beefs, one "cheesy" located at the very top of the menu.When ordering the waitress asked if the beef was the one with marinara sauce.  After I said, No, beefs do not have marinara sauce. She said she must have been confused with the meatball sandwich.  Strange, but fine.  She came back a few minutes later and asked what kind of cheese I wanted on my beef though it says on the menu "cheddar cheese sauce".  I asked for cheddar.  We received our Chili fries which were really good.  However, the tv was tuned into the Kardashians, and they were visiting someplace that had John Wayne Gacy's brain and it was disgusting.  We asked her to please change the channel, which she did after a few minutes.  The waitress brought out our food, a "cheesy Italian beef" with guess what? Marinara sauce all over it.  The Italian beef was gray and boiled.   I thought about just taking it, but I just couldn't do it.  We sent it back.  She then came back with another beef that had American cheese slices melted on it.  I asked, "is this Cheddar" and she said, "Hmm, I think it is."  I tried to eat some of it but my deeply rooted love for Chicago Italian beef was dying inside.  Meanwhile, Lindy's little ant friends were crawling across my Boyfriends Chili Mac plate.This was the last straw.  We sent both of our boiled, absolutely bland, and one plastic cheese covered beefs back to the waitress.  She apologized and said she would give us a full refund, but we said that we would pay for the chili (regardless of ants it was tasty) and the drinks and fries.  She offered us some ice cream, which we accepted, and was delicious.However, one thing the waitress told us while apologizing, I believe that all yelpers should take to heart- "You know what?  I only order the chili and the ice cream here, I never, NEVER order anything else..."Wish I'd known that before I ordered.

44.description: Their brownie sundae is not on the menu but it is to die for!! Their turkey chilli is amazing!

24.description: Well, it's been a minute since hubs and I have stopped in here--almost 2 years.   Came in on a recent Sunday afternoon to catch the end of the Bears game, grab some lunch and a beer without having to drive to the south loop.  We were hoping the new owners would have managed to turn this place around.  What a mistake.We won't be back. There was a cockroach scampering around on the wall across from our table and another climbing all over the booth across from us.  Midday.  Broad daylight.  Luckily the waitress was pretty nice about it (though seemed a little less than shocked) and didn't charge us for the food.  You couldn't pay me to eat here again.  It's a shame.  What I wouldn't give for a nice, clean sports bar and grill to get some wings or a burger and watch the game without having to hop on the highway.  . . . a girl can dream.

7.description: Recently remodeled, but continues the tradition of excellent chili and burgers. prices are very reasonable.

49.description: This place has been around for ages, but I have never been to this location.. the original closed and I haven't been since. I can not speak for the chili, but the ice cream is REALLY yummy. Its thick and dense and with whatever toppings you desire. I had the cherry sundae with vanilla ice cream and lots of whipped cream and my friend had the turtle sundae which was also very good. Service was good and place is basic.. nothing fancy for sure. I will try the chili next time..it looked good, but I didn't think it would be a good mix and I would be paying for it later.

40.description: saw this on Chicago's best and since I'm local, i just have to give this place a try! i came here with my 2 cousins one night to see what's this place is about.. service was OK.. not the greatest but yet not the worst. After we sat down we notice 2 little annoying flying insects flying around us so we had to kill it and no we are dirty people if that's what you guys are thinking haha..  anyways, we ordered 3 chili , hamburger , gyro , and a polish.... the chili was a little salty and definitely not one of the best chili I've had.. the gyro was horrible, very less meat, the pita was oily, and the sauce was sooooo watery its unbelievable... the burger and the polish i saw my cousins eating just looks like a typical school served lunch, they said it was just alright and nothing special about it... only good thing about the meal was the fries, but that's about it... i will not be coming back here again..

53.description: The Chili Here is too soupy, its like a sauce for a coney dog.  This is nowhere near the best chili in Chicago, it is edible though there is not much flavor or texture whatsoever.  If you have a hankering for chili then keep looking past lindy's.

30.description: Yummm.... they now have my favorite beer New Holland's Dragon's Milk... Always a cool spot to chill and have a beer.  Their pecan ice cream recipe is awesome!

46.description: This place was excellent, i came here for a milkshake after dinner one night, and it was the best milkshake ive ever had it was out of this world. I decided i needed another dessert, so I got chili and it was amazing as well. I wish i had a party big enough to buy the 55 gallon drum of it!

1.description: Aside from being located next to the park fairly close to where I live, Lindy's is pretty bland. I've gone there on multiple occasions and yet I've been rather apathetic on most things on the menu except for the chili. That chili was definitely something to brag about. I never tried their ice cream.The bar section is very cramped and the locals who hang around aren't particularly friendly. Overall, this restaurant is average at best, like this review.

55.description: This is the original location of Lindy's Chili, and it is not far from an Orange Line stop. I ate a filling combo of chili and tamales. Somehow I followed that with a "child" sundae, which tasted good thanks to the warm cup of chocolate syrup. It was a pleasant "comfort food" meal.

9.description: Chili is good, enviroment not so much. For a place that serves chili that is a hearty meal that warms you when your cold, the dining area is freezing  (it's  December turn on your heat). You would think the place would be warm and inviting. Make sure you specify if you want beans or not. My husband ordered his chili without beans. I just ordered chili. Mine came without beans but I thought it would come with beans sense that's the main ingredient in chili guess not. So just specify when ordering.

26.description: Second time.. I came once at 1040.. the next time at 1020.. both times an older lady told "sorry we close".. I ask if I can take something to go and they say no.. wtf.. why say you close at 11 if it's a lie.. I used to love this place but screw them now

25.description: The hamburger & fries are good. That's all I order when I go. The service SUCKS!!!!!!!!!! Once I waitress ask if she can go on a smoke break while serving us. RUDE. & once I walk in with my brother & we were about to sit down on a table & a waitress said we weren't able to because closing time is 45mins away. I was cool with that so I order to take out. While waiting for my order a WHITE couple walked in & sat on a table & I just look at the waitress & shook my head & left.

12.description: One of my favorites right here!Either if im going on a low key date with the lady or out for a few beers with the guys, this place is always on point.Regular Diner food with great chilli. Im usually going with the Cheeseburger Dream Meal (comes with a cup of chilli) and it has never been bad. Throw down a strawberry shake at the end and you got yourself a fantastic meal. Or belly up at the bar and have a couple Budweisers and hang out for a while.Love this place.

59.description: Haven't been there in years, but noticed the addition of Gertie's.  They used to be on 59th and Kedzie by the Colony and I remember their "tummy buster".  One of those if you can eat it all (by yourself - no help) you don't have to pay for it.  Never did that one, but did others.  Fond memories.Now on to Lindy's.  Went to De La Salle HS and passed the place every day on the bus.  It was good back then and I assume based on the reviews I've read here, it still is.

21.description: The food at Lindy's and Gertie's used to be good, but it's declined quite a bit over the last few years or so. I used to love their chili and ice cream, but neither things are as good as they once were.

17.description: Came here on Sunday with my family trying to have a family day out we ordered 3 hot dog meals and a chili dog. What we didn't order was a side of rudeness. The waitress took forever to come take our order. She only had 3 tables all together and was slow with everyone before she came to our table she took three milkshakes to another table and slammed and I mean SLAMMED the cup down in front of the girl not cool. When she came over to Us she took our order with her attitude at 100% we couldn't fully order that we had to end up sharing the food AND DRINKS since she took our order in a rush and we could barley get a word in. I get better service at McDonald's and Burger King. We will never be back.

10.description: Sad to have seen what has happened to this location since I was there 10 years ago.  Musty smell when we walked in.    Chili tasted like it came out of a can.   "Nachos" were topped with cheesy goo from a can, and more of the canned chili.    Shakes I heard were good from those at our table that ordered them.    Hope they go back to their old formula of doing things - it used to be much better here.

5.description: This is a child hood tradition i think the chlli could be a little bit better but i always come back

3.description: I can't speak to the full menu at this place, but if you show up and order a milkshake and a hot round of french fries, you will be living the dream, friends.  Incredibly tasty business, with one of the best chocolate shakes I've had in Chicago (super thick, lots of ice cream, big, the value prop was just right).  The fries were fresh cut and served in a big to-go bag...if I had to stretch, I would complain that there were not enough ketchup packets in my bag.Otherwise, amazing and the service was fast, but I was a takeout order, so I can't speak to some of the complaints I'm seeing here about the table service.

35.description: I have never been to a place of such ignorance! We ordered food to go/for pick up for my work. I picked up the food over $20 worth including a quart of chili..... I realized he had put no extra cups and NO SPOONS OR NAPKINS in the bag.... I went back in to ask for utensils to eat our food with, where I was told (by who I believe is the owner)  ' WE DON'T GIVE AWAY THINGS FOR  FREE HERE"  Ok I can MAYBE  see if he didn't want to give me extra cups for us to pour the chili into,  but Spoons?!?!?! I am ordering from a business! we could come back and order everyday if we wanted to!!Are you kidding me??? I'm not some stranger off the street. I am a customer, who just bought your food!!! You don't give people a plastic spoon to eat your food with?? Napkins aside! (which he still doesn't give you!) How could you not give us plastic spoons??? IT GETS BETTER... He wanted to charge me $0.05 per spoon!!! Are you that hard up for money that you need to charge your customers .05 cents per spoon and a couple extra cups and napkins?!?! Overall the food has a general bad taste in your mouth when you know that you paid an ignorant person when there are so many other great business owners busting their butts everyday to stay open and they would never treat a customer like that.In my opinion I don't know how this place stays open aside from the fact it has name recognition and a couple locations. unfortunately for them bad word of mouth travels much faster, and I will never recommend this place and make it a point to share my terrible experience.

19.description: One of my usual lunch options when I'm in court at 26th and California.  Decent service and the food is always consistently good.Chili and a dog for me.

28.description: mmmm , this place is ok. I gave it 3 stars because the staff was friendly and restaurant is family friendly. i ordered a burger and my fiance ordered spaghetti and chilli, which turned out to be a bad idea. we also ordered nachos with chili, which i expected it to be better than it was. the chilli was more watery and mushed out. it just wasnt that great. i feel like they have good food here, i just need to figure out what it is. the icecream sundae was ok, maybe the shakes are better.  i definately want to go back to give it another try.

45.description: Banana milkshakes!! Solid low key diner. I've never tried anything else besides the milkshake.This is based on the frozen tasty beverage i indulged in  a few days ago...which was outta sight!!

33.description: We stopped in early in the week late one night. I had one of the dream meals which included a cup of chili, an all beef dog, fries and a drink. All were good...not great, but good. The prices were very inexpensive. The beer that day was 2 bucks! The chili which was highly touted was decent, but nothing more than that IMHO. The service was good, the place was reasonably clean, and as I said the food was decent. I would return if I am in the area. If you want a satisfying, inexpensive meal, with good service this is a good bet. Ice cream was good too!

43.description: I know the locals love this place but I just don't understand why.I've had the chili and it reminds me of the chili we had in CPS grades K-12, which didn't kill us but was nothing to write home about. Take that chili and add more water and that's Lindy's. What's funny is a friend brought over a to-go bucket of Lindy's chili which was actually pretty decent. So I wonder if they get lazy at the actual restaurant.Service was okay.The ice cream sundaes are outright gross in my opinion. My ice cream had fragments of ice in it and had an uneven consistency. Maybe freezer-frost issues? I don't know. The whipped cream was the grocery store can, so it can't really be reviewed, can it? I mean, a lot of ice cream shops make their own whipped cream because it isn't too difficult. And the hot fudge was not hot and it was just chocolate syrup. Maybe hershey's? No matter what it was, the sundae contained the ingredients of basic crap I can find in the grocery store. Gertie's has no right to call it their own if nothing in it is homemade and all they are doing is assembling it for me, poorly at that.I'll stick to making my own chili at home and Margie's for a real sundae.

2.description: I was craving a chili cheeseburger and ice cream so this seemed like the perfect place to go. It's a classic Chicago style burger; not the highest quality chili but a perfect compliment to the burger. I really liked that I was able to request it cooked medium and it actually came medium. Gotta love when the take out container is wrapped in plastic wrap to keep all the chili inside :)My banana split is AMAZING!!First, I am a bit of an ice cream snob. In a blind taste, I can tell the difference between Gelato and ice cream and such. The chocolate ice cream was a perfect blend. Chocolate ice cream very easy can be slightly grainy but this was nothing like that. It is very creamy and perfectly sweet. The vanilla ice cream is flavorful and creamy. The strawberry is the only one I've ever had is even close to my dad's. It's so flavorful! I will totally go back and look forward to eating my way through the menu :D

18.description: all this place is good for is the chili which is!nt made there and the beer. I sat  and ate there, all the food was cold from the pic up window all the way to the counter

41.description: This is a nice looking small chili bar. I enjoyed the chili and Polish dog. It is a charming little bar and eatery and I look forward to seeing the other places it has in the Chicago area. The fries are pretty average anc could use an improvment.

52.description: This is a staple of the southside. In my opinion, it represents the neighborhood, southwest locale, and memories of my childhood. Yeah, its old and a little run down inside, but its full of personality and never lets you down. I do miss the original Gertie's on Kedzie...I still remember walking in from the summer heat to a cool breeze and the smell of ice cream!I have no complaints about this place! There's always a place to sit, food is served quickly and hot, waitresses are attentive but not naggy, and the ice cream is the best you'll ever have. I'm happy they have turkey chili on the menu, and I've had their fish sandwich many times. Oh, and the onion rings are just about the best you'll get from anywhere. The prices have gotten a little high over the years, but what can you do? Back to the ice cream - its the exact same stuff you would get at the original location on Kedzie. And everything is customizable - you can substitute chocolate ice cream for vanilla, combine toppings, etc. My usual is a hot fudge marshmallow sundae without the nuts. It will make you bust a gut, but you only live once!

50.description: i love this place going there for years, that's why it's hard for me to do this. The service was among the worst i have ever received. The waitress was very rude. She asked me if I wanted peppers on my dog I simply asked for no radish, then she goes on telling me that's not what she asked. " I  don't care about the radding, I'm asking if you want peppers." Then she still bring me radish. that's not the wost part of it. I didn't even get my appetizer till 20 minutes after my family got our dogs. I wanted to leave and forget about the wings. I used to be a server, so I know the importance of a tip, that's why, in case she wondering why she didn't get one, I didn't see it happening. To the management. Get some more help.

4.description: Feel so bad writing this review but it is what it is.Came here with some friends and waitress was so rude.I had the cheeseburger, cup of chili, fries and a side or rudeness.The chili was ok, fries so forgettable, burger was bad, I've had better burgers with the clown and the royal, but my side of rudeness was on point. Waitress comes and puts the check on the table, we had to ask if we could have some icecream, the icecream was good BTW, banana split with strawberries and pineapple, and they added a lil something I can't quite put my finger on it, it was strong, sour and weird, o yea it was rudeness.not again

6.description: Recently, I went to Lindy's on Archer & Western, and it was really disappointing.   They expanded the bar, so it was pretty noisy, and the customer service (or lack of) was really bad.  The waitress didn't even acknowledge us, and after what seem like forever, we left.  I really like their chili, but if this is what is to be expected.  Thanks, but no thanks!

22.description: I have been coming to this location for about 30 + years. I have seen many changes over the years. This is always my place to go when heading back from the sox game. Unfortunately , as a suburbanite, I don't get here nearly as often as I like. A true Chicago legend!

15.description: Best vanilla ice cream! I've been here several times for the ice cream. You can take a carton to go. Never ate the food here. Definitely worth coming here for smooth, creamy delicious yummy ice cream!!

57.description: Oh I wanted to like this place so much but I was sadly disappointed. I went here today with some friends for lunch. We order mac and cheese, some chili, fries, a burger, a grilled cheese and a ham and cheese sandwich. First off the mac and cheese was horrible. It was watery as the noodles were probably soaked in water and not drained properly when it was added to the melted cheese. The sandwiches and burger were meh. My friends complained that the cheese on their sandwiches were too salty. The fries were disgusting. They were tasteless and drenched in oil. My order of fries looked rather old compared to my friend's but both were equally bland and greasy so I guess I shouldn't be jealous. Now I don't understand what makes their chili famous. Can someone please tell me? The best chili I had was at some ski resort in Wisconsin. It probably came from a can too! So for desert we ended up ordering some ice cream. I shared a hot fudge sundae with a friend. We ordered it to go and the lady put the sundae in a pop cup. It was messy and rather annoying as the hot fudge was separate. The ice cream was pretty good. My friend order a scoop of chocolate ice cream which tasted kinda funky.

20.description: I want to love this place, I really do. But the big guy in the fedora definitely makes it difficult. He's always had something crappy to say to me when I leave. Either the tip I leave (for the teenage waitresses mind you--not him) isn't big enough (20%) or if I tell the cashier to keep the change, he's gotta yell out something smart-assed like, "if you're handing out change, I know a guy by the freeway blah blah blah". The past 3 times I've been in there he's made a point to smart off AS I'M WALKING OUT and never to my face. No no--I get it. You don't want my money. That's fine. Your food gives me heartburn and the tables are always sticky and covered in crumbs, anyway.

14.description: This place is awesome, I grew up coming to Lindys for ice cream with my parents. The one thing that disappoints me is this waitress who is super rude. Besides her the food is great,  definitely try the Chocolate ice cream!! Chocolate cows are life lol (root beer and chocolate ice cream)

1.description: I was a little worried as I was walking into the door.  The aisles were narrow and crowded.  The entire store smelled a bit more musty than other Unique Thrift store locations I've visited.  However, my worries soon disappeared when I realized that they had some good stuff to be had.  As always, when Rosa J. happens to have a Monday off, she hits one of the Unique Thrift stores because of their half-off Monday sale.  Merchandize will be half of the price tag.  Since Unique sets their prices on a higher side in comparison to the Village Discount Outlet, participating in the half-off Monday is going to be a great help for a thrift store lover like myself.  They had an awesome selections on women's two-piece suits and blazers.  For the most part, the apparel was in great condition.  Nevertheless, you do want to check for missing buttons.  I typically forgo on anything with missing buttons because it won't be worth of my time to fix the buttons at the price I paid for.  In other words, you need to be as critical as you are when it come to thrift shopping.  I scored a Kohl's brand (Croft & Barrow) sweater for work ($2.00) and a designer brand (Benetton) wool blazer for ($3.50).  From my perspective, you have be super desperate to purchase shoes at a thrift store.  Shoes at thrift stores are usually very worn-out, unless you're looking for shoes that you know you will wear for only once or twice.  This location seems to get lots of visits from moms and young children.  With that being said, the peak times for this location may be early afternoons when the grade school kids are let out.  I did hit the peak times when I was shopping there.  Therefore, expect the wait at the cash registers.  I will see me at another Unique on a random Monday.  This location is great because the CTA 35th./Archer orange line station is literally 30 seconds away.

9.description: This parking lot is horrendous. Like a bunch of craters and you gotta dodge it from sinking in. Place smells, but surprised they had the a/c on.....thank god! Place is usually a mess.If you are willing to search, you can find some decent deals.

23.description: Wow!!! Before I found Unique, I thought all thrift stores were full of schwap that had urine residues and God knows what else on it. Unique has made me a Thrift Store Convert, and here I am, proselytizing like a good acolyte: Shop at thrift stores!I've found $4 Gap jeans, new. I've found Abercrombie & Fitch sweaters, $2. I've found converse sneakers, new, $5.Not that I shop at the Gap, A&F or wear lotsa chucks (sweatshops, goddammit!). But  I don't think the no sweatshop rule applies to thrift stores, because you're not increasing the demand for the clothes, just using up stuff that would otherwise get thrown out. Of course you must not expect the clientele at thrift stores to resemble those at the Gap. People here are pretty rude and pushy (come to think of it, things aren't that different at the Gap). You'll be standing in an aisle browsing through the denim and an entire family will barge right up to you and demand passage. It's a blast. But that's not Unique's fault, c'mon.What I find really funny is that Unique is a CHAIN. How does that happen, a chain of thrift stores?Another hilarious concept is 1/2 Off day. You know you're hard up when you wait to shop until 1/2 Off day at a thrift store.

5.description: The store manager from this store named Isabel needs to get fired from corporate she is always yelling at her employees and prices the items herself way to high. Beware of that manager she has a attitude and is always going to her beat up silver Mercedes to smoke or do drugs.

25.description: smells like pee...but, then again, every Unique I've been in smells like pee...

12.description: THis is the 3rd Unique Thrift Store I've been to, in the last week (as you can see by my reviews). I'm newer to Chicago, and the Unique Thrift Stores in Mpls were awesome, thrifty places to peruse around in, so I was very excited to see what Chicago has. Parking was available and lots of it (we went on a Sunday at 530pm), though bumpy and had potholes. Smaller store. Clothes again not organized by size, but rather by color (this ticks me off to no end, it's what's important to me). Furniture was clustered in 1 back corner, the 2 aisles were full of 'stuff'', I walked back there, but there wasn't enough room for the person behind me to pass me, so we had to back out, in order for him to pass.  I was seeking curtains. I thought they were too pricey. 2 panels of 70's Curtains for $16.99. I did buy them, because I had a $10 off of $25 coupon. As we were walking out, we saw 1 panel of tweed, never used, curtains from Target-for $18.99. Hello?! This is a thrift store.. Prices should not be this high. I realize I could go on Monday to get them 1/2 off,  but I consider this 'not a deal.'  They took my credit card, so that must have changed since the last reveiwer. I'll still come here. just thought I'd share my opinion.  :)

21.description: I write this review as a donator, not a purchaser.This thrift store needs a lesson in how to take in their donations. They rarely empty their donation boxes, so you have to either cram or leave stuff on the outside (what's the point if things get dirty? Might as well have thrown then in the garbage)When I have gone in to give my donations to an employee, it's taken me over 15 minutes to get a tax receipt, if I get one at all. They never help you bring it in, and act annoyed that they have to deal with you at all.FYI, Unique- my whole last house is hanging on your walls for sale. you could at least be courteous when I donate stuff. Go to Salvation Army to donate, where the employees help, offer receipts, and are courteous.

16.description: For a thrift store, way too expensive and things look way to worn. Store also looks very run down and from outside store doesn't even look open but it is. Don't trip in parking lot that is falling apart too.Not worth the time to visit this one. The only thing good if you really want to go is that it is steps fromthe CTA orange line 35th and Archer stop.

17.description: I've been going to this particular unique regularly for a number of years.  Unlike some others who have reviewed, I don't think it smells like pee, I am not amused that unique is a chain (um, haven't you heard of salvation army, goodwill or village?) and I certainly do not think that half-off day is something to be trifled with.  As a result, I was horrified when half-off days were eliminated a few months ago.  How could this be?   I was sure that this was the ultimate sign that capitalism had failed chicago and we were all on our way to hell in the proverbial handbasket.  Thankfully, half-off Monday is reinstated until the holiday season ends.  So why two stars?  This Unique is increasingly picked over.  Looking for men's pants with a waist between 29-44 is becoming a more dire situation with every passing day.  Vintage stores, while conveniant, are killing our opportunities to buy decent clothes for less than $3-4!  That said, I'm not a hypocrite...you might catch me at buffalo or kneedeep, but damn... I'm sure that the morbidly obese are not the only people still donating. Small bric-a-brac selection and a newly gutted men's shoe section as well.  I once bought a 70s 'gazelle' track bike with a flipflop hub here for $7.... I never again expect such a find at this location.

10.description: Quite Unique! lolI love this Unique! The location really isn't too sketchy at all (I always come here at night from the orange line at like 8 at night) so don't be afraid of getting mugged or something. Last year was my first year being in Chicago (from Las Vegas) so i decided that I definitely needed a ton of sweaters and jackets without paying too much. Always go on a Monday for their 50% off deals, which are awesome! Another great thing is that at this Unique and this Unique only (including all thrift stores I have been to) have I been able to find Designer clothing for CHEAP plus all their sweaters were awesome!1. YSL button up = $62. United Colors of Benetton Cardigan = $33. Random Poupon Sweater = $1.504. Multitude of Coogi style sweaters = $2-$5

11.description: I don't go out of my way to go to this location. They have lots of stuff packed in here but most of it is pure JUNK and overpriced.   I have been thrifting over 30 years and this location has always sucked.

26.description: This is a great Unique which I'd forgotten about for a while.  Its really close to my apartment, as in, in theory I could walk should I ever want to get that close to I-55 on foot.  I don't.  The parking lot is not a pit of death and they usually get you through the checkout pretty fast, unless you're behind the guy with two carts full of books that was there last night.  At 15 min to closing the checkout girls wanted to kick his ass.  Good selection and pretty well organized.  It's a lot bigger than the one on Halsted but it closes an hour earlier.  Good place for $1 sunglasses.

27.description: Second best Unique in the Bridgeport, McKinley Park, Brighton Park area. Getting more expensive, but sometimes there's great stuff.

0.description: This thrift store looks sketchy on the outside, but inside is amazing! It got a facelift and organization and now is fabulous. The inside is white and bright with lots of mirrors. I might dare say it's the most well organized thrift store I've been in in a while. The toys are all grouped into little bags by type. Need 3 Power Rangers, there you go. Even the books are organized by type. They have % off based on tag colors and offer coupons. Oh and did I mention they have an amazing section of Halloween goodies? Like brand new Halloween costumes, props, makeup, accessories, and home decor. Get thee to Unique Thrift.

20.description: Don't believe the lies, this parking lot IS the pit of death, the seventh circle of hell, the epitome of frustration, the bane of a driver's existence, etc.BUT, the store itself is amazing. If you don't mind squeezing through the narrow aisles (and righteously giving a stare-down to any lane-blockers), you might find some real gems for cheap. This is another great location for thrift-enthusiasts.

19.description: Wow!!! Before I found Unique, I thought all thrift stores were full of schwap that had urine residues and God knows what else on it. Unique has made me a Thrift Store Convert, and here I am, proselytizing like a good acolyte: Shop at thrift stores!I've found $4 Gap jeans, new. I've found Abercrombie & Fitch sweaters, $2. I've found converse sneakers, new, $5.Not that I shop at the Gap, A&F or wear lotsa chucks (sweatshops, goddammit!). But  I don't think the no sweatshop rule applies to thrift stores, because you're not increasing the demand for the clothes, just using up stuff that would otherwise get thrown out. Of course you must not expect the clientele at thrift stores to resemble those at the Gap. People here are pretty rude and pushy (come to think of it, things aren't that different at the Gap). You'll be standing in an aisle browsing through the denim and an entire family will barge right up to you and demand passage. It's a blast. But that's not Unique's fault, c'mon.What I find really funny is that Unique is a CHAIN. How does that happen, a chain of thrift stores?Another hilarious concept is 1/2 Off day. You know you're hard up when you wait to shop until 1/2 Off day at a thrift store.

2.description: Prices are laughably outrageous.  Want to pay $29.99 for a used, no name jacket with stains and a broken zipper?  How about $49.99 for a PS2?  If so, this is your spot.  Not many deals to be had here.

18.description: Don't believe the lies, this parking lot IS the pit of death, the seventh circle of hell, the epitome of frustration, the bane of a driver's existence, etc.BUT, the store itself is amazing. If you don't mind squeezing through the narrow aisles (and righteously giving a stare-down to any lane-blockers), you might find some real gems for cheap. This is another great location for thrift-enthusiasts.

13.description: Parking is a b*tch, I suggest going later in the day when the rest of the businesses in the strip mall are not so busy. I've been lucky and found parking in the lot whenever I come though.  This location is decently clean, but I think the poor lighting makes it seem dirtier than it is.I can almost always find something here. The clothing selection here is kind of dated, or very hoochy, but if you are patient you can definitely find a treasure or two.  My bf always finds a game or two here. Book selection is pretty good.  The staff is friendly.  Be careful of random crazy people that come in and start trouble!  Housewares are scattered throughout and you can usually find a good piece or two.Check which tag colors are 25 or 50% off!  As with all Unique stores, everything is 50% off on Mondays (excluding shoes and jewelry I think).  Check their website or go to the store for more specials, usually around a holiday weekend, everything will be 50% off that Saturday and Sunday.  We went on a weekend AFTER a holiday sale, and it was totally not worth it, everything had been picked over and while there was still alot of stuff, it wasn't quality items. So far I've been to 3 Unique stores, and all have been pretty great in terms of selection of clothing, games & housewares.  I think the Unique stores are some of the best thrift stores in the city.

4.description: the  unique trift store close to me located  on   4445 N Sheridan Rd..is  one  of  the  best  store in  the  area.....Attention shoppers costomers ..if a lady named Kiana asks you to give her a ride .don,t do it ..you gonna get robbed ...A friend of mine ,he ,s a fan and a shopper . she told him at the store that she will get him some weed . he was robbed by her boy friend..she was doing business the same day she called sick .....be careful ...be careful...be careful ....be careful ..........be careful ....

24.description: This Unique is definitely more crowded and chaotic than the one on Halsted, probably because of its smaller aisles.  It can be an insane madhouse on Monday evenings especially, when families  take advantage of the last moments of half-price day.  So if you're up for braving the crowds, enduring the super-high screaming-child decibel factor, and tripping on toys scattered all over the floor in search of great finds, it might be worth it.  I have found some amazing things at this store, but the best find ever was a gently-used designer handbag (the kind that's hundreds of dollars new) for only $12.99 at the Unique on Elston.  These stores are definitely worth combing.

6.description: Eh, this place is over-priced in my opinion. Not that much selection in clothing, but there are some nice housewife things. I'd say this place is a bust. It's only worth going to when there are those amazing dukes.

22.description: This is the thrift store I pretty much grew up at.  As a teen, like many others I hated that mom shopped at the thrift, then I moved out on my own and realized the benefits.  I have bought dishes, clothes, shoes, rugs, furniture, purses even a brand new spice rack with all new unopened spices!  I have  2 closets worth well over $3000 each & have spent maybe $300 total.  Sure there's a weird odor, but I wash everything before I wear it anyway and have even developed and alchol/fabric softner spray to disinfect the shoes I buy and leave them smelling great.  I*'ve learned its all about the hunt have fun and get shopping!

15.description: I like this store, BUT it is small and crammed full of JUNK...like with any thrift store, you truly have to sift through all of the Wal-Mart and K-Mart clothes to find the designer stuff. At first I was hesitant about going here because usually the best stuff is to be found at the thrift stores in the upper class neighborhoods, but I found a decent amount of gems! I have to remember that people donate stuff all over Chicago and that it could end up in any thrift store...so don't let the location scare you off. I would only come here on 50% off everything days because a lot of stuff is overpriced, but once you take the half off then it's a good deal. I add a star because of the super convenient location to the Orange Line, but I take a star away from the rude staff...I asked if they had a bathroom and the lady looked at me like I was asking her for her first born child. Seriously lady, BUZZ OFF.
