7.description: BEWARE OF THE CUSTOMERS IN THIS STORE!!! I had my wallet plucked straight out of my cart and by the time I realized it the culprit was long gone! Talked to security (who was really nice) and he took all my information down and hoped along with me that it would be found. Well, during that time, the customers were already making gas purchases on my credit cards. I rushed home and called creditors, made a police report, etc. My wallet had $6 in it but these losers seem to know what they are doing, testing my credit cards at every gas station in the area. Staff at the thrift store told me they have been having problems with a thief every Monday (sale day). SO BE ON YOUR TOES. Don't leave your purse/wallet in your cart. Try to keep credit cards/IDs home. Carry cash in your FRONT POCKET. It has been ONE BIG PAIN in the ass and my Identity has been compromised. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

8.description: I like this store, but it's smaller than most and doesn't get the best donations. It's working class stuff, but I did get a 1974 Batman Batlab vehicle last week and a 1962 Barbie too. I paid a lot for them but still less than they are worth. Great clothes selection, not as much shoes as other Unique's. The employees are very nice and actually ask if you want to see things behind the counter! Unlike Village, where you could stand there all day and no one will help you.

3.description: This is usually my first stop when I'm on my Raggin' days of trying to find a deal on a dime.  Not because it's my favorite but because it's closer.  I love Half Price Monday and I have found some great items especially used books in good condition...Now I don't know if it because most people are reading via digital devices or if because they only put out books that pass the test or being worthy of being in the store...I think its the digital devices but I don't care...lol I love reading real books.This store is smaller than some but not the smallest I have seen.  Monday's are always crazy and they open at 6am.  Unique has a new policy of allowing you to exchange but not return clothes within 7 days as long as you have the receipt, tag still attached and is still in the condition that you bought it in.  I love this new policy because there are times you get an item and because you can't really try it on since this location doesn't have a fitting room you may get something that looks like your size but someone altered it and then what just because you paid $2 dollars you should junk it.  This new policy has sealed the deal of me being a customer for life.When I want to go Raggin' this is where I will start...being patient and you may find a gem!Enjoy!!!

14.description: Not any good. Go to the Village and pay half (regular prices) of what they ask and you'll have a better chance of finding retro clothes. They sell old navy and fruit of the loom screen prints shirts and try to charge buffalo or plato prices. They have recently got a new parking lot as the old one was falling apart.

1.description: Worse haircut I have ever had!!!! The last few times I had my haircut at that location, I've asked for low fades cuts but I keep getting high uneven fades. This time I pointed directly at one of the example pictures on the wall and this guy did exactly the opposite. In the middle of the haircut I told him the fade was way too high and looked nothing like the picture. The barber just said "ok" and continued to destroy my hair.  Horrible job of a cut. Where did this guy get his training? This business doesn't even deserve a single star but Yelp won't let me post this until I put at least one star up.

0.description: Great haircut and beard trimming at a fantastic price. Kind and fast service. Will go here again.

3.description: there were dead bugs mixed in the ice of the new pop machine!! nuff said!! would not recommend or return here again!!

1.description: I mean it's Burger King , it's exactly how u picture every fast food restaurant to be but shit what expensive. Chicken fries for three bucks !?!?! Whaaaaaa (jaws drop)

2.description: I am so done going to Burger King restaurants. This is not a gossip. I am going to tell the world. BK 3141 S Ashland Chicago IL 60608, lost a customer. I will start going to McDonalds.  BK has a false advertisement on their web page and commercials. It say 2 for 5.00 mix or match King Collection, the sandwiches should have been the chooses of a Big King, New Mushroom & Swiss Big King, Chicken Big King also includes Original Chicken Sandwich & Big Fish SandwichI went to BK last night through the drive through. They informed me they didn't have that two for five special no more. The website and commercials say different. I had to order two Rodeo Burgers.I called the store, I thought I was mistreated. The phone rang ten times, someone picked up and hung-up. I called corporate they told me that's the deal at certain restaurants only. Your web page or commercial didn't say to only some stores false advertisement.I'm going to go to McDonalds now. They have the Big Macs 2 for 5.00

5.description: I'm a bit surprised that there is no listing for this business (At least none that I could find on here). I don't want to give them a bad review, but exactly how difficult is it to get someone's order right? I can go to the McDonald's in Pilsen and sit through the insanely busy drive thru for 20+ Min while STILL  getting my order correct as requested. This place is not nearly as busy, so what is the problem? First day  I asked for a meal with onion rings and a diet coke. They give me fries and a regular coke and of course I should have checked before leaving the drive thru. A couple days later, I specifically requested "No Lettuce & cheese" on a sandwich. They added the cheese, but the sandwich still had lettuce on it! It has always been a hit or miss with this franchise and it seems to be more 'miss' lately. I know its fast food, but that's no excuse for getting someone's order wrong twice in three days.

0.description: The newly renovated Burger Kings isn't too bad! Right now they have a $4 for 5 deal it comes with bacon cheeseburger, five piece chicken nuggets, fries or onion rings, and a beverage. It's pretty good and they also have $4 for 2 sandwich deal and the long Cheeseburger is killer! I am not usually a fan of Burger kings but their deals are a steal right now if you want to eat cheap and feed the kiddos fast and easy. It's 5 minutes from my house so It's hard not to go for the deals.

4.description: This is a 24 hour BK with reliably excellent service. The wait times in the drive thru are also always short-they are quick! And now they have those super awesome Coca Cola fountain machines in their dine in area where you can create interesting beverages like peach Sprite or raspberry ginger ale. The dining area doesn't have any available outlets, but it does have free wifi and interesting people watching, if you are into that sort of thing. Overall? Best BK I know of in this part of the city.

0.description: What a nice place, this United Global Traders.  They have a lot of average looking, well made, used office furniture at affordable prices.  In a quick walk around I spied file cabinets, desks, tons of different kinds of chairs, cubicles, computers, etc...  Me? I went in for a dry erase white board, and got a better quality one than I could have found at a major office chain supplier compound, of course, for a fraction of the price.They also seem to fix/recycle computers too.

12.description: Great professional service ! Soft delicate threader who was quick and efficient. I will definitely continue to go.

3.description: Quick, thorough, clean, smells nice! They do more than threading - wax, facials, scalp massage, even henna tattoos. If you bring in their flyer, you get 20% off! And they have a buy 10 get one free loyalty card. Nice!

1.description: Love the discounts on Yelp! I used to go to Deeba's on Devon but was too lazy to drive all the way out there. I was hesitant to try this new place as I know the prices would be higher and skeptical about the work.. The girl was very nice and knew what she was talking about and how I wanted my eyebrows without telling her. Glad I found a place close to home and that we get a free eyebrow threading after the 10th visit! Yay!!

2.description: I love this place because my brows do turn out pretty well everytime and this is now the only eyebrow place I go to. I recommend asking for an eyebrow massage because it's worth it :)

9.description: On a Saturday afternoon while I was out shopping, I noticed this place and said to myself  why not try them out since eyebrow threading was on my list of things to do anyway that day. I walked in and was serviced right away. I requested an eyebrow and upper lip threading. She got through the eyebrows threading just fine, my brows are beautiful, when it came time to do my upper lip the area was so sensitive I could not bare the pain. She politely stopped and I paid her for the services anyway. Customer service was spot on and I will definitely be back.

10.description: I was thrown off by the name I thought it was going to be super ghetto, but they are actually really good!!! The only person I ever see there is Lucky.  She is really good and very nice. I will definitely be coming back!

4.description: First time going, and I'm not please. I grew out my eyebrows for months because they were messed up. So I decided to try this new place, and I am so not happy with my eyebrows.They don't even look the same at all. One eyebrow is crazy thin and the other one is thick and nice. Disappointed with my eyebrows because now I have to let them grow out again!

6.description: I told the lady not to change anything. Just a clean up of the excess hair. She made them thinner then I have ever had them. I was not happy. Now I'm letting them grow out.

0.description: Noticed this place a couple of months ago across from the 35th/Archer orange line as I was walking from my house to catch the L.. made a mental note to try them out, as I always thread my brows and upper lip (never liked the idea of waxing them).. tried them out yesterday for the 1st time and I am SUPER excited to find an excellent threading salon so close to home.. when I first moved to Chicago in 2007 I used to go all the way to Albany Park or Devon to get my eye brows threaded, so finding a place that is basically less than a 5 minute walk made me extremely happy..walked in and was politely greeted by the young lady working there (Seema if I remember correctly).. loved how clean and neat the place was from the inside.. very nicely decorated, bright and welcoming..I told her I just needed to clean up my eyebrows without changing the shape... I had originally planned to just get my brows done, but when I saw how great they looked and felt (she was very gentle and thorough, plus I got an eyebrow massage!) I went ahead and asked for my upper lip and chin to be threaded as well... I looked amazing and also felt relaxed! When I was done, I spoke to Lucky who was behind the counter.. so nice and helpful! she told me about the Facebook giveaways they have every once in a while as well as the $2 off you get for checking in here on Yelp.. I read earlier today that they give student discounts too which is awesome! I also asked about the henna tattoos which I will be getting done next time I visit.. they are very reasonably priced..All in all deffinitely a five star experience, hence the five star review... Loved iBrowz threading!!

5.description: Saw this place coming, didn't think much of about it, I said oh well 'another eye Brow place', but NOW THIS IS MY EYEBROW PLACE, very clean and pleasant non pushy aestician..   Love this place..

13.description: Amazing. Therapeutic. Definitely recommended. The staff were friendly and made me wish I lived closer.

11.description: I went for the first time yesterday and loved it. It's an adorable place and very clean. When I walked in someone immediately came out to greet and service me. She was very polite and she did a good quick job. She left my eyebrows better than I expected, and I will be going back therefrom now on. :)

8.description: I went with my sister and we both had our eyebrows threaded. The woman who did our brows was kind and even gave us a eyebrow massage afterwards so that was nice! There was a wait but we didn't mind because what was screening on the tv was interesting. She also gave us a student discount. Will definitely be returning :)

14.description: Hidden gem on the south side of Chicago. Walked in last Thursday and within minutes my brows were groomed into shape and was given an eyebrow massage. It's been 6 days and still no irritation around my brows! Will be returning :)

7.description: Excellent! My eyebrows and forehead look great. She also massaged my eyebrow at the end. If you check in on yelp, there is a discount.

1.description: I have tried this DD 3 times now because it's on my commute to work in the mornings. I was disappointed, frustrated, and/or grossed out each time.Try #1: I ask for a bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese and an orange juice. The girl asks if I want a drink. I say I want an orange juice. She is out of orange juice. I say Diet Pepsi. She gives me a Pepsi. I ask her for a Diet, and she exchanges it. She asks me something about my bagel, but I don't understand her, so I just nod. I wait 5 minutes, get my bag and get on my bus. I open the bag, and it's a plain bagel, cut and toasted with cream cheese on the side. Try #2: I ask for a breakfast croissant and an orange juice. They are out of croissants and orange juice. Would an English muffin be okay? Sure...and a Diet Pepsi.Try #3: I ask for a breakfast croissant and an orange juice. They have both! But the sausage is burnt and there a big piece of fuzz in the wrapper when I get to the end of my sandwich. Ew. There will not be a try #4. Dumb staff, always out of items, and bad food.

0.description: when it comes to the food industry I generally believe in giving people second chances, I even make excuses for any mistakes because I know it's a hard gig, but this time, there was NO excuse.  First time, I chalked it up to being the location being very busy and because it was cold and they are not completely shielded from it OR maybe she didn't hear me say CREAM ONLY.  Shame on me for assuming she got it right and not tasting it first - boy was I disappointed when I got home and tasted the super-sweet coffee that had to be thrown out.  The next time, (same girl) was gossiping on the telephone non-stop - there was only one person ahead of me, weather was not too cold (by Chicago standards) and only one person behind me.  I ordered my coffee - CREAM ONLY.  she left, still on the phone, I paid and asked her - IS THIS COFFEE MADE WITH CREAM ONLY?  NO SUGAR?  she took a break from her phone conversation to say "Yes" - I got my change and left....you can guess the end of this story...I get home only to find THE FRIGGIN' COFFEE HAD SUGAR!!!  Shame on me... I will never again purchase coffee from this place ... there are way too many Dunkin' Donuts locations in this City for me to deal with this type of bad service.   The girl, while she seems nice enough, really needs to pay more attention to her customers.

1.description: Not sure when this store popped up, but it's your average Dollar Tree with goodies galore to explore. This one is a touch on the small side, but does have private parking lot. Great things to get here? Seasonal decor, cards (2 for $1), kitchen goodies (like ziploc) and more. This one has a small frozen food section as well.

2.description: I love shopping at the Dollar Tree!  There's always something interesting to pick up that I've never seen before or am really interested to try, or is just something useful that I didn't even know I needed until I saw it on the shelf!I have been here a few times, including Opening Day, and the best part about this location is that it hasn't gone to heck yet like many of the older locations.  It's still looking new and clean - the products are well-organized, and the staff care about their customers.Believe me, I've been to many a discount store (including some Dollar Tree locations - like the one that closed on Ashland) where everything was in disarray and the aisles were cramped and it was hard to find what you were looking for.This location has some nice wide aisles so two people with a little shopping cart can actually fit and pass each other, and they have a nice little fridge/freezer section in the back with some interesting products and brands to choose from.The best thing about shopping there - if you're ever wary about a product's usefulness or longevity or quality - IT'S ONLY A DOLLAR!

0.description: Stopped in to get some stocking stuffers and was in and out in about 20 minutes despite the after-work rush. This was my first trip since the expansion from their old location down the street. I'm pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and overall organization of the store.

1.description: I haven't ordered here since two years ago and today I decided to order for a delivery. It took about a half hour, which is pretty quick, the only down side was the food was just warm by the time it arrived to my house, as well as the horchata, the ice just melted into my drink but pretty understandable due to the hot weather. I have spent four years experiences with Mexican food during my high school years, I'd say their tortas are definitely not the best in town. The buns were harder than I thought and when you bite into it, the raw onion reminds me of the taste of a maxwell cheeseburger. I also ordered the cheddar fries. Again, not impressive. Fries texture wasn't great to start off with, it was rather soft than crispy fried, or anything close to that.Overall, their food seems to be downgraded compared to the last time I ate there. But their delivery deal is pretty decent and affordable for an one-person meal.

9.description: Was new to the neighborhood and found them on Grubhub and it was an awesome find... great food, great price and a variety... they are reasonably prices and give you a great portion!!  We order from them all the time.. the staff is friendly but I think I'm always talking to the owner or manager.. the burrito's are huge and the steak nacho's are great.. they always make my food to my specifications and i'm always happy.. I give them 4 stars because occasionally they forget to add something to my food that I request but it's rare and they always fix it for you right away.. I highly recommend this place..

12.description: I decided to eat here as I had seen it from the street and it looked kind of crazy.  Ordered the fish taco special and veggie nachos, as I don't eat meat, and you shouldn't either....the way they treat those poor animals, shameful.   A review I read complained about the wait time and I thought, "what a jerk, complaining about the wait!"  Well, I have to tell you I waited a heck of a long time for that order...so long that I hauled ass out of there, irritated, and think I got a red light ticket...is there one of those camera's at Ashland and Archer??  The fish tacos were excellent and the fries as good as described in other reviews...very good, probably the best fish tacos I have ever eaten, and cheap too.  The veggie nachos were a drag.  Mostly because they use (as described in the menu to be fair) "nacho cheese".  That gross cheddar stuff that you get in movie theatre nachos that only children eat.  I had to throw them out...not good.  I would give them four stars for the fish tacos and 2 stars for the nachos...averaging it out to 3 stars.  If you're in the neighborhood try Patio next door...unbelievable gyros...too bad I don't eat meat anymore.

21.description: the food is pretty good. i enjoy myself everytime i go there. its not as busy as i thought it would be but the atmosphere is great. u should check it out sometime

16.description: I ordered a -big tasty cheeseburger-double bacon cheeseburger-2 fish tacos-cheese fries-2 hot dogs-chicken tacoFirst off I will speak on the ordering service, you have to order on the phone and the man on the phone was very polite and nice also they take credit/debit over the phone for delivery. the food came in about 45min which wasn't too bad and the delivery guy was nice. I tasted the fish taco first as this was my first time ever having a fish taco and the thought of it sounded crazy... IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! I would definitely order that again and again the fish taco was on corn tortilla bread, mayo, onions, lettuce and tomatoes! please try the fish tacos!!! now the burgers are big on sesame seed buns they are ok as they are a lil too dry for taste so lot of ketchup, the bacon was big and delicious on the burger, the chicken tacos was good but the hot dogs are NOT beef hot dogs so it saddens me that they call these hot dogs chicagoan when they are not beef hot dogs- shame on them!!! It's like the hot dogs came from aldi's or something- I will never order hot dogs from here again till they beef it up. the cheese fries were ok the melted cheese was kinda watery but tolerable. overall I will order from here again but probably order something different.

17.description: you really want to sell me a cheese-less taco?They seem to have new ownership everytime you go there..until recently, and now there menu includes EVERYTHING. its impressive, and not that bad. I had to feed an entire summercamp of kids for a sleepover with a cheap and inexpensive menu featuring everything, and everyone liked what they got, from the hamburgers, to tacos, to the philli steak i had.

10.description: This place is so great, I seriously can't even tell you have much I love this place. why?1) GREAT food. i love the tacos (steak is my favorite) and the burgers2) it's a great neighborhood place with a nice owner3) inexpensive!! mostly everything on the menu is below 10 dollars.great food for a great price? what else could you seriously ask for i honestly don't know what these people are complaining about. my dad took me here and i hoping to bring my kids here someday.

5.description: Ordered a pick up order online.Steak Nachos - These were ok, but started to get soggy quick, but that's a given. Also, the steak didn't seem to be of good quality.Wings - I asked for hot wings, but the guy put hot and bbq separate since he said he didn't know what I would like. I'm glad they did because the bbq sauce was good. The hot sauce was too vinager-y. The fries were soggy and nothing great. Came with a garlic bread and cole slaw. Not bad and the prices are decent. Maybe give the burgers or tacos a try next time.

11.description: This is one of my favorites. My husband and I order from here all the time and love it. They're really tasty and extremely affordable. I love their double bacon cheeseburgers, I always get added swiss and mushroom, which is AMAZING. They're also pretty good time wise, and if they mess up? The apologize and fix their mistake and also give credit to your account. Really good place.

3.description: Ordered fish tacos, all I can say is where the fish?Also ordered  hot dog, it is okay, just like any take out joint.

0.description: Great food and really good prices. Tried the steak tacos and gyros with fries... never disappoints.

20.description: This place has been open for about 15 years now but has gone through many ownership changes. Each time they change of course the menu and service does too.Right now its a mix of American, Mexican and a little Greek food. Like I said it has changed owners many times.The best deal is the "Big Taster" which is a larger burger w/ everything and BBQ sauce. They usually send out a bunch of coupons for it for $3.59 w/fries.

19.description: This place has been open for about 15 years now but has gone through many ownership changes. Each time they change of course the menu and service does too.Right now its a mix of American, Mexican and a little Greek food. Like I said it has changed owners many times.The best deal is the "Big Taster" which is a larger burger w/ everything and BBQ sauce. They usually send out a bunch of coupons for it for $3.59 w/fries.

2.description: My go to spot for fish tacos, also like the other tacos-steak, chicken and al pastor. They have good burgers and sandwiches. I had the Chicken Parmesan, not bad for burger joint. They are more authentic with Mexican food, than anything.

18.description: The place is a greasy spoon and that's what you should expect.  You get a lot for your money but it isn't exceptional food.  It's not a dive with fantastic food, it's a dive with okay food.  Had the gyro special that comes with fries and pop as well as the half pound hamburger that came with bacon and the works.  It was a generous amount of food all for $11..  Fries were a bit too salty.  I would go there if I need to get something quick.  Next time, I'm going to try their asada taco since it was voted best taco on Grub something.

13.description: In the Battle of the Burgers, this little hole-in-the-wall joint pretty much beat out the rest.They drew me in with their "recession" special of 99-cent tacos.  Of course, once I stepped inside, I found out that one taco was $1.39 and buying two or more tacos brought them all down to the 99-cent deal.  So I grabbed for the take-out menu because after all, there was a burger battle going on and another competitor would make things interesting.  And that's when I saw it:A coupon for a "Big Taster with Fries - $4.59"I flipped through the paper menu, perused the overhead menu and signage and there was no "Big Taster" listed anywhere.  So I inquired of the cashier and he said it was one of their half-pound burgers with cheese, bacon and BBQ sauce!  And it comes with fries all for $4.59?  SOLD!I even threw in one of those steak tacos just to try it out.The taco - meh.  It has no cheese on it, it had tomato on it, but there was no hint of cilantro and the meat was decent and I could see myself getting a few of them at 99-cents each if I had a craving.Then I tried the fries - on a scale of 1 to 10, I'd say they were at least a 6 or 7.  Nicely salted, nicely fried without being soggy, but not very dry which happens a lot with frozen fries.And then that "Big Taster" got unwrapped.  They use one large flat 1/2-pound meat patty (so the sesame-seed bun it comes on is huge) and it had a good amount of BBQ sauce for flavor and bacon that actually had a bit of crispiness to it on the edges.  This was the winning burger, in both price and taste when I was looking for something at least 1/2 pound with bacon and cheese.  And bonus - BBQ sauce!Without that coupon, though, it would have been a sadder story - but still with a tasty burger at the end of it.  I love that their menu is so expansive, though I fear that makes them more of a jack-of-all-trades and master of none.  Perhaps another visit when I have a gyro competition will prove me wrong.  And I'm itching to try out their discounted steak nachos they've got advertised in their window.They also get bonus points for having the TV tuned to Food Network.  and they have two arcade games, though it boggles my mind to charge $1 per game of Pac-Man / Galaga and 25-cents for some dumb Bowling game.(The only thing keeping them from an initial 5-star review is that I found a big ol' slice of tomato on my burger.  When I say "no tomato", I MEAN IT!)

4.description: ive tried..steak nachos- i enjoy their steak nachos.. i ordered it a few times.. its a hit or miss tho.. sometimes the chips taste stale and sometimes not..polish hot dog- skip this.. it tasted like it was microwaved....big taster- it taste like your average burger just a little bigger..rib tips- the meat was chewy and the bbq sauce doesnt taste like bbq..

6.description: Unbelievably bad. I've only tried it once, for a lunch special, and this was when I was working construction, extra hungry. Both my helper and I threw our lunches out after just a few bites.The egg rolls that came with the $6.00 lunch were OK, and of course the RC was drinkable, but I've never had Chinese so inedible. I threw away the Mongolian Beef and I think my helper threw out Kung Pao Chicken.Abso-frikking-lutely the worst. Ever.I would suggest BYOB if you're actually going to try to eat here, because you'll need to be drunk to choke this crap.

15.description: Why did this resturant go from 5 stars to 3 stars to well 1 star, it comes down to one factor. The food has become bland, and yet its still the same owners. Prices have gone up, and during the process of prices going up the taste of food has fell way of the scale. With a city like Chicago that has many other options go elsewhere.

7.description: The burger is shit. I don't appreciate a frozen patty slapped on stale bread slathered in watery mayo. Nor when I ask for cheddar cheese on the burger do I expect nacho cheese sauce. What the fuck is that? On the cheddar fries, I guess it is a 50/50 of real shredded cheddar cheese but on a burger it should be law to specify that it's cheddar sauce product. Waste of my money. Thanks for the life lesson.

8.description: I'm definitely a huge stickler for time that it takes for delivery.    I don't care if there is mass flooding!  We all know you're warming up pre-cooked food... It should take you 5 minutes to cook my food and 5 minutes to drive it the 2 miles to my house... This is Chicago, so I guess I can stand 30 minutes for delivery with traffic and all, but not only did you tell me it would take up to an hour, (no place like this should take an hour, ever!!) it took 1 HOUR AND 30 MINUTES!  Are you kidding me?  Beyond that, food was good, price was meh... horchata was god-like...

14.description: My last experience was sooooo yummy. This time I elected to have 2 steak and one pork taco. I couldn't remember if I liked the steak or chicken better. Having just read my previous review, evidently I was a chicken fan. I have since switched. Pork (al pastor) was amazing and the steak was fantastic too! I love my tacos with onion and cilantro and they do it well. Again, I loved the corn tortillas, despite usually loving flour. RICE AND BEANS are my favorite! Portions are big! I love that the rice has veggies in it. Yummy red salsa too.

58.description: Huy huy huyVer y good shrimp cocktail Just weekends you would need to wait a while for a table

56.description: If I could give them a a zero I would not order trough grubhub. I placed an order for over $60 dollars (over price much). Grub hub confirmed the order, the restaurant confirmed order, they just chose not to send it out!? I spoke with a representative called Tasha (typical idiot) who was just as ignorant as La Palapa people. If you made a mistake you should be held accountable for that mistake not blame the CUSTOMER. La Palapa & Grubhub deserve each other, they will never see another dime from me again. I work in the ninth district by the way. I also deleted grubhub, you don't treat customers that way.

29.description: I wish this place was as good as it was a few years ago. They have grown too fast I guess. Their rice was mushy and the service was horribly slow. It too 30 minutes for an appetizer and over 20 minutes for a bottled water. Asked for my check 10 minutes ago... We shall see.

42.description: First went to this place when it first opened it was just ok my husband liked there langostinos..tried it recently and it was horrible very over priced and the waitress seemed to have an attitude didn't come around after we were served..let me just put it this way i went straight to the bathroom after leaving this place NASTY!!!!

23.description: My family and I went to this place to take advantage of the BYOB and enjoy some delicious seafood,  we were a party of 25 so we were patient when it came to the service not being prompt, however the food was just ok.  I had the Premium Oysters and they were not fresh.  I personally love good fresh seafood but these Oysters weren't good.  We were asked to leave after having paid $1,000 tab and as soon as I made it home the I couldn't leave the bathroom.  Its been 3 days now and my stomach isn't 100%.  Few other family members got sick as well.  Maybe we tried it on a bad day... unfortunately I will never go back.

47.description: I'm still sitting here...it's raining. They decide to sit us in the tented area right next to the door that leads out to the bathroom. There are numerous kids going in and out of the rain and not closing the door so my gf is now completely wet. We complained and nothing happened, the parents are drunk and treating this place like McDonald's play place. There was someone walking around trying to sell us flowers. There is a mariachi band playing for money and it's so annoying. Completely inappropriate for a restraunt. They even over charged a few dollars on an item. No big deal but seriously? They even had a couple that were completely drunk and were causing a scene...nothing was done about it. Also, it's byob, which I liked until the receipt arrived and you find out you were charged $3 per person. A heads up on that would have lessened the blow from the whole visit..I would have drank regardless. Our food was good, that's it.

8.description: This place is one of my favorites.. Not entirely for the food but also the ambience. It's byob and apparently that stands for beer or bottles as in liquor bottles.My go to dish is the camarones a la palapa with a side of avocado. If you like spice and shrimp that's your ticket. The dish is big enough to share with another person. Micheladas are so yummy. Not everyone knows how to make the mix but again byob. They provide an ice bucket to keep your drinks cold. It's a good place to people watch .. I mean if your into that sort of thing .. Once the music starts playing by different musicians that play for a price , you'll see some people drinking more. Enough said about that .. Really good food , just make sure you don't get an outside table when it's scorching hot out. It won't be much fun.

31.description: been wanting to try this place for years!!this place is small inside with a outdoor patio.. small parking lot.. ok service..i went with a couple of friends that has ate here before.. they had suggested a few dishes that sounds delicious.. i ended up with the Mattress Breaker..its a mixture of seafood on top of rice.. from what i can see.. there was shrimp, squid, and fake crab meat..the dish was pretty dam good.. lots of flavor and it has a kick to it..  the food tasted fresh and the portion size is decent..would definitely come back and try their other food!

34.description: Great seafood spot they have an outdoor area with palm trees it makes you feel like if you are on a mini vacation..Friendly and attentive and you get a free small plate of ceviche as an appetizerYou can Byob since they dont serve liquor. They sell you a michaleda mix that you can add to your beer.. Try their pinapple juice its amazingFor food i had their shrimp empanadas..seasoned well crunchy and moist..eat it with chipotle mayo..For entree i had a mojarra a la diabla served with cajun fries, rice, and a salad..the diabla sauce is hot but manageable for you to eat unlike other places where you cant even enjoy the meal. And its not watered down (major brownie points)Like coming here a lot food has never disappointed me and for seafood its cheaper than other places

16.description: Wasn't too impressed. We decided to come try it out and we opted for the mattress breaker since I've heard quite a bit about it. I definitely felt the dish was buttery and had a kick too it. My guy didn't care for the dish. We didn't even finish the dish.I felt it was quite pricey since it cost us $30 (tax + tip included) for just that one dish. I know it's seafood, but the dish wasn't that big. Also, didn't care for the waitress just lingering around when we were paying.

13.description: Some of the best seafood I've had in Chicago. We had crab, shrimp, and seafood paella and it was all really good.  The picnic table seating works, even in the winter time the enclosed patio area is warm and festive.  I live in the area and get tacos and burritos delivered sometimes too. Always delicious, highly recommended.

11.description: Ambience is awesome, outside under palapa umbrellas, beautiful sun, music playing.   Ceviche was a 7 served as an appetizer, camarones sarandeados a 7, langostinos get a 6 out of 10.  They "ok" but the ones from El Cangrejo are way better and more delicious. That was the over all consensus of the there of us.

39.description: First time experience was a great experience. I came here on Mother's Day and boy was it packed ! The staff handles everything so professionally. The wait was really long but well worth it. I ordered the Langostinos and Mixed Seafood platter and I was one happy gal. Only thing I didn't like was the amount ceviche served as appetizer. There's was 4 of us and the serving was enough for one person. Add an extra scoop of ceviche please and thank you !

37.description: Great ambiance (palapas, live music, fake palm trees) etc, and liked the fact that was byob, but the seafood, not so good. My wife (who is born and raised en el puerto jarocho-Veracruz mex) and i ordered shrimp cocktails (simple enough) both were very very bland (tasted more like water-we had to add ketsup and hot sauce to give it some flavor) and had only a few very tiny camarones.   So if you like byob and ambiance this is the place for you but if u want good authentic mexican seafood, not so much.

0.description: We went here the day after Check Please aired their restaurant and we will definitely be back.The place couldn't get any more casual.  It's kind of divey but clean with foam plates and paper napkins, but it doesn't matter.  It's actually part of the atmosphere and experience.  It's a very laid back, yet busy, BYOB with honest food at a great price.  Because of the price some of the ingredients are on the low end but at least they're honest on the menu that there is imitation crab in a dish.  The menu is HUGE, make sure you flip it over because it goes on forever.Each table is given a complimentary starter of tortillas with ceviche.  I'm not a huge fan of ceviche in the first place.  I find the lime overpowering but that's the point I guess.  It was good and my Wife loved it.  If you like ceviche I think you will like there's.First we started with the Empanada's.  I was expecting a thin crispy deep fried empanada but this was much different.  The shell was thick masa and softer more like a tamale. The stuffing was good but could've used more sea food.  I wouldn't order it again, but I'm just a gringo so I'm sure these are authentic.  They were still good just not what I was expecting.The next thing we had was the sauteed Calamari.  This was absolutely delicious.  The calamari was not rubbery or mushy but perfectly "toothy" or al dente.  I think they used jarred garlic, which I typically don't like, but it worked in this dish just fine.  It was muy picante though.  I like spicy food but this was a little too much.  Next time I will order milder.The Mussels came next.  I still have dreams about these.  They seem like they're pan fried which I've never had and the sauce is a rich browned butter.  These were the best I've ever had and next time I'm getting 3 orders.  Delicious!My wife and I at this point were getting pretty full and since the portions were huge we split the Filete Relleno entree and it was to die for!  The tilapia was a little "muddy" since it's farm raised which is typical of any tilapia around here but was easily overlooked with all the stuffing.  The Octopus was cooked perfectly too.  Next time I will order a Pulpo dish separately to enjoy more of their octopus.As stuffed as we were at this point my wife had never had fried ice cream before so we had to.  They fried the outside with corn flakes and I think because of the size of the flakes they were oily and chewy.  Don't get me wrong though, we devoured it.I cannot wait to go back to this place and try more dishes.  Especially since it's BYOB.  They only charge a $3.50 corking fee which I think is fair.  We had to wait 20 minutes at 3:00pm on a Sunday so keep in mind that you will have to wait and parking is sparse.  You will have to walk.

38.description: Ambience is awesome, outside under palapa umbrellas, beautiful sun, music playing.   Ceviche was a 7 served as an appetizer, camarones sarandeados a 7, langostinos get a 6 out of 10.  They "ok" but the ones from El Cangrejo are way better and more delicious. That was the over all consensus of the there of us.

51.description: Recommended by a friend, while I was looking for Lenten food. Of course Friday during lent in a Hispanic neighborhood, this place was jumping and there was a bit of a wait. Atmosphere here is a little gritty, but very authentic. I cocktel de camarone and  my wife and the shrimp ceviche both were outstanding. I'm very anxious to get back here to sample some of the other great looking dishes like the langostinos.

27.description: This place is one of my favorites.. Not entirely for the food but also the ambience. It's byob and apparently that stands for beer or bottles as in liquor bottles.My go to dish is the camarones a la palapa with a side of avocado. If you like spice and shrimp that's your ticket. The dish is big enough to share with another person. Micheladas are so yummy. Not everyone knows how to make the mix but again byob. They provide an ice bucket to keep your drinks cold. It's a good place to people watch .. I mean if your into that sort of thing .. Once the music starts playing by different musicians that play for a price , you'll see some people drinking more. Enough said about that .. Really good food , just make sure you don't get an outside table when it's scorching hot out. It won't be much fun.

32.description: I absolutely love this place and I will make this review easy for you:Pros-The food is delicious I have tried several things inlcuding Red Snapper, Ceviche, Prawns, and breaded shrimp-The menu has a huge variety-Great price for such good and fresh food-BYOBCons-There are huge rocks on the floor in order to dine outside so ladies do not wear your heels you will mess them up-There is a trio of singers that walks around asking if you want music played and you cannot hear anything you are saying to your friends it is really loud and disruptive-Service is so so but not great sometimes they forget to bring you things you ask for like extra lime-They hardly have any parking so you have to be looking around if their facility is fullEven with the cons I mentioned I still love to go because I feel the food quality is worth going through all this, lol....love it!

48.description: The service is okay; it's not spectacular, but it'll do. I've only ever had the camarones a la palapa which are great. And the best shrimp quesadillas OF MY LIFE. Also, it's BYOB, so that's awesome. (There's a fee)

44.description: This place was awesome. Seafood that's cooked well and not overdone or overpriced.

24.description: The mattress breaker and BYOB is all you need to know.

7.description: First let me say that I'm mexican, born and raised, so I know what real Mexican food taste like.Service is below good, since all this kind of places prefer to hire just "pretty" girls instead of efficient ones with some minimal people skills. But the WORSE part of this place is the FOOD!!!Even my not Mexican friends have been like "what the hell is this?"Some body ordered a shrimp cocktail, the cup had some "embryo size" shrimp, and was mostly filled with some nasty whitish water, as opposed to just water, tomate juice or shrimp sauce. The octupus cocktail was even more disgusting since it was undercooked.Regarding other dishes, if u raid your spices cabinet and throw it all in a pan, add oil an onions, yes, u'll get a tasty sauce, I'm not sure that's Nayarit style thoug.7 mares soup, like in some many other places is extremely watery and flavorless.För u my not Mexican people, u can find way better sea  food in some small mom and pop restaurant.Why do I keep going back there?On a hot day, my friend and myself grab a 12 pack, sit outside, order some ceviche or fish "chicarrón" (a little expensive)..enjoy the breeze and our beer...kinda reminds us of back home.

49.description: I love this place by all means the camarones la palapa or the langostinos they are both to die for. Its a must try!.

40.description: Went at the recommendation of friends and loved it. Got the 7 sea food soup and it was delicious from start to finish. I was extremely full by the end of it :) Good sign, right? BYOB definitely helps. The waiters and waitresses are helpful and them being eye candy helps ;) In all seriousness, the food and ambience are congruent to each other and live music added to the awesomeness. The lobster empanadas were delicious.

53.description: been there, not impressed. as long as the cooks (wanna bees) don't cook the seafood, by that I mean order the cold plates not the over cooked, over seasoned and over priced plates.i hope that was helpful advice to any willing to drop a whole lot of money . there is much better out in that area.

30.description: The food is great, we've been coming here for years. Lately we've noticed that there has been a very steep decline in service. We waited fifteen minutes for our server to come greet us at our table. The food was also overly delayed it took over thirty minutes to get our food. I really do hope they get their act together because the food is great and the service was good at one point.

46.description: Service was mediocre, so was the food and management was worse.   Waited over an hour our food.  Management said we should have expected to wait that long. Waitress was extremely rude after we spoke to the manager. First and last time there.

1.description: I'm so sad that i have to write this review, I've been dying to try this restaurant and had finally convinced my boyfriend to try it out. Last night (valentines Day) we decided to cancel our reservations at Spiagga, we wanted to stay in and watch the all star game, we decided to order in and finally try this restaurant.. Let's just say that was the worst mistake EVER. We ordered online thru GRUBHUB.. The order was placed at 7:25. We ordered ceviche, garlic shrimp, rompeconchon, and the shrimp empanadas. $75 worth of food plus delivery fee plus a tip. About 1.5 hours in we got a little worried and called the restaurant .. "Your order should be there any minute" is what they promised .. Another 45 min go by and nothing .. We called again, they said "we already delivered the food!" EXCUSE ME WHAT?? Apparently they "delivered" the food to the wrong address, WHICH MAKES NO SENSE, mind you..It's almost 10pm at this point and we are starving and I am super annoyed.     The manager gets on the line and apologies and says he will send out our order again and will throw in something extra for the inconvenience  .. Another 30-40 min go by and our food finally shows. It is now almost 11pm.. We open our bags and they FORGOT THE CEVICHE! Really!? Almost FOUR HOURS LATER AND YOU STILL SCREWED UP OUR ORDER!? The food was mediocre since it looked like they rushed it, empanadas had a total of 2 shrimps in them, my garlic shrimp were gamy .. Completely ruined our Valentine's Day Dinner. Probably will never be returning which is too bad since I love Mariscos.

55.description: A great mom and pop spot! This is my neighborhood, and in a neighborhood lacking destination spots,  I'm proud to have this place.  Great food and service every time. It's best in summer, when you can sit outside. Sure it's on rocks, but it's fine. There's usually a mariachi band or something hanging around.  The Rompacachon plate is amazing! It's a mamoth plate of rice covered in octopus, shrimp,  crab,  etc. It's got heat too. My wife loves the shrimp cocktail. It's Mexican style in case you're expecting tiny shrimp over ice with cocktail sauce.  The shrimp el Diablo is also outstanding. It's  BYOB, so grab some Modelo and hang out.  The crowd is usually cool, but remember where you're at,  and don't be surprised with a few rowdy guys.  Otherwise, it's a great spot. And it's popular! So parking can be an issue.  Weekend evenings are tough,  so come early.  But it's all authentic,  fresh,  and legit!

9.description: I love this place. My coworker has so much Mexican pride that he eats mainly at Mexican restaurants on his lunch break. He invited me to go with him here. There portions are huge and good. I tried the ceviche, burrito, and seafood platter. The seafood platter is worth your money. It's about $25 but you can share it with 4 people. It's a lot if food. Also, in the summer, you get to sit outside. They have it set up like a beach, and with the seafood, you do feel like you're out on the sand.

26.description: Best seafood in Chicago. Yeah, I said it. It's not fancy by any means. You hear 18-wheelers passing by and the waitresses primarily speak Spanish but these people don't mess around when it comes to fish. On my last day working in the area, I ordered the filete relleno and almost kissed the fish. It was so beautifully overflowing with flavor and spices that food afterwards just tasted bland in comparison. In the summer, they have a little patio which is cute and makes you forget you're in a semi-industrial area  with the little mariachi dudes singing every couple minutes. Also, BYOB! The service is solid and they don't bug you when you don't want to be bothered. It's like they have an internal sonar and know when to come to your rescue. On a recent visit, I chatted with friends for about 30 min after we finished eating and they didn't push us out/shove the check in our face. That's that Latin hospitality. I will forever suggest this place to any true seafood lover that is all about the fish, not the flash.

25.description: Yes I think  this place is amazing if you order the right stuff plus live music and sitting outside under the palapa umbrellas. It transports you to another place out of this country. The staff was super nice, it almost felt we where with family. We order the small charolada. It has a lot of flavor and a little of everything. You have to have their ceviche on a tostada with a drop of Valentina hot sauce. It was just perfect. We also had empanadas de camaron. They tasted like they just had made them, so fresh and tasty. My son loved them! Oh since we brought wine for the adults, we ordered orchata for my son. I had to try it and it was the best orchata I've had. Desert was so good too.Definitely recommend if you want to try something very adventurous and different.

12.description: Awesome hidden gem in the Bridgeport neighborhood. BYOB.Ordered:langostinosaguachilesmejillones la palapa (mussels)Ceviche.If you normally like the aguachiles (spicy citrused raw shrimp), it is pretty good here.The langostinos were good as well, though I prefer el Venenos.I recommend the mejillones la palapa (mussels). Love the sauce!I look forward to eating there again!

59.description: I loved this seafood restaurant up until today, they charged my card 4X!!  And to top it off I went to the restaurant to see what had happened, can you say WORSE customer service ever, I mean they could have at least given me some fish tacos for life or something. People I advice you take CASH and not pay with your card. I am never going here again as much as I love their food! Might I add that I went last week Tuesday 01/13/2105 and they charged my card yesterday 1 week later!

21.description: I'll give it two stars because there is always worse out there I guess and if i gave it one star then my wife wouldn't let me live it down. She comes here often and loves the langostinos. Her and her friends go often. I don't eat Langostinos (roaches of the sea) so I can't comment on that. However, I have tried their fish and I was not a fan. I tried their steak and was not a fan. I tried their tacos and was not a fan. I have eaten here a few times now and as others have said it just isn't that good. The price isn't on par with the food either. I think people just love the fact that it is outdoor seating and byob. That definitely adds to the experience in a good way but given the chance, I would rather eat at maxwell's for dinner. I would rather take my burger home and light some candles and bust out the good silverware and plates than to eat here. I can set my own environment.  I think people are just fascinated with the environment and the fact that is an ok seafood place on this side of town. This is definitely not the best seafood restaurant in chicago. By far. Maybe they have the best langostinos. I don't know and can't tell you but everything I have tried here doesn't come close to best in any way. I just think people don't know better or need a way to drink and this provides BYOB to people that aren't allowed to go out or something. Or maybe people just want to love a seafood place near them. I mean even the other 5 and 4 star reviews say things like "Not the best but I loved it" or "Order the right thing" "depending on what you order". That tells you right there. I have never had a bad server though. They have always been nice. The restrooms are ridiculous though. I would rather walk on hot coals than piss in there ever again in my life. Don't let me review sway you though. Go find out for yourself. You may be one that loves the place but it just isn't for me.

17.description: I absolutely love this place and I will make this review easy for you:Pros-The food is delicious I have tried several things inlcuding Red Snapper, Ceviche, Prawns, and breaded shrimp-The menu has a huge variety-Great price for such good and fresh food-BYOBCons-There are huge rocks on the floor in order to dine outside so ladies do not wear your heels you will mess them up-There is a trio of singers that walks around asking if you want music played and you cannot hear anything you are saying to your friends it is really loud and disruptive-Service is so so but not great sometimes they forget to bring you things you ask for like extra lime-They hardly have any parking so you have to be looking around if their facility is fullEven with the cons I mentioned I still love to go because I feel the food quality is worth going through all this, lol....love it!

10.description: Great seafood spot they have an outdoor area with palm trees it makes you feel like if you are on a mini vacation..Friendly and attentive and you get a free small plate of ceviche as an appetizerYou can Byob since they dont serve liquor. They sell you a michaleda mix that you can add to your beer.. Try their pinapple juice its amazingFor food i had their shrimp empanadas..seasoned well crunchy and moist..eat it with chipotle mayo..For entree i had a mojarra a la diabla served with cajun fries, rice, and a salad..the diabla sauce is hot but manageable for you to eat unlike other places where you cant even enjoy the meal. And its not watered down (major brownie points)Like coming here a lot food has never disappointed me and for seafood its cheaper than other places

5.description: Best seafood in Chicago. Yeah, I said it. It's not fancy by any means. You hear 18-wheelers passing by and the waitresses primarily speak Spanish but these people don't mess around when it comes to fish. On my last day working in the area, I ordered the filete relleno and almost kissed the fish. It was so beautifully overflowing with flavor and spices that food afterwards just tasted bland in comparison. In the summer, they have a little patio which is cute and makes you forget you're in a semi-industrial area  with the little mariachi dudes singing every couple minutes. Also, BYOB! The service is solid and they don't bug you when you don't want to be bothered. It's like they have an internal sonar and know when to come to your rescue. On a recent visit, I chatted with friends for about 30 min after we finished eating and they didn't push us out/shove the check in our face. That's that Latin hospitality. I will forever suggest this place to any true seafood lover that is all about the fish, not the flash.

3.description: I was hoping to like this place but was greatly disappointed . Prices are higher than other places I have to.  The positions are small as well . Employees seems unprofessional but I can see why given that the owner was sitting behind my table talking to the girl and work hours . What business owner handles work issues out in the open ?

35.description: I have been going to Palapa since it opened. Food is very good. Service a bit iffy sometimes depending which girl is your server. I recently went and I noticed a disposal byob fee $7.50 I was in shock because that was something new and I am wondering is that even legal? Next time I don't think I'll take anything to drink or I'll ask to take my trash home!

19.description: Two Yuma up. Honestly about as good of a taco as you can find. I had the chicken and steak and both were great, steak just a hair better. The salsa was to die for, I love me some good sauce. It comes with a free fish ceviche which is novel in my dining experiences. Good as it gets I suppose for being in the central Midwest haha. Then 2 guys in cowboy hats came up and started singing and playing guitar and accordion. All in all a top notch lunch with a fun atmosphere.

28.description: Came here for lunch with my co workers. The outdoor seating is a nice touch especially when it's nice out. Our waitress was very tentative and the service was nice. They give you tortillas, salsa, and ceviche while you wait for your order. The ceviche is fantastic !!! I ordered the grilled shrimp which was very flavorful. I'm giving this place 3 stars because of the location (I wish it were in a nicer area). I plan on coming back here and trying their other dishes so I can update this review.

45.description: The food isn't good i ordered a shrimp cocktail the shrimp wasn't fresh the juice of the cocktail was super watery! On top of the fact that i took my own beer which is a byob place they charge 3.50 a person to dispose of your bottles you have to be kidding me! What a dissapointment wanted to take my girlfriend out for a nice night out. What a nice "night-out" it was. Never going back!

33.description: best mexican seafood in the city ...remindes me of Playa Del Carmen

43.description: Ive never liked places that use plastic silverware and dinnerware. Even the mugs are plastic. Their fresh waters are made from some generic powder which is always a downer for me. The food was not bad, but it wasn't as good as it was hyped up to be. I always judge a sea food place by their basic ceviche and shrimp cocktail, which again, were nothing special. I believe what makes this place special is the BYOB, but I wish they actually sold beer here because ended up paying 7 bucks for just bringing in a bottle. They do have great service, but then again it was a Monday afternoon.

2.description: It's been quite a while since I've come here and I feel bad with this review but it has to be done. So I decided to take my mom here because she wanted seafood. She order a Sopa de siete mares (7 seafood soup) because she thought it would be a nice change. Well let me start from the time we walked in. We were seated next to the mariachi guys who hang out and for $15 a song they sing and play a gig from their Arsenal. Okay, I let the waitress know that my mom is a senior and I don't think it would be a good idea to sit us right on the side of the mariachis because I know from experience it can get loud. But she said "oh don't worry, they haven't had any request for two hours you'll be fine." UMMMMM....Mom ordered the 7 mares soup and I got the large shrimp cocktail with oysters.  Well moms soup was salty beyond. I was surprised as they usually don't salt it up so much. But she ate the seafood and the stock, well it was left. Now my shrimp cocktail was also a bit salty (surprisingly) and the oysters were so not fresh. They had a real funny taste and inlet the waitress know and she said that was because they are fresh. Ummmm no, I've had fresh and this wasn't one of those times. I ate the shrimp but the oysters were not consumed so much due to the taste. All in all, I've decreased my view on Palapas and that's tough encase for the most part I do enjoy them, but this visit was certainly not the best. I should of done the BYOB to mask the taste this time around.

18.description: been wanting to try this place for years!!this place is small inside with a outdoor patio.. small parking lot.. ok service..i went with a couple of friends that has ate here before.. they had suggested a few dishes that sounds delicious.. i ended up with the Mattress Breaker..its a mixture of seafood on top of rice.. from what i can see.. there was shrimp, squid, and fake crab meat..the dish was pretty dam good.. lots of flavor and it has a kick to it..  the food tasted fresh and the portion size is decent..would definitely come back and try their other food!

41.description: For a seafood place it was by far the worst shrimp cocktail I had ever ordered in my life. I gave them 2 stars only because I had been here before and I know the rest of the food is held to a higher standard. That same night I went with two friends and they said their dish wasn't what we are accustomed too.

52.description: It was alright for me...The service is great and we got seated right away. But thats the only good thing. This place was set for outdoors and the day I went there it was cold. It was made so that we can be inside but its still was chilli in there. Ok the food...most important. Well they start you off with this miniature size ceviche and its suppose to be enough for everyone on the table...not! The taste was mediocre at best. The salsa was not spicy or special in any way. I ordered the langostinos and again nothing special. Seasoning and flavor was ok. Im not sure if I'm willing to come back and risk it on another dish.

50.description: Finally getting around to writing this review. Trying to avoid the blowback from management/ownership that other poor reviews seem to be battered with. The second star is for the waitstaff, who are pleasant, courteous, and attentive. They made four visits here tolerable, and I apologize to them for what follows. You guys were great. Otherwise, one star all the way.I live within walking distance of this place, so I wanted to love it. Really. Which is why I kept going back. Each time, of the FOUR times I went, the food was worse than the last. I wish I had pictures of the very literal slop they served. It looked like it came from a chum bucket that was ladled on top of over-cooked rice. It was truly disgusting. Not terrible tasting (not great either [although, over-season a bike tire, and I bet you can choke it down]), just visually disgusting and worlds apart from the pictures that they put on the menu. That's right, tacky pics on the menu. Huge red flag! Basically,  the obviously frozen, bought in bulk, factory processed seafood they serve is gross (don't bother denying it guys, anyone who eats fresh food regularly will agree). If you want fresh...I guess move to the coast or be prepared to pay for the quality, because quality is definitely not here. The prices for quality are though. Imagine jj fish charging sushi grade prices and you get the idea. You're only fooling the plebs, guys; your product is sub-par, bulk-bought, frozen garbage. Retool your business model. Unless overcharging for sea-garbage to reap undeserved profits for as long as you can until people realize what they're eating is nauseous or they die from ingesting it is what your going for. If so, kudos! Five stars! The ceviche was decent though.

4.description: This place has been going downhill and it is no where near as good as it used to be. I literally live walking distance from this place now and I haven't gone here once since moving by here. Food quality is going down and they give way less portions now. Also, the BS $14.00 disposal fee for a bottle of wine seems kinda stupid. I understand a BYOB fee per person for beer, but wine shouldn't be charged per person... Anyway, this place was just much better overall back then. Seafood here is not fresh by any means...

6.description: Yes I think  this place is amazing if you order the right stuff plus live music and sitting outside under the palapa umbrellas. It transports you to another place out of this country. The staff was super nice, it almost felt we where with family. We order the small charolada. It has a lot of flavor and a little of everything. You have to have their ceviche on a tostada with a drop of Valentina hot sauce. It was just perfect. We also had empanadas de camaron. They tasted like they just had made them, so fresh and tasty. My son loved them! Oh since we brought wine for the adults, we ordered orchata for my son. I had to try it and it was the best orchata I've had. Desert was so good too.Definitely recommend if you want to try something very adventurous and different.

22.description: I have the say the seafood was really good and BIG huge servings. However, my boyfriend, who speaks Spanish told the waitress he did not want his food THAT spicy..well it was SPICY!! He ate it because it was VERY tasty but he was pretty uncomfortable for the 1st part of our meal. $7 for disposal fee & ice for 4 beers? I didn't need limes & I could have kept our 4 beers in my cooler bag & throw out my own bottles. They don't tell you there is a charge either...didn't even realize until we got the bill. I feel like that is done on purpose & that doesn't seem right to do to a paying customer. Why is it charged BEFORE tax? Service was good & the atmosphere too..except the guitar players who come to your table consistently. I enjoy the music but I think politely saying NO once is enough..especially if it is the same person. I am all for ppl earning $..but sometimes you just want to eat. We were 1st timers..so lessons learned..we will be back now that we have the know how.

15.description: Ordered the snow crab legs with shrimp and they were delectable. The ambience here was surprisingly great on a Friday night. We also had a group playing live music (kind of wished they turned on the playlist down on the side though). We had a funny waitress and kept our order accurate and pleasant. This place has great ambience if you want to be reminded of a beach-side establishment since you do see a lifeguard chair and plenty of hay umbrellas. I'm not sure about the other food, but the seafood I ordered was definitely delicious and worth going back for!A part of me wished I had room for dessert...

57.description: Omg! Hands down a great experience. The paella is my favorite! Big portions n very full filling. Def does not lack taste. Highly recommend this hole in the wall.

20.description: Two Yuma up. Honestly about as good of a taco as you can find. I had the chicken and steak and both were great, steak just a hair better. The salsa was to die for, I love me some good sauce. It comes with a free fish ceviche which is novel in my dining experiences. Good as it gets I suppose for being in the central Midwest haha. Then 2 guys in cowboy hats came up and started singing and playing guitar and accordion. All in all a top notch lunch with a fun atmosphere.

36.description: Excellent service and seafood, my favorite place to go, seating outside very nice, best seafood restaurant in Chicago, highly recommended

14.description: I'll give it two stars because there is always worse out there I guess and if i gave it one star then my wife wouldn't let me live it down. She comes here often and loves the langostinos. Her and her friends go often. I don't eat Langostinos (roaches of the sea) so I can't comment on that. However, I have tried their fish and I was not a fan. I tried their steak and was not a fan. I tried their tacos and was not a fan. I have eaten here a few times now and as others have said it just isn't that good. The price isn't on par with the food either. I think people just love the fact that it is outdoor seating and byob. That definitely adds to the experience in a good way but given the chance, I would rather eat at maxwell's for dinner. I would rather take my burger home and light some candles and bust out the good silverware and plates than to eat here. I can set my own environment.  I think people are just fascinated with the environment and the fact that is an ok seafood place on this side of town. This is definitely not the best seafood restaurant in chicago. By far. Maybe they have the best langostinos. I don't know and can't tell you but everything I have tried here doesn't come close to best in any way. I just think people don't know better or need a way to drink and this provides BYOB to people that aren't allowed to go out or something. Or maybe people just want to love a seafood place near them. I mean even the other 5 and 4 star reviews say things like "Not the best but I loved it" or "Order the right thing" "depending on what you order". That tells you right there. I have never had a bad server though. They have always been nice. The restrooms are ridiculous though. I would rather walk on hot coals than piss in there ever again in my life. Don't let me review sway you though. Go find out for yourself. You may be one that loves the place but it just isn't for me.

3.description: Love the coconut ice cream and paletas. I'm very happy this cute place opened up near me.

1.description: So this place is adorable and everyone's really nice. But do not order coffee...unless you want a cup of brown water. I admit I'm a little bit of a snob when it comes to the stuff, but it's like they use one granule for a whole pot. I just don't get it.Okay now that I feel like a jerk for saying something bad, let's get to the good...their pork tamales rule, the Cuban sandwich is ridiculously good, and their veggie panini is fully loaded and awesome(I would change the bread it comes on though as it gets a little soggy). All in all, I'm glad this place is down the street from my house and I'll be back to try more soon!

2.description: The ice cream is fantastic, and unique. It is very clean, and the employees are very kind and attentive. The taquitos lunch  I had was good, a bit over done but that could have been a one time thing. The Sundaes are fantastic and very reasonable. I'm looking forward to my next visit.  I hope they do well in the future.

5.description: This place is great! We saw an article about it on a neighborhood newspaper and thought we would check it out. The soup is so flavorful, sandwich cubano is delicious and so as panini. We had magoneada for desert and omg it's amazing. Gandpa's delight is such a Bridgeport's hidden treasure! You should definitely come check it out!

6.description: this place is excellent. I had the fried tamales and horchata. the owners are the nicest people too. it's a cute place to go for a quick bite or if you're hungry! definitely check it out.

0.description: I visited a few days ago and I'm already planning my second trip today! I had the mangonada and I was floored with how delicious it was. Beautiful table top art, clean and comfy space. Friendly staff. Just what McKinley Park needs! Highly Recommended!

4.description: only downfall of this place is the very bad coffee ive been having. Extremely watery! but the Tamales i got today were awesome!

28.description: Everything here is excellent, but there's usually a 25% chance that you're order will be messed up!  Still, it's worth the gamble.  The place gets bonus weird points for having a parking attendant for a lot that can't have more than 8 or 10 spots.

1.description: When I moved into the area, I was so happy to find Los Comales. Hulking, well priced burritos and tortas with quick service was a godsend considering their late hours and proximity to the CTA orange line.But, that was about two years ago and since then Los Comales has consistently failed me. The prices hiked, and that's fine, the burritos are huge after all, but then the service got worse, the food wasn't as consistent, and I realized it's nearly impossible to have a nice dinner inside the place. Blaring TVs make it impossible to even hear yourself chew, so since I live nearby, I only ordered take-out.That was, until I found an avocado sticker in my burrito and that was the end of my Los Comales eating. It was a one-time incident and I had gone there many times before, but it was the last straw for me on the downward trend this restaurant is experiencing.

9.description: My #1 spot for any mexican food.

29.description: Okay food, Okay prices, but inferior service...The main waitress keep on staring at my family and was talking in Spanish, laughing at us... I felt like they didn't want us... Yea... ehhh.......Authenic Food... I think not, it look like frozen food.... The place was cold and dirty...

23.description: Good portions. Decent price.OH, and open super early in the morning most days. I dont mean"open till 3 or 4 am" I mean open at 7:30 AM when i get off the train on my way home from work. And on a tuesday to boot.I've eaten there twice, and both times have been good. First time was after the Home Run Derby back in 2003. Last time a few weeks ago. Had the steak tacos to go.

5.description: The tacos here are pretty sweet, but the meat can be dry.  However, their tortas, so good.  The service was on point, even though they kept speaking to me in Spanish due to my tan skin--seriously.  However, I feel as though that is part of the experience, if I'm eating their food I would like to be immersed in their culture.  It was never a hindrance and when I spoke in English they responded in English.We had a sweet older woman serving us who was very friendly and funny.

31.description: If you're American, they'll stare at you like you're a frickin alien.  I called in an order one time because I like their tacos and they didn't have it ready when I got there.  The people working there don't speak much English but it's still a nice sit down place, there's a big eating area.

25.description: Great steak tacos and the rice milk was awesome..  crowd seemed pretty average... helpful staff Don't get anything else there.. just the basics

12.description: My sister loves this place! I think it is decent place, I order the kids combo , two tacos rice and beans with an horchata for $5, cant' beat that!

21.description: Let me tell you something about me--I dont give a damn if I dont speak the language; if people are eating good, drinking good or partying well, I'm in the house like AC in the summer time in Phoenix.Los Comales is a spot I roll through quite often after my late night escapades in Chi.  I am consistently one of the only people, if not THEE only person in this joint at 2 am, that does NOT speak spanish. AND I DONT GIVE A DAMN! lol. Know why? Cause Los Comales tacos are extremely crackish. I personally have never, nor WILL ever have crack, so I cant officially call them crack--cause I cant totally speak to the parallel...so crack-ish I am comfortable calling them. Get the steak tacos. Yes, they are small, so make sure you get 3 or 4.  They come with onion and cilantro and a better than average salsa.Los Comales and I are a match made in heaven. Good talk.

16.description: mmm lengua tacos with a good horchata.  That's cow tongue tacos with rice milk!!  Very similar to San Jose Taqueria in the southside, in fact, its similar to many southside Mexican restaurants that serve burritos, tacos, chips, tortas and horchatas for reasonable prices.  The staff was nice, the eating area was nicely lit.The horchata was very sweet without much cinnamon, I like it that way, so suit yourself.  But I enjoyed that the tacos could be served with either lettuce/tomatoes or cilantro/onions.  We also had the fresh guacamole dip with hard tortillas, not chips but full tortillas.. weird.  The dip though was very fresh, but I wish it had more flavor/spices in it to make it more flavorful.overall a good place to get a late night bite or for lunch/dinner.

17.description: Let me tell you something about me--I dont give a damn if I dont speak the language; if people are eating good, drinking good or partying well, I'm in the house like AC in the summer time in Phoenix.Los Comales is a spot I roll through quite often after my late night escapades in Chi.  I am consistently one of the only people, if not THEE only person in this joint at 2 am, that does NOT speak spanish. AND I DONT GIVE A DAMN! lol. Know why? Cause Los Comales tacos are extremely crackish. I personally have never, nor WILL ever have crack, so I cant officially call them crack--cause I cant totally speak to the parallel...so crack-ish I am comfortable calling them. Get the steak tacos. Yes, they are small, so make sure you get 3 or 4.  They come with onion and cilantro and a better than average salsa.Los Comales and I are a match made in heaven. Good talk.

10.description: ¿Qué dijo!? If you're ignorant to the Spanish language that means, "say what!?" (I used Google translate so not sure if it's legit.. lol Anywho, I've been living in Mexico, ummm, I mean McKinley park for almost 3 years now and NEVER even noticed the place...  It is right down the street from my son's daycare too. Boy was I missing out.  Not any more!! Ordered the pollo (chicken) burrito and as Dora the Explorer would say "DELICIOSO'!!  Not the typical greasy spanish fair that you get at most mexican restaurants in the area. It was huge and all I could eat was half but it was the best chicken burrito ever!  I will be back as soon as I can afford the calories and post some opinions on some other dishes...

11.description: Comales is nothing fancy but it is good food for cheap and it is the best place to hit up after a night out. Late nights seems to be their busiest times. Grab some tacos or a torta. An horchata or jamaica to wash it down and you are set.

26.description: torta. torta. torta. one tiny taco. delicious.

27.description: Pros- The most amazing tacos ever! The tremendously tender steak with creamy avocado makes the best combination. My boyfriend only gets the veggie burritos and loves those as well. It's open till pretty late and has super fast service to pick up. Just call 5-7 minutes ahead and your meal will be waiting.Cons- Resembles fast food joint cleanliness. It takes about 10 minutes to get them to understand I want a veggie burrito that = no meat. I usually get transferred to someone else.The parking lot is too small and awkward for its 2 speedbumps.

0.description: What I like about Comales is that you can get real simple authentic food fast and inexpensive. For less than $9, I got a gordita, 2 tacos and a Coke!  You can't beat that my friends!I've been to many Comales for many years and the food is good and comforting.  I always order tacos a side of sliced avocado and an orchata. Occasionally I order a torta. :) this time around, a gordita was calling my name. I ordered one al pastor with everything.  Wow!  It was deliciously good and it was steaming hot.  I think I will be eating more of these now.

20.description: The portions are worth the price. The food was very good. We ordered steak burritos and they were huge. Would eat there again. They have a kids menu and deliver to your home.

19.description: I walked in Monday afternoon for lunch expecting the best since I was starving.
