I had been to other locations were they give you chips and salsa however this location did not give me chips! I ordered my drink and the horchata tasted really weird as if it was sweetened with corn syrup. The tacos were really good I had three. I will not return to this location.

2.description: I use to like Los Comales but they are skimping on their food. The tacos I ordered of steak were very greasy. I ordered a bean and cheese gordita and it tastes like it had been reheated, it was not made fresh and almost stale like. I did not like anything that I ordered. I won't be going back.

32.description: You have to love this place's little tacos.  They cost about a dollar each, and are made with steak, onions and cilantro , and are a great late night food option to the White Castle down the street, due to the fact they are open quite late.  They also have the normal Mexican fare, including burritos, tortas, and some really good guacamole.  And when you order take out, you get a little baggie of pickled spicy veggies (cauliflower, carrots, and jalapeno peppers!-yummy).

18.description: I have tried most of their menu items and they are just about as good as any other Mexican fare I have had around town. Where this place stands out is the torta de pollo de Milanesa (breaded chicken sandwich).  The breaded chicken is very thin and tender with just the right amount of breading and spice.It is tucked neatly between a soft fresh bread (telera) and topped with all the traditional fixings. I have heard many rave reviews about the tortas from Bon Bom Cafe and I believe the hype (I got try them).But simply put If you want to have GOOD Mexican food with FAST service and CHEAP prices this is the place for you. It's great for lunch or after a long night of drinking (open late).

13.description: I  was a big fan of this place until the last few months. Their meat must be coming from a different source now because it is not the same anymore. It has alot of fatty hard meat as if they are trying to cut corners. This is the same problem with their other locations.

4.description: unbeleivable Cesina tacos. Best in the city, and for some reason they are the best at this location!

24.description: Came here with my guy to try it out. The menu is small. We ordered the steak burrito, 2 al pastor tacos, steak torta and grilled onions. My steak burrito was huge. I like the crispness of the outside and plenty of steak. I just thought it was a bit bland.I tried a bit of the al pastor tacos and thought it was flavorful enough. Tried a bit of the torta and didn't think much of it. I was expecting chips and salsa, but I guess they don't serve them here. =( They didn't even offer them on the menu.They did have that pickled carrots, peppers and cauliflower. The cauliflower was tasty. Overall, it was ok, but nothing to go seek out.

6.description: Great food! Fast service! Small tacos, but TASTY!!I am seriously here at LEAST once a week and I live no where in the neighborhood. This Los Comales has thee best limonada ever! (Lemonade) ... sweet, so don't expect summer sun lemonade.... but I LOVE it. My boyfriend hates it.Their Jamaica is great too. No, that's not grape juice. Its Jamaica.Their al pastor is to die for! LOVE IT!! And as many times as Ive been here the last 3 years, I never noticed they have chorizo tacos. DOUBLE YUM!! Just when I thought I couldn't love this place anymore!! Their chicharron gorditas are so good too! Now, I'm Mexican. And Ive dined at Mexican restaurants on the North side of the city, the south, the east, and the west. Even nasty places like Taco Burrito King. But this is a place I would DEFINATELY take a drive for. Downside? I LOVE the pickled cauliflower. Dine in and the cauliflower is all you can eat. Take it to go? 3 pieces in a small bag cost you an extra 50 cents. And no refills. So order a large.

22.description: All I can say is EWWWWWW don't waste your time and money !! This place Sucks and the service is just as bad. If you want some tacos go down a few more blocks to the steak house you'll be happy you did.

15.description: "LIQUADO DE PLATANO Y TORTA DE POLLO SIN EMPANZADO." If you gringos can learn how to say that then you will see g-d in the form of a banana milk shake w cinnamon on top and a delicious chicken sandwich. Its right by the train station also, i think the archer orange line. Did you know there is a Sandwich, Illinois? They have a big fair called the sandwich fair. I'm thinkin about going, whos in?

7.description: Came here with my guy to try it out. The menu is small. We ordered the steak burrito, 2 al pastor tacos, steak torta and grilled onions. My steak burrito was huge. I like the crispness of the outside and plenty of steak. I just thought it was a bit bland.I tried a bit of the al pastor tacos and thought it was flavorful enough. Tried a bit of the torta and didn't think much of it. I was expecting chips and salsa, but I guess they don't serve them here. =( They didn't even offer them on the menu.They did have that pickled carrots, peppers and cauliflower. The cauliflower was tasty. Overall, it was ok, but nothing to go seek out.

8.description: Great food, and right next to the 35/Archer CTA Orange (Midway) Line! I was one of the few non-Spanish speaking customers there, but I felt at home, and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere! The Burritos were filling and amazing, though one thing I found inconvenient was that they didn't offer soft drink refills (so I ordered the large).

30.description: I have tried most of their menu items and they are just about as good as any other Mexican fare I have had around town. Where this place stands out is the torta de pollo de Milanesa (breaded chicken sandwich).  The breaded chicken is very thin and tender with just the right amount of breading and spice.It is tucked neatly between a soft fresh bread (telera) and topped with all the traditional fixings. I have heard many rave reviews about the tortas from Bon Bom Cafe and I believe the hype (I got try them).But simply put If you want to have GOOD Mexican food with FAST service and CHEAP prices this is the place for you. It's great for lunch or after a long night of drinking (open late).

3.description: I love this place.  Always solid food.  When i'm in the area I will be back!

14.description: They have many locations, all of them are not up to par. Tacos al pastor are always dry and tasteless. No manches! Que paso con los comales.You better off going to Tio Luis.

12.description: I went to Gertie's for lunch yesterday at 87th and Harlem and ordered a Filbert's root beer. It was to die for at the first taste. The best, bar none!

7.description: Anything under five stars and your possibly crazy, best place around, they gave my son and I a tour of the bottling area while it was running, cool stuff. They have a great variety of flavors. You can get kegs of root beer for parties and events and it is really affordable.  They are really easy going, you walk through and build your own cases of flavors. It feels like your going back in time here neat old building, no fancy storefront, it's awesome.

1.description: Visiting Filbert's bottling plant/warehouse on Ashland is a unique experience, to say the least. As the sign pictured here on Yelp notes, the actual entrance isn't on Ashland itself per se. Instead, it's perpendicular to the street, just off of a small parking lot. From the lot, visitors enter via a short staircase onto a loading dock. (Alternatively, it seemed like you could also enter through an additional storage and loading area towards the back of the parking lot, if stairs were an issue. Definitely call ahead if you have any accessibility questions or concerns).Once inside, from the perspective of looking into the warehouse from the loading dock, there are three things to see: To the left, a live bottling line; to the right, along the back wall, a display of historic drinking containers; in the middle, dozens of pallets of freshly made Filbert pop....and that's about it. There's no receptionist. There's no signage (that I noticed). There's no retail space. You're just in the middle of a small warehouse. It may not feel right at first, but you've found the correct place, in all of its light industrial glory.Filbert's is an active work space and you may need to wait a moment to catch anyone's attention. A couple of minutes after my arrival, one of the guys in the warehouse offered up a spare case and there was no rush or pressure while browsing cases of pop for sale. With a few exceptions (notably, ginger beer: $1 each), each 12oz glass bottle is $0.50 and you're welcomed to create mixed cases of whatever is available. A small shelf held a few popular flavors in larger sizes as well. Filbert's line includes well over a dozen pops ("sodas", as I'd call them back home...), but the Draft Root Beer is the centerpiece. While I didn't bother to confirm whether or not every flavor was in stock, it seemed like most were.Depending on the day, you might be able to find out a little more about the company or get to check out the line. Be forewarned though: there is not a formal tour or anything of the sort, so your experience may differ from that of fellow Yelpers.As far as the sodas themselves? There wasn't one among the eight that I selected and didn't like, but none that I'd add to my 'must-try' list either. The most pleasant surprise might have been either of the lemonade (a tart, refreshing, snappy version that made me wonder why carbonated lemonade wasn't more popular) or the blueberry (a not-too-sweet fruit-flavored drink with a clean, fresh finish). For those so concerned, many of the drinks here are sweetened with high fructose corn syrup (per their labels), although the ginger beer uses cane sugar.

2.description: Drove by a million times.  But it happened to be open today.  Well the door was open cuz it's hot out.   Plus I love visiting local Chicago businesses.  Anyways, stopped in and bought a case of philberts root beer for $6.  Not bad root beer, but I'm far from an expert on that.   It taste good to me, so that's all that matters.  The root beer has actual sugar, so if u like that, u will certainly enjoy this.

9.description: In case anyone has a child's party. You can even rent their Root Beer by the keg!! I was at a friends party and the kids were creating Root Beer Floats using the keg. The kids had fun with it since they have never seen one before.They also have created several new flavors such as Banana, Red Raspberry, Blueberry, Apple and more.

6.description: Filberts is a gem!  We stopped in on Christmas Eve and bought 24 assorted bottles.  We haven't been disappointed with any flavor.  For New Years Eve, we offered flights of Filberts to partyers under 21.  It was a huge hit for everyone!

18.description: 9$ for a 24 pack of killer local root beer. That's about 38 cents for a delicious local root beer. Why aren't you picking up a case right now?

10.description: I really like this place, haven't been often because it's a bit of a hike, but they have a really good variety of flavors.Some of them are made with sugar, some are made with HFCS, at least according to the bottles.  The cherry, red raspberry, peach, and lime all tasted like real sugar and were outstanding.  Very friendly, they'll talk your ear off about politics, the neighborhood, whatever.

13.description: I just stocked my front cooler at Winstop of South Holland with Filbert's Draft Root Beer. I couldn't be happier with my decision. Ron couldn't have made the transition easier.

16.description: LOVE THE ROOT BEER!!! The video strip on archer carries root beer and other flavors!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

17.description: I am sipping a bottle of Filbert's Pineapple Soda.  There is absolutely no pineapple taste in the bottle. None. Nada. The Filbert chemists to do a little more research.  Rootbeer must be their forte, it sure isn't the fruit flavored drinks.

15.description: This place is trip!  A case of retro soda in glass bottles for $10.00!  Unbelievable.  Great for parties where kids are around!

0.description: How many places can you name that still brew local pop?  Besides being hands down the best root beer ever they go beyond that.  I remember as a kid getting the big ass glass bottles of pop on tables at weddings so it was a treat something to look forward to.  When I grew up and moved into the neighborhood and seen who was next door my mind was blown.  They are great people doing things right.  I don't think they have a flavor can't can't please ....If you are within a hour drive you have no excuse for not going there and stocking up. Prices are very fair and you owe it to your self,  what ever you do do not leave without a case of root beer.

5.description: I love it here!! They were so kind and even gave us a cold sample. Also really cool to see all the old bottles on display. Can't beat the prices.

11.description: Best pop in the city and you can't get it cheaper or fresher anywhere in the world. Great range of flavors, my favorite being Cherry, then followed by their Cola. Worth the trip.

8.description: Love this gem of a place. Last year I threw my husband a surprise birthday party and because he would take root beer over beer any day of the week, I started looking for places that did root beer kegs. Other places charged upward of $75 for a small keg, but Filbert's only charged $25, plus a $100 refundable deposit. My husband raved about the taste and quality, and while I was there I picked up 2 cases of soda for myself-1 peach, 1 pineapple. SOOO GOOD!!! The guys were super friendly, helpful and grateful for my business. If it weren't so far away I'd be in every week. Whether you need a root beer keg or just some delicious soda, go to Filbert's!!!

3.description: Website says they're open 9-1 on Saturday's but when we arrived at 9:45 the place was closed.  We rang, we knocked...no answer, not a soul in sight.  Disappointing...

14.description: I myself can only drink the diet root beer.  Yummy.   Light cake-mix flavor.Go and see the bottler in action.   Very friendly guys.

4.description: I get Filbert's root beer from my local market amongst a number of other beverages they make. I didnt pay attention to the fact that they were based out of Chicago until i tried Maria's ginger beer, which is a partnership between Maria's packaged goods and Filbert's. root beer, ginger beer, cream soda, black cherry. It's all really tasty and a very solid line of great beverages. 4.3 stars

12.description: If I could give this rat hole a negative score, it'd be a -10 at the least.  Were it not for all of my prior experiences at other Popeyes being filled with fatty goodness, I'd swear off the chain all together after going to this one.I really like Popeye's spicy fried chicken and absolutely love their biscuits.  That said, it pains me (literally) to write this review.It's a Sunday afternoon that found me craving some fried chicken; so we go to Popeyes on Ashland near Archer.  We pull up to the drive thru and this is where my rant begins.[RANT ON]We try to place a simple order; just a 3 piece meal w/ dark meat, spicy, cole slaw, and a Coke.  An order we have to repeat each component of the order three times because their shitty intercom system makes communication near impossible.  Then I get home discover: no dark meat!  WTF?!  A breast and a couple of legs with no meat on them do not constitute as dark meat by any measure.  The cole slaw had a somewhat odd taste to it; which led only to my prompt pitching of the styrofoam contained shit into the garbage can.Thinking, well at least they didn't fuck up the drink and biscuit part; I proceeded to force consume the white meat pseudo-chicken and the biscuit and washing it all down with the Coke.  End of story....  So I thought....It's 3AM in the morning; I wake up clenching my stomach in discomfort.  I make my way to the bathroom and that's when the real stomach clenching begins.  Mind you, this order from Popeyes was the only food I had on Sunday save a bowl of cereal for breakfast.  One of the two caused me to run to the can in the middle of the night... I don't think it was the Honey Bunches of Oats...To eat the crap that they sell is akin to asking for a messed up order and a stomach ache in the middle of the night that leads to teeth clenching.  Teeth clenching can lead to wearing down of enamel which can lead to cavities, cracked teeth, and other ailments that cause a lot of pain.  Thus to sum up my rant, Popeyes at Ashland and Archer is horrible and will likely cause much pain; both in your near future and possibly for some time to come.[RANT OFF]

3.description: Actually deserves zero stars. Stopped by after my son's baseball game in Bridgeport. I love KFC and think Brown's is pretty good. I haven't had Popeyes in 20 years but my son is a fan so we decided to give it a shot. The customer service is pretty bad mainly because of the language barrier. Not courteous and as stated here before, they keep on hammering you about extra charges.I got the 3 piece meal and without question it was the worst food I have ever eaten. The chicken is dry, the breeding is drier and my stomach felt terrible after. By all means avoid. The are a ton of other edible positions in this area.

1.description: Ugh. I love Popeyes but I'm so sad this is the one near me. Some of the other reviews said it, but the business put little weight on customer service. Any time I want to customize my order, there's an up charge. Want you pick thighs instead of breasts? Up charge. Want to change my order? Up charge. They even are stingy on the ketchup and hot sauce....I asked for ketchup for my medium order of fries, they give one measly packet and even "forgot" my hot sauce. I don't know. I probably will end up driving 5 extra miles to avoid going to this particular Popeyes......

2.description: David wanted greased and momma said okay. This place was near his apartment, so for a quick stop and run this Popeyes was it.I went through the drive through which was basic - nothing surprising. The server was pleasant and patient as I asked my questions, (of course, I couldn't see her eyes roll, but she sounded nice and respectful) and how many times did I have repeat my order - 3-4 times. Hmmm.I don't eat fried foods, but thought, it's been forever since I had fried shrimp, so I ordered some. To my surprise they were okay, (just okay). Not that I would drive out of my way to purchase more, but they would suffice for the locals if they haven't tasted Troah's. My sons were pleased with their fried products, but sometimes I don't they have tastebuds nor stomachs - just pits.

9.description: This place is great, but something caught my eyes when I went a week ago. I come here often. I saw that the Department of Health suspended this Popeyes license. I don't know whether it is only this Popeyes, but hopefully it gets its license back when I check tomorrow..

10.description: Okay, everyone knows what a Popeye's is and how it tastes. I really go here for the cajun fries more then anything. But I'm going to focus this review on the service. The food already meets the standards of your average Popeye's.I've been coming here for years and the staff has almost always been majority hispanic that has barely spoke any English. I have no problem with that but if you can't speak English you should not be working the cashier's position. I've felt that has slowed the lines down many times because there has always been the language problem where they cannot understand the customer questions and they need to call someone over to be a translator.The place itself is about as clean as you'd expect a Popeye's.

4.description: I have only been to a handful of Popeyes, but this one is by far the best. The service is always friendly and good here. Luckily, this is right by my house. As far as the food, it is the same here as any Popeyes.

6.description: food is great! except the customer service i spent $26 dollars there and i couldnt get a 1 bbq packet for free. they were charging 27 cents really wtf?! contacting their quarters

0.description: The food here is always good, but I will have to knock out a point due to their staff.  Most of the time, I will go through drive thru and take it home to eat... so I can't tell ya anything about the cleanliness of the dining room.Now, I'm the type that doesn't eat any dark meat... so I have to specify white meat... and then repeat it over about 4 times before they tell me it's going to be an extra charge.  "yes, the charge is fine".... then they repeat the extra charge for another 2 times before I can finally drive to the window. LOL.

5.description: Ordered yummy cajun fries. The con is the service. They sound so busy and rushed us through.. only to discover we had to wait at the drive-thru for five minutes... not sure why.

13.description: I loves me some greasy fatty crispy chicken and all the sloppy sides that come with it and yes I really love when I get them awesome 2 for1 lunch special coupons in the mail cause believe me I do use them and sometimes I even steal my neighbors coupons but don't tell them that.

11.description: Not a very clean, eating friendly establishment, but in a pinch it will suffice.  There is something about the spicy naked chicken that I really like.  The drive through menu-board only seems to work if you are driving a pick-up or van to set off the sensor.  So don't try it in a normal sized car.  The staff here always seems only mildly interested in work, and last time I ordered, the woman taking my order was mildly annoyed because I couldn't give her the order in Spanish.  If it wasn't for the few menu items like the biscuits and mashed and gravy, I would stay away from this location all together.

8.description: Usually come here for some chicken. It's usually pretty good. Sides are decent. Can get busy and especially when they have those chicken deals like 8 pieces for $5 or $6.

14.description: It's a busy place in the evenings which is a good thing, high turn around of food gives you higher  chance for fresh chicken.  On average, the majority of the customers are made up of Hispanics, I would say about 80%, Asians 10%, Whites 5% and Blacks 5%.  I like their fried chicken but not the biscuits, too dry, yuck.  They have an in-house coupon like no other when you buy 3 piece dinner with a medium drink, the additional 2 piece dinner is free.  Great value.  I've never been sick from this place and I've been there for years.  My stomach is quite sensitive to bad food and MSG so I would know if the eatery is bad or not.   I highly recommend this Popeye's over the others.

7.description: This is the nearest Popeye's to me and unfortunately it's about 20 minutes away.  It's worth it because the service here is fast and friendly.  They never seem to be short on staff.

1.description: History keeps on repeating itself, and I am the fool for returning here.  Possibly because it is so close to work, and beats the hell out of the White Castle next door.  No matter what sandwich I order, something always comes up not too pleasant.  For example, last time I was here, I ended up getting overcharged, and had to argue with the clerk with the fact she charged me for a foot long, when I only got a six-inch.  That is only one example of the problems I have encountered at this particular location.

0.description: They've gotten better since the remodel, but still shy of the five-star review.I've never had an issue with the quality of the food. Its typical Subway fare that you will find at most Subway restaurants. My only gripe is that the soft drinks from the fountain always seems to be a bit flat and I am one who prefers my soft drinks to have some fizz.

58.description: I have been trying to get a Texas-sized doughnut for years.  For some unholy reason, I can't find any place around here that caters to this need.  I have visited places in multiple states that were all supposed to have them but didn't make any the day I showed up [including IN TEXAS!!]  When I saw the images of the Texas Donut Delight online from Huck Finn's over a year ago, I almost died but remained cautiously optimistic - I saved it to my favorite places but had no concrete plans to visit Chicago at the time and feared when I finally did either the restaurant or the doughnuts would be gone by then.I went last month.Another life goal can be crossed off the list.It's one thing to eat a doughnut larger than your face.  It's another to have a giant face doughnut with a sundae on top of it.  And it's a third thing to realize you bought the second largest doughnut in the restaurant, as the one the size of a toilet seat, as amazing as it was, would have ended up being wasted between two petite girls with eyes much larger than their bellies so we had to be content just being in its presence [though we now regret not getting one sans ice cream, carting it all over Chicago buses all day, and ultimately consuming it on the 20+ hour Amtrak ride home the following day].Ok, was it the best tasting doughnut on the face of the planet?  No, but it was perfectly acceptable in a Dunkin' Donuts-y way.  Was it the best tasting ice cream ever made?  No.  Do you really think I care?  No.  Waitress was super friendly and nice, kept refilling our drinks, and instead of trying to upsell us on the larger doughnut that we thought we wanted was actually the one who persuaded us not to get it because she didn't think we'd be able to finish it [she would have been right as we barely finished the one we got and it would have been money/doughnut thrown away].  Another bonus: the bus stops both coming and going were literally steps away so it couldn't have been any easier to get to for a couple of tourists without a car... or perhaps it was simply fate bringing me directly to the doughnut's doorstep.

56.description: After a night out of the city...this is the place you want to stop at 2am to stuff your face with an early breakfast and coffee...to sober up...or to wake up for your drive home.I think it is pretty cheap for breakfast and no one judges you when you walk in looking like a hot mess.The food is decent and portions are big (Yum Yum skillets!). A better alternative instead of that late night mexican burrito stop (you won't regret it in the morning like that burrito!).On the downside the bathrooms are gross...yuck yuck yuck

29.description: Nothing spectacular, typical diner. Corned beef hash was obviously from a can. The donuts look good, although I did not try one.

42.description: Love this place! The food is always good and the staff is warm and inviting, my husband and I love going there any time of day since they are always open!

23.description: I always order the Becky Thatcher, I don't even know who she is....Regardless if I order anything else it has to be accompanied by s Becky Thatcher. I have eaten here so much in the past 2 years that I have personally paid a cook his salary, jokingly serious.

47.description: Been coming here since I was a little kid. Love the food and place. Great for morning hangovers as well.

8.description: Piss poor horrible restaurant. I ordered the Becky thatcher after a hard day of rioting at riotfest. Ordered a coffee to keep me awake rest of night. I go to stir some sugar in to my coffee and I find a sugar packet floating in my coffee. They were not busy at all and there should have been better quality control. The creamer bowl was filled with empty creamer cups with a napkin set over it. Luckily the very nice bus boy brought me a new cup and spoon. He got my tip... As I requested another water to keep my self hydrated, I pounded half the glass down. As I was sitting the glass down i noticed there was sewer flys in my water. They're lucky I paid for my meal because I was so disgusted by the poor lack of quality and detail. I have 0 interest in going back to this location. At least the one on 67 and Pulaski pays more attention to details...

31.description: I can't remember if I reviewed this location, so here I go for 2014. Have you ever left the bar at 2am and just want a nice homestyle cooked greasy breakfast dish to settle the stomach of all that liquor your drank? YOU'VE FOUND IT!!! I don't know how many times this place saved me after karaoke nights, drinks at Maria's or house parties in the area. They make bacon the way I like it and their coffee is exactly the way diner coffee should be. I just wish the waitresses i've had could be a little more cheery. They remind me of the ones that have worked a double and just want to get the hell out of there. Almost like they don't care if they get a good tip, just let 7am come already, dammit! If you are also looking for old school donuts, this is the place. They have your standard donuts without all the fancy stuff and someday my bf said he will buy the Texas donut. I wait the day....

34.description: Only good for breakfast.  The lunch and dinner are lost causes. Needs a bit of cleaning.  Looks so old and run down. And the waitresses should care more about how they present themselves,  they are borderline between old school waitress and heavy makeup hookers (sorry, no offense) but very distracting to eat around.

16.description: The waitress we had was very friendly and was even cracking jokes. The food was made fast and was delicious I had a chicken Caesar Pita with fries. I could not finish all my food because the pita is huge and they give you a lot inside it. My fiancé had the chorizo omelette which was very good and he also had waffles which was good as well.

13.description: Where can you get monstrous-sized donuts?  And, I'm talking about BIG - big, oversized chocolate-covered or glazed donuts (the glazed ones are so much better) for only $1.70!  The fact that they're monstrous and that they sell them at this donut shop, I just thought it was hilarious! I got all giddy when I saw these - didn't even want to eat them.  The donut itself was fine, and I think it's just one of those experiences that's cool to have if you're in the area!+oversized GIANT donuts = $1.70!

11.description: My first time here and I had the shrimp. It was good nice and chrunchy just like I like. The donut and ice cream was awesome to.

39.description: I have to say that their chicken breast salad with caesar dressing is the BEST!Although they have messed up my order sometimes when I take it to go so that's why it gets 4 stars but oeverall its a great place..

37.description: Love this place! The food is great, the donuts are very fresh unlike dunkin donuts. Definitely will keep on visiting.

0.description: Them big ol' donuts turned me on to the southside. Love the diner, love the servers, love the menus, and can't get enough of the Texas donuts. The fact that it's a 24 hour joint makes it all the better.

38.description: This is a local city landmark!  It is quite surprisingly (to me) pretty clean here. I was expecting it to be sort of a dump but no, it was relatively clean.  Now, mind you, I made a pact with myself a few years back to cease patronizing any sort of 24-hour diner facility.  I have done well with the pact but only came to Huck Finn because my boyfriend has been raving about the donuts. We came on a Saturday morning around 9 am and there was no wait and many empty tables to choose from -- hard to find sometimes!  The place has this very towny feel here that I find comforting, like all the customers are regulars and know the waitresses' names.Our breakfast was good, no complaints. We took our donuts to go...the selection was a bit sparse so I'm guessing it's common knowledge that the donuts are good. Sadly the waitress gave me a white-frosted donut instead of a chocolate one so I didn't bother trying it. My boyfriend reported that the donut he had was a bit on the stale side and said that perhaps they make the donuts on-site at the other Huck Finn location.  Next stop: Archview Huck Finn.

51.description: I went to meet my friend for breakfast at around 10 am thinking that the rush would be over and the service much better but it didn't happen. My son wasn't offered a child placemat to color or to at least keep him occupied while we waited for the food. The food was bland and unappetizing. I ordered the french toast for my son, four wedges and nothing to wow him with. I ordered the two eggs scrambled served with a sausage link and one bacon strip, and hashbrowns. My eggs were served in one flat layer, my hashbrowns were undercooked, and the frenchtoast didn't have any pizzazz!!!! Service was okay, but nothing that showed they were trying to provide high quality attentiveness. I was not impressed at all and now I remember why I would only come as a late customer after the doing the club scene, because I was clueless to what was going on! So disappointed.

27.description: After a long hiatus of not frequenting this joint because the food used to taste like heatlamp, I came back to find that the business is booming here. I was kind of intrigued. The menu is pretty extensive, didn't see any filet mignon, if you get my drift, but this place has Americana written all over it and then some.  Ever wanted a giant donut you could share with three others? Check. How about some damn good prices on stuff like the Becky Thatcher Breakfast that beats the pants off some other establishments in the same neighborhood? Check.  Oh, and those pancakes! Heartier than a corn-fed midwestern girl's hips and just as luscious drizzled in all kinds of jam, syrup and butter! If you're into that kind of thing. Service is pretty good considering they get HAMMERED on the weekends with Mexican families out for a little "convivencia" with their loved ones -- even though I saw parents on their phones while their kiddos played in silence across from their "rolemodels", anyway... I digress. Waitresses are sweet and prompt most of the time when they aren't being run ragged. Tip 'em!My only complaint is the men's bathroom. Um, time for a rehab, good sir or madam who is in charge. The splishy and splashy of the water all over the floor and the other conditions made me think of that one scene in Trainspotting, you know the one where Renton has to dive in to get his magical suppositories? Yeaaaahhh...Other than that, get some good grub and hit the road!

32.description: I can't believe I have never been here before! I discovered this 24 hour gem driving a friend home from work. I think I will be offering this friend a ride home more often, haha! DONUTS!!!!

54.description: the few times i came here, the service was horrible. the waitresses really shows that they don't care and just want to leave out of there. they hardly come check up on our drinks or if we need anything else.this place is like the ghetto version of archview that's a block down. there's not one thing that Ive tried here that was decent. i ordered rib tips here once because it was on the specials page and I'm a big fan of rib tips, when it came out i thought they brought the dish to the wrong table. my rib tips was not cut up at all! it was just 2 long pieces of meat covered in BBQ sauce that didn't even taste right... i also tried a few different burgers here and it was just disappointing.. it was bland and kind of sloppy.i would not come back here anymore since there is not one nice thing i can say about this place.

48.description: I've found myself becoming quite a regular at this diner, full on with a regular order: a cup of coffee with a chocolate glazed french donut that I share with my friend who orders decaf (!) coffee and hash browns. They make a decent cup of joe here; it is plain coffee and real cream and does its job.

44.description: Donuts as big a frisbees?  Check.  Open around the clock?  Check.  Wide menu?  Check.  Easy to get to? Check.  Lots of free parking? Check.  Tasty, but regularly-sized donuts?  Check.  Prompt, friendly service?  Check.  Good to great food in large quantity for a very fair price?  Check.

24.description: This place has amazing pastries. I8 Recommend their apple fritters. Freshly made and warm. Delicious. I also ordered breakfast from here as well and it wasn't bad either. Great customer service even though one of my friend's was drunk and throwing up.  They still helped out. A+ in my book

7.description: This place is always good, especially to get a late night snack. Try to avoid the crowds on the weekends after 2 AM because they're all drunk and loud and sometimes disorderly. But the prices are good as well as the food. It's open 24 hours, which is one of the great things about it. Good food, decent prices, nice atmosphere. Can't ask for more.

49.description: Huck Finn's is a 24/7 diner. I love the waitstaff, as everyone has always been nice. The donuts are okay if you show at the right time. Sometimes they can be stale.I've had the pancakes here (meh), and the eggs (also meh). What's really great, however, is the broccoli soup they serve every other Tuesday (random, huh?). The bread that comes with it just goes so well with the soup itself.Being a vegetarian, there's not much I can eat on the menu, so be forewarned. If you're in McKinley Park and hungry around 10pm, though, go here.

40.description: The menu here is much smaller than Archview, but the quality of the food here is a bit better. Again, this is just average diner food at best. I always get their omelets or skillets with toast. The toast here is actually really good! My biggest issue with this place is that the water cup is so small and the servers are not that attentive, so this leaves you extremely thirsty if you don't order something else other than water. I wish their menu selection is bigger so there can be more options. They have a small bakery, which is a plus. My favorite is the cinnamon roll. It is so soft and delicious.

53.description: I go here once a week with my friends late at night to get donuts and hot chocolate. The staff is super-friendly and the donuts are super-delicious (and cheap)! Although they often run out of donuts by 11pm, which sucks since they are open 24-hours. The rest of the food is exactly what you would expect from a 24-hour diner, greasy and kind of overpriced. The bathrooms are also pretty gross. But the donuts are good enough to over-power these problems!They also accept credit cards for ANY purchase. So even if you go and order a donut and a small hot chocolate (around 2.00), you can use a credit card! Also, if you sit down at a table with a large party you can pay at the register and split the bill anyway that you would like. Great hangout for large groups!

30.description: Where can you get monstrous-sized donuts?  And, I'm talking about BIG - big, oversized chocolate-covered or glazed donuts (the glazed ones are so much better) for only $1.70!  The fact that they're monstrous and that they sell them at this donut shop, I just thought it was hilarious! I got all giddy when I saw these - didn't even want to eat them.  The donut itself was fine, and I think it's just one of those experiences that's cool to have if you're in the area!+oversized GIANT donuts = $1.70!

46.description: The waitress was very slow, and did not suggest a better deal. When i received my bill i was floored. The toast was the best thing on the menu.

1.description: Huck Finn's is your basic diner.  Open 24 hours a day, they have a wide menu variety of all 3 daily meals.  On this day, we wanted some lunch.  My husband ordered the Monte Cristo platter while I chose a BLT Club platter.Sharing half of each meal, I thought my Club sandwich was better than his Monte Cristo.  I prefer my MC's to be battered and cooked in a skillet.  This one was more like french toast bu I thought it was somewhat soggy.  My husband thought it was the cat's ass, though.  We also picked up some chocolate long john donuts but I could tell they were close to exceeding their shelf life by the time I tried one later in the day.  Still, the food is pretty good here.

55.description: Great breakfast joint !!! Sprinkle donuts are delish!!!!!!

9.description: This restaurant is disgusting! I went here expecting a good breakfast and I leave unsatisfied and disgusted.First of all, I ordered the steak breakfast and I specifically asked the waitress for the steak to be well done but both times it was rare. The hAsh browns were still cold, I could tell that they were previously frozen.  Then my daughter ordered the pancake meal, and half way through her meal she notices a black hair on her plate. I know that was not her hair since she has blonde hair. After complaining to the waitress she just said "shit" and left with our plates. No apologies or explanations. Twenty minutes later she came back with our bill. Supposedly she was going to remove both plates from our bill, but how did our bill amount to nothing. So after their discount they wanted us to pay 33 for the food that we didn't eat. Ha! I am never going back to this crappy restaurant!I also wanted to let you guys know that the manager never showed up and talked to us, in fact nobody ever came and apologized for our bad experience.

26.description: The waitress we had was very friendly and was even cracking jokes. The food was made fast and was delicious I had a chicken Caesar Pita with fries. I could not finish all my food because the pita is huge and they give you a lot inside it. My fiancé had the chorizo omelette which was very good and he also had waffles which was good as well.

25.description: A real budget friendly place with good coffee and food. I went in the late hours of the night, fairly busy, yet service was fast. My waffle came out quick and so did my husband's burger. Our waitress was nice and attentive ( I never had to ask for a refill which is one of my pet peeves) and she wasn't wearing hooker make up like some other Yelper mention. I will most likely come back to try some of the other meals.

12.description: Service has gotten better, met some old friends for breakfast , place was packed, and still was able to get a table in an adequate timing. Food was good, my daughter is a very picky eater and finished a whole pancake, and bacon !!!!! I will be gong there just to see her eyes shine so bright!!!

59.description: I when this morning for breakfast. Nice restaurant, it is very friendly and especially it welcomes large family. But it does get pack sundays after 10. It worth the wait.

21.description: Good diner food. Amazing bakery!!! Everything is so fresh and moist and the donuts taste better than krispy cremes! Love the giant one too!

17.description: Great friendly service. Authentic and traditional diner food. Ruben and hot turkey sandwich were perfect! Will be back for donuts and breakfast! They are also open 24hrs!

10.description: Drove from the burbs for breakfast and regret the decision whole -heartedly! First, it took over 10mins to even place our order. When we finally received it, both of our orders were wrong (they were simple orders!)The coffee spilled all over our table was overkill (we don't drink coffee.)My husband didn't get his drink until he was finished with his food (yes, we asked way before that.) The waitress commented she's "in such a rush since everyone decided to come at the same time." Not our fault ma'am.  The food was decent at best but we should've stuck with our original plan of going to Blueberry Hill in Lagrange.

5.description: Super cute old school place. Breakfast is great...I get the broccoli cheese omelette or a veggie skillet. Lunch is okay. The donut delight saved my life once.

3.description: Doughnut review only.Huck Finn has been on my apple-fritter radar for a while, and today was finally the day.  It was decent, not great.  The exterior was a bit crispy as it should be, but the center was slightly underdone.  The whole thing contained very few apples and little cinnamon flavor.  It wasn't even very sweet, which is usually fine; but in the absence of other flavor elements, I at least wanted some sugar, you know?I liked the other doughnuts more, particularly the blueberry cake, which was rather light, almost fluffy, and sported a robust berry taste.One other positive note--at 2pm on a Sunday, the doughnut case was still well stocked.  Most bakeries would be closed or their selections decimated by then.

35.description: Horrible! Came in here with a big group, maybe about 20 people. Within 5 minutes we were getting kicked out by some white guy because we were apparently taking up to much space haha! Wow never seen a business that doesn't want to make any money

19.description: I always order the Becky Thatcher, I don't even know who she is....Regardless if I order anything else it has to be accompanied by s Becky Thatcher. I have eaten here so much in the past 2 years that I have personally paid a cook his salary, jokingly serious.

28.description: Typical diner; this is exactly as you'd expect.  Nothing special whatsoever.

45.description: Great food, relatively close to my house and courteous service. I have been coming here since I was a young lad and the place has largely remained unchanged over the years. I typically get my order to go and it doesn't take long, either.

33.description: I have been here many times and most of them have been late at night. As you walk in, to the right of the restaurant the cool kids tend to sit on that side and to the left of the restaurant, you'll find cops, state troopers, and UPS drivers. I'm not sure why I payed attention to that but just thought I'd share that. The food, ice cream, and doughnuts are good. I tend to order the Becky Thatcher or a short order of French toast. Their soup and coffee are also good. As of now I don't know any restaurant or ice cream establishment that sells the so called "superman" ice cream they have here. Which by the way is very good. Overall they're service is fast and friendly especially if you're sober.

43.description: ...Again; I love diners.  This spot is always crowded; always kinda messy but their donuts are usually fresh.  I like their tuna melts

2.description: I was so excited to meet my friends here EARLY for breakfast one morning and then... meh, I was disappointed.  If it weren't for the company, I would've probably not stuck around.  The place is more greasy spoon than the location in Oak Lawn and the food is just ok.  It's just your standard breakfast, no frills, nothing over the top, just food.  It doesn't sound like all Huck Finn's are owned by the same people.  I will never have a need to go here again.  Blah.

18.description: Classic comfortable American diner! My go to brunch/breakfast place for when I can't figure out what I want to eat or I don't want to wait 2 hours to get a seat at some other brunch place. It's also great for hunger pangs at 3am in the morning, so it's a great all around food joint. The food is all typical fare, so I can't say that a particular dish stands out. But they do it well, so I don't have any complaints. My go to is any of the skillets, either the vegetarian or chorizo one, depending on full I want to be.

41.description: I love this place. Becky thatcher breakfast, unlimited coffee, sassy 35th street waitresses. Giant yummy London burgers, crispy steak fries and the previous reviewer is right on about the broccoli cheddar soup. My personal favorite is the turkey club, I think their donuts are the best and they're open 24/7. The manager is really great. He's always there. He could own the place for all I know. Last week we went in to get donuts and asked for a discount since we were selling them to raise money for McKinley Park and the man GAVE them to us for free! These guys have a customer for life!

52.description: Diner cakes.......arrrgggh!!!  My wife had the impulse to go out for breakfast after work and since hardly anybody yelps on the southwest side I figured we'd go to the Huck Finn's on Pulaski.  Nothing fancy here, just regular diner food and a bad waitress; but since I'm a pancake nut I'm loathing the fact that I had to settle for diner cakes.  Diner cakes are the standard pancake you get at 84.7% of the diners in Chicago.  They taste like Aunt Jemima, Hungry Jack and Bisquick powders mixed together with cornmeal then just add water.  To top it off, they were tough and my bottom diner cake was burned.  There HAS to be a better place than this to go to on the southwest side when you have a taste for late-nite breakfast.

50.description: Their food is actually quite tasty! I would definitely return. Service is pretty good as well!

4.description: Fast service, the food was great & inexpensive. We bought breakfast to start our shift & doughnuts for the crew later. No complaints with either. Since they're blocks away from our garage we'll definitely be back!

6.description: I ordered a Reuben to go. When I arrived, I was kinda worried because they asked if I would like Thousand Island dressing. Since this is a given on this type of sandwich, I was confused why they would ask that. I was impressed that I had called the order in and walked over which took less time than I had thought so I was there early but barely had to wait for my food. I don't know why there was lettuce and tomato in the container (not typical with a Reuben). It was really awkward to add the dressing since the cheese had already melted holding the sandwich together. The corn beef was nice and thick and the sauerkraut was the perfect amount to be enough and not overwhelming. I would order this sandwich again but make sure to ask for the dressing ON the sandwich!

22.description: Strolled in there at 4am. I got the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon. Not bad. The biscuits were nice a fluffy, I actually like them a little less fluffy because the gravy soaks into them. The sausage gravy was good too. Not great but definitely above average. A lot of places have really bland gravy, but this place has  good taste with a lot of chopped up sausage mixed in. Good review with a  minus star because I felt dirtier after I got out of the bathroom then before I went in.

15.description: One of the only places in town where I can order a plain omelet and they aren't confused or laughing at me. My bruised ego has fond feelings for Huck Finn. If your dining alone or with a buddy, don't wait to be seated. Just go up to the bar and sit up front. It's much faster, and you'll be in and out in under 30mins. **They also have donuts, but I don't really eat donuts so I guess can't rate them either way.**

57.description: Definitely check it out if you want to experience the one dirty bathroom stall they have for women in the entire restaurant.Food is ok diner slop but plenty of other better places nearby.Our waitress today pretended as though our table of 5 was invisible after I complained that she placed my egg sandwich order to include meat when I didn't request it.  She kept walking right past our table & never stopped to refill our empty coffee mugs and water glasses until I asked her.

20.description: On my way coming home from the casino I got very hungry and we stoped here to eat. Back in the day I forgot about how great this place was and for not eating it for a very long time bring back some memory. This place is still good best breakfasts u can eat at 300am

36.description: This is what a diner should be. 24 hrs w/ a steady staff that knows what they're doing. Don't come here for fancy trendy menu options, just great eggs 'n pancakes!

14.description: It's only getting a 2 star Bc the food is good. Service is terrible!! Last time I went I got this mean white lady, I asked her to bring me a soup and she forgot about it and when we got the bill my soup was already charged on it... I love the food but the service is just a no-no.

3.description: We stopped here for lunch and I'm so glad we did. I ordered the pork kabobs and they were amazing.. Some of the best I have ever had. My boyfriend ordered the pulled pork Mac and cheese and he said it was excellent. We will definitely return!

1.description: So I can only review based on two things.....cold takeout from hubby bringing catering home, and than takeout when we didn't feel like cooking. Normally husband doesn't rave too much about the catered food from school....nothing bad, but nothing special. This time, when Angie V's catered, he not only had to tell me about it, but brought home leftovers and a menu! The mac and cheese, a day later and cold in the fridge was delish! We only had the regular mac and cheese, but I saw on the menu that there were many variations! He also brought home the patty melt, which was better than the mac and cheese! So of course a week or so later, we had to try their food hot out of the oven :) Hubby was sick, so I went to do a pickup. I ended up with two of their appetizers, the sliders and the loaded nachos. Although all bar food, you can tell that everything was homemade. The sliders were great, and they even remembered to accommodate my sheer hatred toward pickles and gave me a pickle spear (for husband) on the side! The nachos were tasty, but I should have splurged for the addition of pulled pork. It just needed one other thing to round out the flavors.We can't wait to try them in-store! The bar atmosphere is great, the restaurant spacious, and there's even a few pool tables to keep yourself entertained for a few hours!

2.description: It was slow when we were there...but the game was playing, the drinks were flowing and the bartender was attentive.  I can't ask for much else for a Sunday afternoon at a sports bar.  :)

5.description: Love the pork kabobs and mac n cheese options. Francheesie is awesome too.   Good food, reasonable prices, attentive staff.

6.description: This place just changed hands not too long ago and is a pretty nice looking bar on the inside. The menu items are pretty much what you would expect from a bar and the chile and Mac meals were pretty large. The place has several TVs and has both booth and table seating with a busy kitchen the nightI went. A good place in an area with limited drinking and eating options

7.description: Love the baked mac n cheese! I am always ordering to take out as we are within walking distance. This place is great with awesome special. Only con is no beers on tap. Definitely a go to spot!

0.description: Great food.  Great service.  Mac & Cheese was awesome and so was the pulled pork.  2 meals, beer and a soda....under $20.  Fabulous.

4.description: Stopped here for the fish fry on Friday night. The fish and fries did not disappoint. In fact, the fries were excellent. The service was friendly and they treated us as if they actually cared if we enjoyed our meal and ourselves. This is a good neighborhood bar and grill and I will be back.

12.description: Great place for games and movies! Customer service is fantastic, and Joe is a really great guy. Huge selection, and a very convenient unlimited monthly plan is available. Definitely a good place to find more obscure/"underground" films as well.

7.description: Not only have I been a customer for the last 18YRS but like a friend as well! The Video Strip not only out lasted Blockbuster but pretty much every other video store out there. Proof that only the strong do survive! Great selection of DVD's, Blueray, PS3, XBOX and Wi games! Friendly and knowledgeable staff as well. Joe "the owner" is a huge movie buff and that's what I want in an owner! The store covers every genre you can think of from Anime to Drama and everything in between. Also has the uncut/unrated/uncensored versions of movies that other stores most likely don't carry. If you're a fan of film you'll definitely get your money's worth here!!

19.description: This is all you could want from a video store open 365 days a year. Why would anyone want go anywhere else is beyond me. A knowledgeable friendly staff that will get you in and out with no hassle. I'm so done dealing with the other Big Box robotic & impersonal security shouts of "HELLO!" when you walk through the door and the long lines waiting to hear a "NEXT! STEP UP!" I much rather get a warm ma & pa welcome and a free bag of chips not to mention the awesome deals and great selection of UNcut & UNedited video rentals. A huge plus- You're able to rent the whole box collection as one rental and have it longer than your typical rental place. They offer pick up & delivery too!

1.description: I've been so torn as to if and when to write this review.... I adore this little shop and I've enjoyed keeping it to myself for long enough..  The owner Joe, really is a great guy which is why he is mentioned in every review. He's got a good little staff of employees who are always very helpful and kind. Need a movie recommendation? Give Joe several titles you've enjoyed in the past and he will come up with something you've never even heard of! You won't ever want (or need!) to use Redbox again after you see the selection this little shop has... There are several monthly plans you can subscribe to (we have 2 out at a time, about $25 per month). Only wanna rent family movies? There's a plan for you too, $4.99 per month. Oh and I mention the selection of video games? Yeah, it's extensive too! I hate to mention it, but I have to.... There's an epic xxx section complete with Girls Gone Wild and all the parodies. You're welcome. Pretty much every hit show that's ever been on television is there and when you rent a series, you get the whole series not just one or two discs at a time. Joe also takes requests and custom orders, so if you dont see something, ask! Don't feel like going out? Oh well they also deliver! (This is subject to availability of staff) You'll always be in the loop with the text alerts too. New releases and specials pretty frequently. The shop is located next door to the Auto Zone, so park on the street and not in their lot. Happy 19 years (October 27) to Joe and his Video Strip, wishing you many more.

2.description: Signing up for membership is a breeze, there's tons of titles to rent and if you don't know what to get, ask one of the helpful clerks behind the counter. No need to wait for your connection to buffer or whatever crap menus a Redbox has (I've never used one). You get the real deal with all the special features, just like the good ol'days.

9.description: Who needs Netflix or the Red Box when you have an actual video store to go where you can find the movie you really want to see! Video Strip has countless titles including the harder to find titles that you can't seem to find anywhere.  What makes it even better is that they have different specials to make your renting experience a better and more inexpensive one.  They have an unlimited monthly plan, a kids friendly plan and a number of  others.  You just have to make a trip there and check out what they have to offer. The friendly staff will tell you exactly what you need to know. This is definitely the place to go for all your renting needs!!

6.description: I have been getting my movies from The Video Strip since the first week they opened.  Why would I ever go anywhere else?  Joe and all of his employees are friendly and knowledgeable about movies.  I remember going in and not sure what I wanted to see.....but somehow they always know what I like!!  I especially love that they stock obscure movies that other places don't even know exist.  Heck, I can rent a movie anywhere....but NO WHERE would I get the kind of customer service that I have always received at the Video Strip!!!  THIS is why they have been in business all of these years.

18.description: I like the friendly personalized service.

10.description: Joe is the man!  Awesome selection, great rental deals, and he has everything before netflix and redbox!    Nice place to stop in and catch up on neighborhood gossip too!

13.description: I love this place. Where else can you get a WHOLE SEASON of a TV show for the price of one rental? I had to keep re-renting Star Trek, The Original Series for 3 weeks in a row because it had so many episodes...Plus, Joe Trutin just plain rules as a plainspeaking, genuinely concerned political junky. And the ever present, mopey dogs are pretty sweet as well.

16.description: Best Neighborhood video store ever. Hello how many videp stores do you know that delivers? staff is always fun pleasant and remember you and the owner Joe kicks ass. best place in the world why deal with the big box videos when the local stores the best???? Having a hard time finding a video you've been looking for? look no further if they don't have it Joe can find it!! great prices and rental club options to save!!! I LOVE THIS STORE!!!

17.description: I also love that you can rent a whole season of a show for one price! I also love that they have everything, even those hard to find movies that the big chains never have! the dogs are so cute and service is great!

15.description: The Video Strip is a great little rental place.There are lot of television viewing options availabe these days: Tivo, Satellite, HDTV, Digital-over-the-air, onDemand, PPV.  You'd think that a brick-n-mortar couldn't survive, but the Video Strip has done just that -- and how you ask?  With an awesome selection of DVDs and video games, generous rental times, and a knowledgable staff.  Joe (the owner) has been running this place for a while and is always super-friendly when you have questions.I highly recommend this place for hard-to-find titles as well as latest releases. :)

0.description: My experience here was phenomenal!There was a gentleman working by the name of Joe and he was sooooo knowledgeable and informative!He answered all my questions thoroughly and helped me fine EXACTLY what I was looking for!The location is like a hidden gem tucked away! AND you can't beat the prices !!We need more video stores around like this one. I will definitely be coming back and letting friends/family know about The Video Strip!! -Michelle B

5.description: Best place for all things movies, candy and all things info. From the warm hello's to suggested movie tips "you'll hate to leave"

11.description: How do they fit so many movies/video games in that small store? I don't know...but it's awesome. For those of us who resist technological advances and still prefer a brick & mortar video rental store, Video Strip is your spot. They have pretty much any movie, TV show, or Girls Gone Wild you can think of. I can't speak to the video game selection since I've never rented one, but it looks like it's also a good size. Prices are super cheap. $9 for 3 movies for an entire week...plus they'll throw in a free bag of chips/popcorn if you rent 3 movies. I haven't used their delivery/pick-up services, but I've seen signs that they have it, which is awesome if you're busy or not very mobile. All three employees (Joe the owner, a young girl, and a young guy) I have encountered are really nice and helpful. I'll keep renting my movies here as long as it's there.

8.description: Don't let the outside fool you--they actually have a big selection of movies & video games (both old and new). Plus, the guy that owns this place rocks! Definitely recommend Video Strip to anyone. Check it out and see for yourself.

3.description: Don't let video stores die! This place is a gem. They have a great horror section and every new release you're looking for. The owner is a super nice guy...ready to answer all your questions and give suggestions. So glad they're in my neighborhood.

14.description: I've passed by The Video Strip many times growing up but never really paid any attention to it. Just recently i've started renting out from here and I can definitely see i've been missing something!The selection is not bad at all. You probably won't find everything and if you don't i'm sure that Joe will probably order it for you. I was amazed to see that you can rent whole TV show box sets (Doctor Who baby here I come!) instead of just one disc. I also like the specials where you rent 3 movies for example and you get a free bag of chips.Its convenient as heck too because there are open most days and its in walking distance from my apartment. Good to see that if I want my movie fix I don't need to travel all the way to the North Side to find what i'm looking for =)

4.description: Joe is a real nice guy! I went in there last night to have some old PS2 games cleaned (y'know, remove all those scratches that have accumulated over the years). Joe was working & we were chatting about movies & stuff. He said no one has ever written a review about their disc-cleaning machine, so I guess I'm the first. It's a real nice thing to have in the neighborhood. My games took about 20 minutes to clean & they now look brand new. I was charged $2 for each game. What a great price! What a great neighbor to have!

3.description: This is just for the Cricket Wireless Company it self. They are a great company. Cheap and reliable and they have nationwide calling, unlimited text, unlimited minutes, and unlimited web browsing. I need all that so its perfect for me.  Great for the price you pay a month!

1.description: Cricket is a HOT HOT HOT ASS MESS. Don't ever get internet service from cricket. I don't give a damn if it 45 dollars a month. I can barely watch movies because it's always skipping I can't move my laptop around It has to stay in the living room other wise it's slow ass hell. I can talk about how bad cricket is all day my mom can only use her cricket phone outside otherwise her calls will drop. Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!.

2.description: As far as the phone and service goes I have had no problems with reception and the mobile web is fairly quick, my problem is with their customer service.I have had my phone for almost 2 weeks now and from day 1 I have been unable to receive or send picture messages even though I am paying for unlimited.Sent an email to customer service-no response.Called on Friday and was told my phone needed to be reprogrammed and everything should be fine then,tried it and it didnt work.Called again on Saturday and was told the pictures were not working due to a service outage-strange because phone,texts and web worked just fine, how could an outage only affect picture messages? So basically I have spent an hour on the phone and sent emails with no response-still unable to get or receive pictures.I am going to go into one of the stores with hopes that someone there can fix this problem-wish me luck.

0.description: Great service. Awesome customer service. Jorge, Ulises and yesenia are all friendly and helpful.

4.description: I have the Samsung Messager phone with Cricket.  My experience has been so poor that I am looking to switch service providers.  Their customer service is terrible.  I have had several issues that have not been resolved, despite many calls to customer service... Sometimes local text messages do not go through for no apparent reason.  When I am roaming, I can sometimes get incoming roaming calls, but I cannot get or send texts.  (Cricket said text messages are not guaranteed in their roaming areas.)  Another issue -- I pay extra for international texting, but can only send out texts, I cannot get incoming international texts.  The last and most serious issue is that the voice quality is very BAD.  Callers on the other end sound unclear and there are brief pauses of silence that make having a conversation very difficult.  Friends say I sound muffled and robotic and are begging me to get a new phone / plan!

3.description: I cannot fathom how much I love this place. I bought a futon from here. $250 with double storage compartments ! That's a steal for sure. I also bought an entry bench with hooks for coats and an under rack for shoes $80. I highly recommend this place. It is a gem for sure.

1.description: More of a thrift store than a vintage shop, but they have a good collection of housewares and furniture. All the furniture pieces have signs on them with dimensions which is helpful, and some pieces are in great shape.

2.description: Honey, let me tell you, if you want a deal... scratch that, if you need a deal, THIS is the place to go. Well priced and not too distracting in its set-up.

5.description: Found couch on Craigslist. Will was kind enough to hold it for me for 2 days until I could make it to the store. I purchased an awesome sofa sleeper that was going for twice as much anywhere else I looked!  Highly recommend!

6.description: One of the best Thrift stores in Chicago. It's worth the drive from the Suburbs.  New items added frequently making each visit unique.

7.description: I don't really want to give up this secret wonderland of fabulous thrifting, but I want them to stay in my neighborhood FOREVER.  They are an independent shop, so its nothing like the chains. They get great furniture and ART.  I have a BNB and have furnished the entire apartment from this place. (With serious style!!)   Cermak grocrery is next door so I get a 2 for 1 trip by hitting it up about  twice a week when I get my groceries. They seriously get new merchandise ALL THE TIME.  I have yet to be disappointed there and I've been no less than 52 times. Ok,  secrets out.

8.description: Need to be careful when buying appliance that can't be test in store.  The staff said it worked, but it didn't, and they refused to repair or pay the repair.   Got it repaired by myself, but they should have told me the truth earlier.

0.description: I love finding deals on used furniture, clothing and household items and this place did just that.While driving one day, I noticed this store, Free Parking lot across the street -Bonus!!I was able to grab some shabby chic dinner plates, a king size duvet cover and cute piece of art work!I'll be back for sure:)

4.description: It's a great neighborhood joint with cool stuff.  I found a vintage office desk and the owner even helped me move it.  I swing by all the time looking for fun stuff.  It's the best secret in Bridgeport.

29.description: Walking in to BBQ Patio, you will pass by one of probably the last few indoor payphones in Chicago.  Passing through the second set of glass doors, you'll likely first notice the motif that seems to combine a standard diner setup with these HUGE potted plants that just give off this crazy vibe.  I don't know what they have to do with anything, but they seem too large to not be pure coincidence.Well, when it comes to BBQ-type diner joints with a wide grill, I go for a burger.  And they have a "Patio Burger" that's a half-pounder.  "With bacon and cheese, everything, hold the tomato and make the onions grilled." - that's my favorite way to order up a nice burger, you know?And their giant burgers come with fries.  So you can get a double-1/4-pound burger for $4.25 and no fries, or the 1/2-pound Patio burger that comes with fries and coleslaw for $5.09 - logic dictates getting the fries (since a small order by itself is $1.55) and so did my tummy.During the wait, I looked around.  The bathrooms are hidden (behind two giant potted plants, of course) and there is just stacks of condiments and accoutrements for the picking if you're dining in.  There are two small TVs on the sides by some groupings of tables.  And given the "patio" title, they do in fact have tables outdoors for your dining pleasure.  Of course, you've gotta grab the tray of food.  As it says on their menu, "We Deliver, We don't Serve."I eventually was handed a large Styrofoam container put into a paper bag.  Upon getting home, I found that they had indeed given me tomatoes, which signals something in my brain as not good.  The onions were nicely grilled, though.  The fries - mediocre.  Nothing to write home about, but nothing worthy of great complaint, either.I admit that while waiting, I saw some of the best-looking gyros I'd ever laid eyes on being served up to another family.  My burger escapades aside, I will definitely be back to test drive one of those lamb-y lovelies.  And, of course, for the "Home of Chicago's Favorite RIBS!" claim on their menu.If you're willing to put it on your menu as fact, you'd better be able to back it up with your food, folks.Until then, I'll just call this place "weird nostalgic diner serving a decent but not-spectacular burger and fries".

42.description: The food here is served by a very friendly staff and all the food will make your mouth water. If your looking for alot of food for low price get the 1/2lb burgers, ribs tips or the gyros. After your done you'll be sitting back wanting to unbuckle your belt to another notch. It can be alot to take at once.My only complaint are the shakes. They use syrups to flavor the shakes so no real fruit. It comes out very bland and you can really tell there's lack of fruit.

23.description: It's cool.  A place with a drive-through where you can get a rib tip dinner and a gyro is alright with me.  I can get cheaper and better tips and gyros elsewhere, though.

8.description: Just got bbq patio delivered and it was horrible! The fries were cold, the mushrooms burnt, the burger was cold and the bun was so greasy I couldn't even pick it up. This is only the second yelp review I've ever written, but the food was just so bad, I felt I needed to.

31.description: Driven by this place a bajillion times because it's on the way to the bf's house. Kinda always wanted to try it. The boy planted the seed for ribs and he's not a BBQ guy so I had to jump when he mentioned it. Neither of us wanted to travel too far (further north than 16th street, that is haha) so we stopped here. YUMMY. We both ordered the large rib tip dinner which comes with choice of fries, baked potato or something else I can't recall and coleslaw plus garlic bread for a whopping $9 and change, under 10 is great in my book! Add on a giant drink (the bf) and a medium beverage and we're out the door for $25. I was initially hesitant because the sauce was more red for my liking but I loved it. Also, I never quite understood the point of bread coming with a BBQ meal but I totally enjoyed the side of garlic bread! Fries were up to my standard, again I'm a conisseur of fried potatoes, specifically the french kind =). The coleslaw even met my standard. A tad sweeter would be nice but then again diabetes in the future would not be. Fear not the area my friends....while we were dining 8 police officers were also dining. If you're looking for a place to rob...this IS NOT the place. Rather speedy service and the staff seemed to be friendly. I did notice that some of the officers waited a bit long for their food, perhaps they wanted to get their order perfect.In my best Terminator voice: I'll be back.

34.description: A nice little BBQ place.  The rib tips were pretty tasty and I loved the garlic bread.  And the police were in the house, so it must be good...or free.

16.description: Went to the Drive through for my ordered. I was the only customer in the place but it took almost half-hour to get my food. I ordered the hot wings and the cheesy beef.  Hot wings were pretty tasty, they crispy on the outside soft on the inside and fell right of the bone.  The cheesy beef was OK. My fault though, thought i was ordering something else. The cheesy beef there is pretty much Italian beef in a bun with some cheese. On the wings alone this place would have got a 5 but because of the wait and the mediocre Cheesy beef it's getting a 3.

13.description: this plastic is Dimond in the rough.they have something for everyone.great place for your comfort needs. very hard for me to order one item. hope that was helpful advice.

11.description: I am all for an outdated grease hut, but this one was a sad disappointment. The rib tips had little to no meat worth picking at, ribs were pulled out of something that looked like a kraft singles wrapper and were a haunting gray color. Worst tamale I have had in a while. Fries were decent. The coleslaw is the one thing that saved this from getting a one star rating.

39.description: I haven't been to this place in ages, but was hungry so I decided to stop in. The smell is soo good.. the open grill is mouth watering.  I went for the burger and mushrooms.. awesome as always.  Big burgers with all the toppings... Big menu for every kind of eater.  Definitely check this place out.  Can get busy, but its well worth the wait.

37.description: I've always gotten carry-out here because it's near my work. Never tried their BBQ but their gyros are delicious and the ONLY thing I've ever tried. Their cheese fries are delicious too and I'm a huge fan of cheese fries. I'll try some of their other items if I can resist the temptation of ordering the gyros.Tasty and inexpensive! Best place for lunch.

0.description: It was a cold Thursday evening and was heading home from the South Loop when I no longer could tolerate the bumper to bumper traffic on I-55. I decided to exit and wait it out a bit with a nice order of Rib Tips. The actuall dinner comes with garlic bread and your choice of Rice Pilaf or Fries plus a drink. The bbq sauce is addicting and they were generous with it. The Rib Tips were tender with a slight char to them and definitely easy to consume.The BBQ Patio's menu is quite extensive and appears to be more than just ribs. I notice half chicken, NY Strip steaks, Gyros and the list goes on and on.In the end I was happy not to be stuck in traffic and absolutely satisfied with a great meal!

38.description: There was a meat fest! We shared a large rib tip meal. It came with cole slaw, garlic bread and fries. It was quite a generous helping of rib tips. They were tender and flavorful. There was a bit too much sauce slapped on but I used it to dip my fries. The garlic bread was surprisingly good. This was more than enough food for two people. I'm sure we could have gotten by with the small version of this platter. 1 Large rib tip meal + tax = $10, enough for two people.

27.description: Please get their rotisserie chicken in bbq sauce. Please. I want everyone to enjoy this amazing experience. I love the rice pilaf and garlic bread and you get that with almost any meal.I also get the chicken breast plate with rice pilaf and salad and garlic bread. I've also seen people eat the ribs and it looks amazing! There is so much to choose from and you will for sure leave with a happy, full tummy:)
