32.description: I've had a few things here and have enjoyed it each time.  First, however, you need to understand that this place is a fast food setting kind of retro but nothing special.  So, don't expect a lot on that front.  It appears to be clean and on the front - and in the cooking area, things look very well maintained.  I have had the Gyros platter and I love it.  The only thing I make sure to do is ask that my fries are "well done"  - I like those type of fries a bit crisper.  The portion on the fries was average but they were very generous with the meat and the sauce and pita were tasty.  I have had their cheeseburger also.  A standard sandwich but tasty and well prepared.  The fixings are always put on correctly (have had a problem with that at other places - go figure).  If you have a taste for a burger, this will satisfy.  Although I do have to say that I usually switch up to a double cheeseburger because I'm a little piggy.  The Chicken Breast salad is a favorite of mine.  First, they don't skimp on the chicken.  A major complaint that I have at most places.  The chicken appears to be grilled nicely and has a nice flavor.  Very tasty.  Instead of getting a dressing, however, I ask for marinara sauce on the side and they automatically gave me two sauces.  On the service front, I thought that was fantastic.  It came in handy and it was very delish.  Pour it on and mix it up.  Everything melds together quite nicely.  The spaghetti is good but not too exciting.  I generally don't like eating spaghetti outside because I loved my Mom's so much.  However, it was good enough as a meal and I would order it again.  Just remember, it's your average dine-out spaghetti but good enough.  Today, I am trying their chicken parmigiana and look forward to it.  I love their chicken and my sister told me they don't bread and make it a deep fried fat fast.  So, on that front, I'm happy!  Can't wait to try it today!Now, if their was a separate rating for the service, I would give them a 5.  I have only eaten inside once so my experiences have been on the take-out end of things.  The woman that answers the phone at about 11:45 - 12pm (seems to always be the same) is very nice, has a great memory and is just very nice to talk to.  The delivery woman is very nice, prompt and friendly.  I have to tell you, on the customer service end of things, on this take-out front, I am a happy camper.  I appreciate this type of service, especially in today's day and age of slipping customer service skills.

44.description: A nice change to all the Mexican food take-out joints in the area.  Surprisingly, for a place that resembles just your average greasy spoon fare, they do dish out some tasty food.  Try their rotisserie chicken with rice for a nice alternative to the burgers, hot dogs, and sandwiches they sell. (But are very good.)  They do have outdoor seating in the summer, but most of their food is carry out.  They do get rather crowded during the lunch, so if you have a large order, be sure to phone it in.  The service is usually pretty friendly and prompt, and the prices are pretty reasonable for the portion size.

24.description: I haven't actually had any of their BBQ, but they have the standard burger joint fare.  I've had the gyro and burgers there, with each being a bit above par.

7.description: Ribs were gross

40.description: Just googled to see what was in the area and come across this local gem.  Came in for lunch craving bbq ribs and so glad i got them, i am not disappointed!  1/2 slab baby back ribs, with a baked potato and garlic bread  -  yum it was enough to feed a horse, but i packed half for tomorrow's lunch.  The person taking the order was nice enough, everything went smoothly!  We had a pleasant experience dining in, got there early enough to avoid the rush and had good seating.

30.description: I have been having a taste for a gyro for a while now. In Bridgeport it was hard to find a good gyro, George's wasn't worth yelping about, and BWR wanted way too much. (Over eight bucks for just the sandwich are you outta your mind?). We moved this week, and this place is within walking distance from our apartment. Seeing that they serve gyros made me want to stop in. The promise of some good BBQ will make me come back and try other things on the menu. I sat in. Its a very small no frill's dining area. What do you expect from a fast food place though? Service was to the point. They ask what you would like you place your order you wait a short time grab your tray and sit down. My gyro was rather tasty. Now I can't say it's my all time favorite gyro but it certainly hit the spot. They also stuffed my pita bread to the point of hard to eat. Fine by me! They were also really generous with the sauce which a lot of places aren't so that was nice. Fries were good but needed a little bit of salt and would have been better extra well done. Add a diet Pepsi and it was a very filling tasty lunch. Price came out just under eight bucks too. so it was rather reasonable.

1.description: The food is good, especially their Gyro plate. The only bad part about it is that they close kind of early so they're not open too late. It's been there for years and service is good too.

9.description: If you like waiting three minutes at the drive-thru speaker before being acknowledged by anyone, then being asked at the window whether you're there for a pickup order, then paying nearly 11 dollars for an average-sized, average-tasting gyro sandwich with no tzatziki sauce and three tiny tomato slices on it, plus mediocre fries and a dinky drink, this is the place for you! If you like good food at good prices and don't understand how a gyro sandwich combo could cost nearly 11 dollars when the sandwich alone costs just $5.45 (even though, truth be told, you added cheese to the sandwich), you should probably take your business elsewhere.

26.description: We had the rotisserie chicken in bbq sauce, and it was literally in bbq sauce. I thought it was cooked to perfection, because the meat was falling off the bones. Also their rip tips were amazing. I didn't care for the fries, but I did like the rice pilaf and the garlic bread. The whole meat was about $20.16 it was a good deal.

25.description: Everything a fast food spot should be.  Great food at affordable prices.  I had the half chicken dinner with barbeque sauce. It came with awesome oven roasted potatoes, garlic bread, and cole slaw. Everything was great.

12.description: The rib tips dinner is great, lots of meat and sauce and the flavors are Classic BBQ nothing fancy just great local food. Been coming here for over 15 years.

21.description: I love the Gyros here! I I have tried the gyros in different places and always end up coming back here! The onion and tomatoes are fresh.

17.description: The food has always been great here, mostly everything good except the fries they should go with natural cut instead of frozen. I Ordered some food for pickup arrived at the place through the drive thru paid for the food and the girl who was at the window took my money and didn't even say "thank you ", have a nice day or anything that was rude.

10.description: Just ordered a large order of rib tips from here and they are delicious! The order comes with a perfectly baked potato, some coleslaw and a slice of garlic bread. The rib tips are so tender that they're practically off the bone already and theres not too much far in them. It's also large enough for two. The BBQ sauce is great too! I would definitely recommend this neighborhood spot in Bridgeport, they deliver and they have a drive thru. First time I've ordered from them and I will definitely come back. Happy camper here! :)

5.description: Gyros were delicious !  Pleasant staff. Free parking or drive-through. Authentic Chicago ambiance: Formica tables. Picture of President Obama when he was a young president with no gray hair. A couple tables of police and firefighters complained about the lousy economy and lousy politicians. A couple who were utterly lost in each other's eyes sat under a loud TV played sitcoms.

35.description: I don't live far from here and have been driving past for years without stopping . I checked the reviews on yelp, and we finally checked this place out. I was expecting a lot based on the other reviews and have to say I was pretty disappointed. We went around 6 pm so there wasn't anyone in the dining area, but there were cars in the drive through. The woman at the cash register had an unpleasant disposition. We got , 2 gyros, a large fry and a patty melt. The fries were crisp, soggy, crisp, soggy, completely inconsistent, which was puzzling, since they looked picture perfect. The gyros meat had not been warmed up on the griddle like my usual gyros place does it, so the gyros seemed cold . I don't know if this was an oversight on the gyros or what. Our diner with the patty melt was happy with it. The dining area and rest room were very clean, which is not always the case at some of these stands.

19.description: For the name Bbq I expected so much more.,my boyfriend got the rib tibs & they taste like they use open pit barbeque sauce (gross!) they truly do not have much on the barbecue selection. Its a glorified hotdog restaurant, but I've been too much better. oh yeah I got the gyros, the meat was ok should have been cooked longer, but the cucumber  sauce was tasty. I don't think I will be going back anytime soon.

28.description: I've driven by this place like a gazillion times & never thought to stop by until this weekend when my BF said he wanted BBQ.  And I didn't even notice before that they have a Drive-Thru! ( That's whats up!!) I ordered the Italian Beef (because I haven't had 1 in years) & it was really really good. Could've used more sweet peppers... My daughter got the cheeseburger which was pretty big. My BF ordered the rib tips. Here, I will quote him, "They were pretty good. Sauce was pretty good. Not the best BBQ that I've tasted but it was pretty good. The slaw was delicious." Lol. When I got home the large fry was MIA but really, what drive thru DOESN'T screw up an order??!! You can't blame anyone but yourself when you drive off & don't check the contents so I won't gripe about that. I will do a follow-up review next time I go back and try the BBQ. It's so fattening so it might be awhile.. And I'm a very harsh BBQ critic. Nothing like Texas BBQ, I don't care what NOBODY says... Yeehaw!!

3.description: I'd fire the employees working tonight's shift. It's 8:42pm and they wouldn't take my order because "they closed early tonight". Simply put, that's the last time I come to this place! Makes me wonder what other corners the lazy employees cut there.

33.description: Never knew about this place til reading about it on Yelp. I ordered the small rib tips platter and my guy got the gyro.Ribs were tender and BBQ sauce had a bit of kick to it. I wish there was a bit more sauce though. Fries weren't all that great, but I guess with the BBQ sauce just made me keep eating them. Garlic bread was good, but the cole slaw was bleh.Gyro had a nice flavor, but I prefer the ones from Greek Town. Would go back and try other items off the menu.

43.description: Thank god i found you! I just had a delicious meal on your patio. There was almost a line out the door, and the food was pretty good for your typical southside chicago restaurant. I'd usually only stop by these places when i feel the need to over eat, or drunk. So it was good to see that they also had salad and regular non-greasy sandwich options. The place is filled with big burly construction type men, who get the BBQ Plate, ( which is load with salad, meat, fries or rice, garlic bread, and a drink $7.00). I also think that your drive through window will probably come in handy, in the near future....

2.description: GrubHub helped me find this local gem with quick, cheap delivery. Very salty BBQ sauce, but good. (Consider asking them to use half the amount of sauce.)Their casual food brings back all the joy I loved about 80's movies, music and culture. Quality, happiness. ;-)

18.description: With half-a-dozen cops dining here, I knew it had to be a trustworthy lunch spot. I'm a fan on their thick milkshakes and chicago-style hot dogs, which are served quickly. Since there's good Mexican food down the road, it made sense that the tamale was sub-par. Haven't had their gyros or bbq, but the gyro is next on my list.

41.description: took a chance on this place...and was very happy with my choice, ribeye sandwich real good.. i recommend it.

4.description: Very good prices on all of their food. The Chicken Breast platter is my favorite! If they could open the drive thru they can see an increase in sales... Just a tip

6.description: This is a quick lunch spot in the area.  I was a little unimpressed with the food, I ended up getting the rib tips and I should have known going in that they would be extremely hard to eat.  Note to self- eating rib tips as a female with male co-workers probably isn't the best idea.  The BBQ sauce wasn't anything out of the ordinary, and there wasn't too much meat on my rib tips.  Next time I think Ill just try the regular ribs.  The fries they come with are your typical fries, seasoning on them would do wonders.   It also took awhile for our food to come out even though it's one of those places that you order from the counter and sit at the booth until your name/number gets called.The Greek salads looked great though!  I'll have to try that the next time I'm here.  I really wanted to like this place, because I'm partial to BBQ diners, and it was good but wasn't blown away like I was hoping.

22.description: their rib tips is a must try ! its a pretty big portion even for a small and the BBQ sauce is just delicious! their gyro sandwich is pretty good too.

15.description: Never knew about this place til reading about it on Yelp. I ordered the small rib tips platter and my guy got the gyro.Ribs were tender and BBQ sauce had a bit of kick to it. I wish there was a bit more sauce though. Fries weren't all that great, but I guess with the BBQ sauce just made me keep eating them. Garlic bread was good, but the cole slaw was bleh.Gyro had a nice flavor, but I prefer the ones from Greek Town. Would go back and try other items off the menu.

20.description: Once upon a time I didn't like the Patio, but they have gotten better. the bbq sauce is where its at in this place. The 1/2 chicken with bbq is what my hubby got tonight and he had no complaints other than the portions were to  big to finish.I got the gyro plate, which was pretty good and very big I shoulda ordered 2 pitas because their was enough meat for 2 all. in all the place is worth going to. However if I want ribs I'll continue to go to Uncle Johns no place in chicago can beats uncle on the ribs

36.description: The food was very good. The rib tips were smoked and the service was awesome. I can't wait to go back. It's a must try.

14.description: The food was good but they second time I ordered my food through grubhub and tipped them before they came, the guy lied and said the door was  locked just so he wouldn't have to come up to our floor. I was so pissed. never ordering from there again.

3.description: Not bad for a neighborhood joint. Pizza can of pop and fries for $6 the pizza was pretty good. Papa Freddy was a little creepy. I'd be back for the lunch special

1.description: Not really big on leaving reviews (especially bad ones) But after always hearing good things about this place I decided to give it a try.I called in to place an order and was hung up on immediately. Thought perhaps my phone service dropped the call, I decided to call back. I begin to place my order and was told they did not serve an item I was asking for. I told them I thought it was since it was clearly posted on their menu. I was then told to "Take it or leave it" before being hung up on once again. I would have never wasted my time if I would have known the service would be like this.Don't waste your time on a place like this

2.description: I ordered a pizza and asked for it well done. Well when it arrived it was still raw and I called right a way and made a complaint they said it was too late to remake it so the lady said I can call back and they will replace it.So I called yesterday to get my pizza and they said I will only get free toppings WHAT???? I'm assuming I was speaking to the owners daughter she had an attitude no so nice nor friendly. I asked to speak with the owner and I can hear her speaking in Spanish "ESTA MUJER NO QUERIE HABLAR CONMIGO" like if I didn't understand Spanish. Then the owner said I would only get $5 off DOUBLE WHAT??? so I told him then in that case you should have come back for your pizza but by now it's in the trash cause my family doesn't eat raw pizza. NEVER ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN NO CUSTOMERS SERVICE

9.description: the pizza is amazing *-* especially the pepperoni and ground beef pizza. wway better than pizza nova ha sorry pizza nova

10.description: Burgers are great, but these guys like to close super early so I can't get a pizza delivered after like 8pm. Apparently it's not safe to order a pizza with a credit card at night, according to the blond broad that works there. *shrug*

4.description: Freddy is a good dude who has been in the neighborhood a long time. His pizza slice specials are the best around for some good tasting pizza. Love having this place down the block when I get a pizza craving and only need 5 bucks and get a pop and fries too:)

6.description: I am a Grammar/Spelling Nazi.  I can admit to that.  I'm also totally willing to overlook certain things.  For example, when a Chinese buffet can't spell an American dish and "buffalo wings" becomes "bafflo wings".  Or when a Mexican restaurant things BYOB stands for "bring your own beberages".  Or when another Mexican coffeehouse says "we accep credit cards" and "we delivery".But this is a good-ol'-fashioned burger joint and unless you're luring customers in with a hilarious play on words, how you present your establishment with words says a lot about your business.I'm willing to allow for leniency when it comes to letterboards, because you only get so many of each letter.  I winced when I saw the words "FRENCH FRY'S" up there, but I figured there was short supply of e's or i's.  And abbreviating "chicken" to "chix" is common shorthand and I can see past that.  My real qualm when ordering here today was the fact that their letterboard menu actually contains the following:"SALADS TOSSED $4.00"It doesn't appear to be an intentional joke, and it's incomprehensible why you couldn't use those letters (fewer, I might add) to spell "TOSSED SALAD", because that's how everybody orders it.Anyway, once my brain fervently tried to ignore that blemish on the overhead menu, I ordered a pizza puff.  I was given the choice of "small or large" and when asked what the difference was, I was told that the larges are handmade.  Which means that they're charging over $4 for what I assume are the small pizza puffs you can purchase at Dominick's or a gas station for often less than $2.  I went with the large, hoping for something along the lines of the monstrous "pizza puff" you can get at Freddie's on 31st and Union (which would be better-described as deep-fried calzones).I wound up paying $9 for a pepperoni pizza with a layer of crust on top.  It could have been considered a calzone, but it was too hard to tell because in the half-hour it took to get home, the fact that it was already sliced up meant that the grease and cheese and sauce had leaked out, mixed with the cardboard of the box, and turned the box into just as soggy and gelatinous of a mess as the "pizza puff" left inside.Altogether, a disappointment.  What's worse is that while waiting for my disaster to finish cooking, I witnessed a man paying over $9 to get a cheeseburger (that came with fries) and a liter of soda.  Disgraceful.

12.description: Papa Freddy's Pizza . .........Yummy. I usually look inside this place when I am waiting for the 35th street bus to Cottage Grove. I have known about this place since I was a 13 yr. old kid. I think it was the Damen Snack Shop back then. I can't remember if it belonged to Papa Freddy yet or not. I think it was because I can remember my friend talking about how good Freddy's pizza was. To think it has taken me this long to actually eat there. I have gone in a few times to buy a soda while waiting for  my bus but I have never ordered anything to eat. Well, that's history now. I was coming back from Target with my little boy. I had promised to take him inside to eat a pizza special and the other day ,I did just that. He has been anxious to eat there ever since we started waiting for the 35th street bus outside of Papa Freddy's after shopping at Target. He pointed out to me that the painted windows outside say " Sausag" Pizza. Maybe over the years, some street punk scraped off the "e" in Sausage from the window. Well, I ordered 2 Pizza specials. That's a slice of your choice of Sausage, or cheese pizza with a can of soda, and some fries. The slices were pretty big , they were cut into these little squares. I don't know if that's how they serve it up always or not. The next time I will have to ask them not to cut it up in tiny little squares like that. Also the fries weren't bad at all. I forgot to mention that if you want a slice of Pepperoni, it's 30 cents extra. The pizza special is $5.50 cents. The same special, pepperoni is $5.80. They served us pretty quickly I have to say. Both me and my son enjoyed it, and really there was no complaint with the food at all. The only complaint I have in my review is this. It was hot on the day we went in to eat. There was no air conditioning. They had a fan on a table and basically it was just blowing hot air all over the place. I think they used to sell hot dogs outside or something because there is a retired bright yellow Hot Dog cart parked right inside of the place. Beside that, I enjoyed my first ever visit to Papa Freddies Pizza. It's easy to get to just by getting on the 35th Street bus going either East, or West. And also the 50 Damen bus going North or south. It's right on the corner. How easy is that. If you are driving, there is a gas station right across the street. Parking? I guess yes, around the neighborhood side streets. I will be going back because they gave us some coupons before we left, and I also noticed a sign in the window. Another special. A 10 Dollar pizza special. Yummy.

5.description: I use to live in the neighborhood and came to this place everyday  they have great pizza. The prices went up a little bit  but for the pizza its worth it, you wont be let down,  if u go in tell freddy  mike sent ya

11.description: We have been ordering pizza from here for over 2 years now. The pizza is delicious, however, the customer service isn't that great. They are always super busy and rush you off the phone when you order, the blonde lady in particular. They appear to be chatty & friendly but let them mess up your order and they can become rude & unaccommodating. There were countless errors with our orders over the years that we dismissed because we just love the pizza but this time I will say we will no longer be customers. We are "regular" customers as we order pizza for every PPV fight, every gathering we have, party, etc. We do not order out unless we order from Papa Freddy's. A week or so ago I ordered a Family pizza and they replaced the 1/2 spinach and mushroom order side with sausage. I called before even touching the pizza and the man told me that they would just replace it since it was already very late, close to 10pm and my kids had not even eaten yet and would have to wait another hour to get a new pizza. The other half was cheese so at least they got to eat, we do not eat pork so the other half was trash. We took the "credit" and called it even. I called tonight to order the "credit" pizza and was told that they would just charge us $18! The pizza was $20! A $2 credit?? I told the blonde lady that that wasn't what I was told and he told me he had written my name down with a credit for a family pizza. She said that they NEVER credit a whole pizza and at the most will only discount $5 or come back, pick up the pizza and deliver a new one. I continued to press the issue that that wasn't what I was told and she put me on hold and came back and said we will take off $7 which is WAY MORE than what we EVER do! Wow! Then I said well if that's the best you can do this will be my last order and she hung up in my face! I previously  told her that we have been ordering from them for a very long time and she said well I've been here for 15 years, so?? Well, that being said, good-bye Papa Freddy's. Your 15 yr. veteran just lost you a good customer. We will steer our friends elsewhere as well.

8.description: I come here for a big, greasy , yummy slice of pizza when the desire strikes me (usually to cure a hangover) and I feel upset with myself all day-BUT IT IS GOOD!!The quirk of the people here is quite awesome. They are very chatty, friendly, and generous-from the young girl that is sometimes behind the counter, to the blonde lady that cracks me up every time.They also always have a newspaper on the counter, and I never read newspapers, so Papa Freddy's is my ticket to current events as well!

0.description: This pizza provided me with the energy needed to get me through those late college-study nights!  I can't tell you how many pies I've ordered from this place during my 4-years of learning!  My favorite pizza from here: green peppers, mushrooms, and olives!Yummy.....

7.description: My biggest regret of moving from Mckinley Park is missing out on Papa Freddy's.  The pizza is available by the slice, but the whole pizza is the way to go.  Sausage and Giardinara, ideally and its possibly the best southside thin crust available (well, up there with nick & vito's on 85th).  Burgers are juicy and messy.  Yes, they're with frozen patties but somehow better than most.  A jar of jalapeño slices is available for others with a taste for extra spice always.Partially covered up by the sign is the original brick work of the building which says "Damen Snack Shop".  A nice detail for people into those old Schlitz logos and so forth.  The counter is nice, but the window on damen is better for talking crazy to the blond woman while she feeds hot dogs to my dog.  "Papa Freddy" wears an apron all day, but I've never seen him cook.  He claims to have no connection with "Freddy's Hair Salon and Spa" across the street, but I find that highly suspect.  You have to buy something if you wanna talk to the young woman usually behind the counter, as the window is clearly and permanently marked that bus riders are not welcome to wait inside.

1.description: I lost the crave once I received the sloppy hamburger and the overly fried fish sandwich which I was not able to enjoy. The service here is pretty good but the food itself needs to be prepared correctly.

9.description: Went here before the 2003 All Star game, where Hank Blalock led the AL over the NL. For the first time, the AL would gain home field advantage in the World Series, because they won the All Star Game.Anyway, my dad bought a crave case and I ate 9 sliders. I didn't feel sick after, but I know a lot of other people call them sliders because, well, you know the rest!

23.description: It's White Castle... it is what it is so don't expect gourmet food.  Just the typical greasy (yet sometimes delicious) artery and digestive tract clogging junk you'd get from any fast food place.  I like this one because it's the branch that my friend Leo and I go to when we get the late night crave.It's near our homes and I enjoy doing the Harold & Kumar run at the drive through - look up Leo's photo from my friends list and you'll understand.=-PWord to yo' mutha!

12.description: I don't remember the movie too well, but my friend and I had a mission to go to White Castle. As a childhood favorite frozen burger, I was always intrigued by how damn good it tasted. The second I passed by a White Castle joint on the Chicago metro I made it my goal to get to one (they're not as common over here on the west coast!).It was probably not very smart of us to venture into this random part of town at around 9pm, but when we got there we ordered just about every single type of burger they had to offer. Consensus? Their only good one was the cheeseburger, and it tasted and was probably prepared the same way as the ones from the freezer aisles at Safeway. A bit disappointing, not to mention that we could have possibly gotten into a bit of trouble out there. Two girls, alone at night, with big scary black men loitering the area/in their cars who were mugging us as we took our photos and scrambled out of there--yeah, not the best idea.

21.description: I've never had any problems ordering from here.  The only downfalls is that you'd have to be a very patient customer.  Getting your order can take quite a bit of time... even when there aren't any other customers around.

16.description: One day while driving home I was having a craving.. so I popped on by and got a 30 case for the family. My wait was not too long and the staff was friendly and courteous.

17.description: On the way to Wrigley for work we stopped by the drive thru for breakfast. tired of McDonald's or Burger King and still needing something quick i was told this was the place to be. They serve bacon, egg and cheese sandwiches on toast...and it's f'n amazing! They try to do the McDonnald's style hashbrown, but its just not the same, nevertheless the two sandwiches I had were easily the best fast food breakfast items Ive eaten ever!

10.description: I got the crave... I'm a vegetarian and not a huge fan of onions or things in ring form but this WC (White Castle, not water closet) knows to make some pretty mean french fries. I used to stop here after work and get orders of cheese fries and regular fries at their drive through to eat on the way home... I know it's not healthy but in winter it takes around 2 hours to get home from work and the fries, as nasty as eating in the car may be, really make my day worth living. I like this WC because they make their fries kind of soggy (my favorite!) and they don't skimp on the cheese. Obvi, it's not your first choice to take a date but as far as guilty pleasures go, this place is 4 star.

5.description: Sometimes I wonder how I survive a night of drinking and debauchery. Then I remember that somehow I stumble into this white castle and their delightful little cheeseburgers makes my troubles go away. But it still has its legendary side effects you know what I mean. Flush Flush.

11.description: two words: impeccable bathroom.I was recently asked by a comrade In a arms to join him in a Small jaunt over to Dominick's for some tasty domestic canned beers when along the route I felt a tumble in my stomach.  After besmirching  the side of someones garage with my noxious contents of my bowels and colon I needed somewhere to "clean up" quick.  And like a beacon of white hope and buttocks cleanliness white castle shown brilliantly on a hot and humid Chicago night.  I was relieved to find the commode with out any needless locks and no need to ask for any key.  Inside it was bright and sanitary, and I found all the needed plumbing and electrical devices to be in fine working order.   After  the "clean up" I found a sack of four sliders with cheese to perfect and delectable antidote to my rare case of "bubble guts"special thanks to my friend for looking out for me while I did  the "mocha volcano" in the alleyand thanks to you: fine employees of white castle who no doubtingly properly dispose of the bathroom trash that now has and old pair of boxer briefs in it "lightly soiled"

22.description: CEO: People, we have a situation on our hands. We've been coasting on the unique flavor and soggy texture of our  famous slyder for far too long. And, frankly, we do  have the tiny, steamed, pre-made burger market  sucessfully cornered. However, we're still getting  killed in the burgeoning poultry-product sector. I've  got the board breathing down my neck, and if we don't  produce some McCompetition soon,  we'll ALL be taking turns in the burger steamer soon.. EXEC #1: We need a hook! Something that asks, "Am I  chicken? Am I not? Hop aboard and find out!"  EXEC #2: Hmmm...Gobbler Rinds?  EXEC #3: Poultry Tubes?  EXEC #4: Chicken Clumps o' Mystery? {Abruptly from the back of the room, a man rises. He  walks slowly, deliberately to the center of the room  and rests his palm on the conference table.  Maintaining eye contact with the CEO, he clears his  throat and begins} MAN: Gentlemen, the answer is quite simple. What do  people love? Reconstituted fried chicken--YES!--but  what else? What about reconstituted fried chicken *IN  DONUT FORM*?  EXEC#2: {Gasps!} You mean--?!  MAN: Indeed. Sirs, I offer you just two words:  Chicken. Rings.  {After a heavy moment of silence, a slow applause  erupts from an executive in the corner of the room.  Soon he is joined by another, and another, until the whole place is on its feet.}  CEO: Excellent! Our work here is done! Let's go eat  like 8 or 9 little fucking burgers each! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------OH MY--I DO LURVE MYSELF SOME WHITE CASTLE!  WE ARE WITNESS TO GENIUS HERE PEOPLE!

0.description: After going on a sad rant to my friends about how I just missed the opening of the White Castle in Vegas on my last trip there, I was told there was a White Castle a few blocks away from where we were staying Chicago. More importantly, it was open 24 hours! Not to waste any more time, we quickly drove there and ordered half a dozen sliders, some reg, some jalapeno. In my sleepless haze, I maybe ko'ed somewhere along the way and it wasn't until we were back at the apt and seated did I hear my friend tell me to try the chicken rings. Pretty sure the convo went something like this....Friend: Hey, you should try the chicken rings while they're still hot.Me: You mean chicken nuggets right? I didn't even hear you order them, lolz.Friend: No, I mean chicken...rings. Me: ....What do you mean rings?Friend: *hands over the box*Me: Holy mother of....*cue godly enlightenment sounds*So yea. Sliders were decent, in a cute concept-even-though-the-patties-don't-look-that-appetizing-even-for-fast-food-but-its-2:30am-and-everything-is amazeballs-right-now-so-I-ain't-trippin' kind of way. But those chicken rings thoooooo....Maybe it's cuz we came super late at night (early in the morning?) so they had to fry a batch up fresh for us but I swear the extra surface area due to the flat ringed nature of the shape (as opposed to a regular nugget lump) makes for SUPREMELY CRUNCHY GOODNESS. Crispy on the outside and tender processed chicken on the inside....late night fast food dining prolly hit it's peak for me that night.CHICKEN RINGS. Do it.

20.description: It's an average White Castle. But ....Service is usually really bad!Driver Thru can take forever!But hey...you still get your greasy slider without any lack of taste!

19.description: CEO: People, we have a situation on our hands. We've been coasting on the unique flavor and soggy texture of our  famous slyder for far too long. And, frankly, we do  have the tiny, steamed, pre-made burger market  sucessfully cornered. However, we're still getting  killed in the burgeoning poultry-product sector. I've  got the board breathing down my neck, and if we don't  produce some McCompetition soon,  we'll ALL be taking turns in the burger steamer soon.. EXEC #1: We need a hook! Something that asks, "Am I  chicken? Am I not? Hop aboard and find out!"  EXEC #2: Hmmm...Gobbler Rinds?  EXEC #3: Poultry Tubes?  EXEC #4: Chicken Clumps o' Mystery? {Abruptly from the back of the room, a man rises. He  walks slowly, deliberately to the center of the room  and rests his palm on the conference table.  Maintaining eye contact with the CEO, he clears his  throat and begins} MAN: Gentlemen, the answer is quite simple. What do  people love? Reconstituted fried chicken--YES!--but  what else? What about reconstituted fried chicken *IN  DONUT FORM*?  EXEC#2: {Gasps!} You mean--?!  MAN: Indeed. Sirs, I offer you just two words:  Chicken. Rings.  {After a heavy moment of silence, a slow applause  erupts from an executive in the corner of the room.  Soon he is joined by another, and another, until the whole place is on its feet.}  CEO: Excellent! Our work here is done! Let's go eat  like 8 or 9 little fucking burgers each! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------OH MY--I DO LURVE MYSELF SOME WHITE CASTLE!  WE ARE WITNESS TO GENIUS HERE PEOPLE!

2.description: Had a taste for some oatmeal, then I remembered that White Castle has oatmeal on their menu. Big mistake, I go in and there is 1 customer inside. The parking lot has 5 cars, where are the rest of the people? Looked over the menu and ordered the almond oatmeal and French toast sticks. Took my order home, and found the oatmeal was like a soup-filled with water. Tried to eat it, but too watery. Going back to McDonald's for their oatmeal, it taste better. French toast sticks were ok, is it something I would order again? Probably not

18.description: Why do we continue to torture ourselves,    why will we engage in attempting to digest the undigestible.  First off  I am not even sure I now how they are supposed to taste, every time I go they seem even more slippery or more chewy than the last time, as a kid I remembered their soda as being watery and overly carbonated.  This problem has been fixed, but at what cost.   The onion rings seem undercooked, flavorless, on the inside while the breading is  a matrix of doughy hardness, which doesn't sound right, but when I ate them I said" the outside is hard , with the tactile feeling of rawness, really fucking gross."   The fries always taste flat and unpotato like, even when you see them come up fresh they are the worst in the industry.     As far as Whities goes I have never experimented with the monthly specials.  On my last trip I waited in line for an excrutiatingly long time and the counter lady offered my some "fish nuggets" what kind of a ass refuses free food right.   They were the size you would expect from a nugget, that was the only thingthat live up to expectations.  A similar style breading from the onion ring but flecked with what I can safely assume was an Italian seasoning, you know the stuff that you would never find in Italy.Well they were like you can imagine a lesser fish treated in a very abusive manner and breaded with a completely inferior  batter.  The kind of a thing a cat would turn his nose up at.      So why, why do we abuse ourselves, maybe because the other chains just aren't that much better.  This is one of the great questions of my life, please help me if you can.  One disclaimer, Yelp forced me to give 1 star actually rating should be NA

13.description: When it comes to White Castle, the method of judgment that I prefer is examining the quality and speediness of a Crave Case.  After all, the Crave Case is one of the biggest selling points of White Castle and is prominent in much of their advertising (that doesn't have to do with chicken rings - and with all of the judgment of McDonald's in activist campaigns asking where on a chicken you can find the McNuggets, nobody's bothering to ask where on a chicken you'll find rings) - so why not make the true test for this location be their "signature dish"?Four friends and I decided to do just that.I must say that the price was good, the line moved quickly, and we received our case in just a few minutes - which is a good sign in my book.  Unlike places where ordering the signature dish is almost frowned upon and involves a long wait time because nobody ever orders the damned thing - to sell the Crave Case and not be properly prepared to churn one out as fast as possible once ordered would be a detriment to the chain itself.And the taste?  Excellent.  Well, as excellent as a cheap and small steamed burger with minimal condiments can be.  Just enough grease to allow it to slide down your throat.  Perhaps that is how the term "slider" caught on with these little morsels of satisfaction...It took possibly less time for four of us to devour the entire Crave Case than it took to order and wait for its arrival.  And yes, we would be back - to devour more bite-sized burgers conveniently placed in a suitcase-like container.Well played, White Castle...

4.description: I don't like White Castle. I think the burgers are disgusting.But I like chicken! So the chicken rings were alright.

6.description: There are times when my gf has a craving for white castle. Her favorites are the ranch chicken rings and the jalapeno cheeseburger. My only complaint is their pop machine. Their pop has a weird taste to it.. its hard to explain until you try it.

15.description: eeeeeeeeeeeh, can the service here get any slower. I could have parked my car and took a nap. Also a little rude, I don't likey. There's a better location going further south. Shoulda, woulda, coulda.

7.description: Sometimes this is just what you crave.Food is decent. Drive thru can take awhile though.

8.description: I never really liked their sliders... it was always a bit wet for me. Not sure why. They do have a few BBQ items on the menu recently. Seems like a few worthy items to be checked out. It really takes a while for the food to come out at the drive-thru though.

3.description: walked in, waited to order for 5 minutes. While waiting, one of the castle regulars cut in front of me. I left. Probably a  good thing, I didn't need to eat 2 bacon cheese sliders 2 chicken ring sandwiches and a loaded fries anyway

14.description: Usually only has a handful of people there talking or reading the newspaper in the day. Im not familiar with White Castle so i only order cheeseburgers.It takes a while until your order is ready.I used to go to white castle on 79th & pulaski on the south side but i dont go to school near there anymore

3.description: Bill is talented, friendly, and very affordable. I spent $35 dollars (with my tip) and my very long blonde processed hair was expertly shampooed with an incredible scalp massage, deep conditioned, then cut and styled. I had Bill take about 4+ inches off my shapeless, one length, generally wrecked mane. I feel like I got an absolutely fabulous and cool haircut. I don't want to see Bill get overrun or the prices go through the roof, but MY OH MY this place and stylist are really deserving of the five-star prize. What a find...I am so happy I went!

1.description: I found this place by accident as I was walking to go get a $10 haircut in the neighborhood.  There were so many places to go to but I always felt a little dread because it could be hit or miss with places charging that much.  So, this one day, I walked down Ashland north of 35th street.  I walked past A & B and did a double take because I did not see it before.  To be honest with you, I am not sure what prompted me to even check it out.  I think it was because my last $10 haircut sucked.  I was in this position as I was on a tight budget and did not want to spend the $35 plus tip for my last stylist due to my "unemployment" budget.  Of course, I didn't want to look like a mad man with exaggerated trims over my ears (like weird arcing or something) and other challenges like uneven sides etc. I started to feel like the $10 cut situation was actually making me feel less and less satisfied with the end results.  So, I called A & B and that was the start of my year plus love affair with this place.A man named Bill answered the phone.  You could certainly tell English was not his first language and I placed his accent as being most likely Chinese (since the neighborhoods around here have a heavy Chinese ownership rate).  So, let's be honest, as a mixed breed dude (Mexican/Lithuanian) and raised as an average American, I wasn't too sure how we would communicate as I have barely learned enough "English" to get by, let alone attempting any foreign language communication, but I took a chance.  He told me that a man's haircut was $20 and I decided I was going to give it a chance.  I am so glad I did.  The above was over a year ago and I am a VERY SATISFIED customer.  A gentleman, Cho, ushered me in and took good care of me that first day and then Bill came in and ushered me over to the shampoo chair and proceeded to give me a wash.  This was not your ordinary wash, I got an invigorating scalp massage and some expert water rinsing of the suds and hair conditioner.  Seriously, I wanted to fall asleep in that chair as it was so relaxing. Bill certainly tries his best to communicate and does an excellent job.  Let me say this, I was able to clearly get across to him what I wanted but then, on my second visit, I brought a picture.  Both times, this man was spot on.  Seriously blew my mind.  The cuts are precision and never rushed.  After your cut, he then takes you back to the shampoo area and you get a fantastic rinse and then back to the chair for drying and final styling.  Bill also treated me to a chair massage on one of my visits.  It was given by a wonderful woman named Ivy.  Though we had a little language barrier, just by genuinely wanting to communicate with each other, we ended up having a great time and laughing.  I was also in pure bliss with the massage and Ivy adjusted to my needs perfectly (we also had to be mindful of my right shoulder and artificial elbow area).  She was awesome. $12 for 10 minutes and it was well worth it and then some. By the way, Ivy is now my "First Wife" and they can explain the story behind that!  :)Some tips that will help you - 1)  They are always accommodating and you can call them at the last minute and they will get you in. I do recommend giving them a call to make sure.  To date, in the last year that I have gone there, never EVER have I not been able to get in at my time and taken care of.  2)  As I mentioned above, my first visit was a total success as the cut was awesome.  However, I brought in a cut  shown in a specific picture the second time, just to make it easier to show what I wanted that time, and he was spot on.   For the average customer that may not have the desire to try to bond with another human being in a natural non-rushed manner, this will be a time saver and make it very easy for Bill to give you the look you want to achieve. 3) I highly recommend  the chair massage by Ivy.  For this, I suggest calling in to make sure of her schedule as I believe she is off on certain days. Note - I also saw his prices for a woman's haircut.  I have been told that they are affordable compared to other places.  So ladies, I highly recommend you check out their pricing.  Bill is a master stylist and if you bring in that pic and give him a shot, I am sure you will not be disappointed.  The place is always clean in every area that I have observed.  Bright and nicely colored interior that is welcoming, energizing and yet relaxing.  Cho, Bill and Ivy have been wonderful and I even try to communicate via testing out my Google Translate app.  We have had a lot of laughs and I have to say, I truly appreciate this staff.  I took a chance in between cuts twice (both for even tighter budget reasons at the time) and I regretted it.  When I went in for a "hair rescue" on my next visit to Bill, he was able to seamlessly correct the challenges.  Check this place out, people.  I would be completely stunned if you do not enjoy your visit and the results.

2.description: They are moving soon to 3324 S Archer Ave so everyone can still know where to find them.

5.description: This is my first time at this salon and I am absolutely floored at how happy I was during and after my hair cut. Asian hair is not easy to cut as it tends to be very thin. Bill did my hair perfect! He made sure to consult me throughout the entire process and did not rush through it either. My hair looks 10x healthier and this is the first time I did not leave a salon upset. Nothing but good things to say about this salon. This is definitely a salon people need to try. As far as the cost, it might be one of the least expensive salons considering the length of my hair and the type of haircut I wanted.

6.description: I've been going to Bill (owner) when he was working at a salon in Chinatown Square.  I've been going to him for haircuts for about 10 years.  Before that I tried different hairstylists with no luck.  I am a girl and for all you ladies out there, don't you hate when the stupid hairstylists cut more than you tell them to?  Come to think of it, all the hairstylists I previously went to were all women. Seems the majority want to make you look ugly or something.  With Bill, he does a wonderful job layering my hair.  He cuts my hair to the length I want, no more, no less. A haircut for women cost $25 which is extremely reasonable given the time he spends on your hair.  Only thing I dislike is the person that washes my hair.  She does this weird kind of head massage while washing my hair which is a bit awkward and makes me a little uncomfortable.  Other than that, I would recommend him to anyone.

7.description: I first found Bill at the hair salon where he used to work in Chinatown Square several years ago, and since then, I have not wanted anyone but him to do my hair. When I called him up last weekend for a haircut appointment, he told me to go to his new salon on South Ashland Ave. ...and what a nice salon it is - simple but very clean and contemporary, and there's street parking right in front of the building as well as in an empty lot that sits next to it. Best of all, the price is right!! $22 for a cut and wash (even less expensive than before). Bill took his time to do a fantastic job. He mentioned to me that he used to run a hair and beauty salon business back in China where he originated from. His business thrived and grew to having 3 different branches, but he had to sell it since he moved to this country. I highly recommend Bill's service.

0.description: The owner, Bill, does a fantastic job every time. He takes his time and may not be the fastest hairdresser, but his work is of the highest quality.

4.description: I only go to this place for haircut although there're tons in Chinatown. Bill the owner has sophisticated techniques and friendly service. Great cuts!

3.description: As soon as i walked in i was taken care of, did the best they could and it was well worth it and definitely much needed! Ask for Evealon, she's great!

1.description: Came here because they took my insurance.They have name brand frames, yippie.Unfortunately, it's not worth the time and headache.They don't do appointments. Only walk-ins, so you have no idea how long you'll be there.The doctor seems to come and go as he pleases, and the staff seemed annoyed by his questionable schedule.when I did see him, he was very quiet, not inviting, and I'm sorry but when you're putting your hands that close to my face, I don't want them smelling like cigarette smoke. Just disgusting.My glasses were the wrong prescription. I gave myself a month to adjust but was in excruciating pain and couldn't see. He re-tested me and said that my prescription was correct. He still went ahead and weakened it for me.Do yourself a favor and go somewhere real.

2.description: This place is a joke if you care about the health of your eyes do not go there. Sold me faulty contacts and refused to exchange them. Expecting me to show them an irritated eye first. So they want me to wear it. Possible scratch my eye. So they can see its faulty

9.description: I return to Miami Optical because the doctor is knowledgeable, caring and gets to the point.  His staff could be more professional and friendly, but they do get the job done.

10.description: This place is shady! The staff is terribly unfriendly and the prices are outrageous. House of contacts my ass. Exam rates start in the &160s but prices are indefinite. The girl said the final price of the exam will be determined afterwards and prices for an exam could raise to the $300's. For an exam? Its bad enough we have to renew our prescriptions once a year.  To not know what price your getting is outrageous. You can find much cheaper prices in the area.  If you don't have full coverage optical do not go here. Prices for glasses exams are in the $60's but there selection is very limited.  In short. Dont go here. Unless you are insured or enjoy throwing your money away.

4.description: This place is awesome. I walked in without an appointment. They checked my insurance options and showed me my pricing right away. By the time I filled out my medical history, they were ready to give me an exam. Dr Hauser was very forward and to-the-point. The staff was also very helpful helping me select glasses. I came in just to set an appointment. I walked out 25 minutes later with a full exam and order for glasses. Great staff here.

6.description: Pro-Doctor was a very kind older man, knowledgeable, straight to the point, and quick-The man who does glasses adjustments is very kind and skilled and has a great eye for symmetry. I have lopsided ears, so my glasses in the past always had to be adjusted to appear level on my face.  The man felt the sides of my head and ear lobes.  Then he melted/shaped the plastic arms until they fit perfectly (they look very even and level) without slipping.-No appointment necessary to see eye doctor-I was in and out within half an hour-Affordable glasses-Opened until 7pm, very convenient for my busy work life-I can go back to get my glasses readjusted, free of charge.  Con-The front desk women have poor customer service-They could not figure out how to enter my insurance information. I had to call VSP myself and have it sorted out while I was in front of them-The interior has dim lights and old chairs.  It wouldn't hurt if they remodeled.

12.description: So... last year I realized that I needed glasses.  When I was driving looking for a decent priced gas station and would think that I just read $2.25 for unleaded and realized when I drove in that it was really $2.75 I thought that's it I need some glasses.  So after doing some research I ended up going here.  I called and asked to make an appointment and I was told that it was not necessary.  I walked in later that day filled out some papers and was seen within 10 min.  The eye exam was a fast and a learning experience.  The optometrist was nice and explained everything he was doing.  I was able to pick out my glasses that same day and they were ready within 2 days.This past summer I had a small accident with my glasses and I was able to walk in and get them fixed right away.  Since this is the first optical place I've ever been too I find the experience to be pleasant and easy every time I go in!

5.description: on 1-5-13 Me and my 2 children go here shortly before noon of course it was no one waiting to be serviced. The place is dirty carpet and chairs and reeks of odor and in need of serious upgrades. I was awaiting my 3rd child to arrive and one of the staff ask me if i had insurance i said yes VSP and my dependents are included but my daughter was on her way with the card. so she looks me up on the vsp website without even goign through the different vsp screens to verify my children were covered. She keep insisting i pay $52.00 for each. So my daughter arrived with the card verifying coverage for my dependents but this lady kept stating i pay additionally over my $5.00 co-pay. So i just walked out due to i did not want anything inside this dirty place. The odor was horrible. I will never again go here.

13.description: Dealing with the receptionist is a nightmare. The eye doctor isn't very patient. It takes too long to get a pair of glasses (6-8 weeks) if you pay by insurance.

11.description: My daughter just broke her glasses so I was kinda in a bind. I needed to call an eye doctor quick well I called a couple places. And was told I could get an appt.  in a couple of days. But she can't read the chalk board in class so a couple days was not good enough then I was told by my sister that they were quick and that they accepted walk- ins so I was out the door and sure enough we filled out some paper work and were in and out of there within 30 mins. which I think was awesome cause I didn't feel like sitting there all afternoon. The eye doctor was very nice and explained everything I'll be back next year when she needs her one year check-up :)

8.description: I used to come here back in the day when I was in high school (over 13 years ago) and this was the place my parents could afford.  Always had a pleasant visit.I'm not sure why I stopped coming here though.  I might give them a try again when I need new contacts.My daughter is on her way today.  Will update.

0.description: This place was a great choice for me.I decided to check this place out for my annual eye exam.When I called to find out if my job insurance was accepted. I was also giving great information about ( free parking, don't have to have a appointment and that I most of all I would receive a full eye exam)So the day that I decided to go it was about 10:30am.I didn't have a appointment but true me I didn't have to set for a long time.The place is very nice and friendly.The eye Dr. Was great and I enjoyed my exam.I was able to find a very nice pair of glasses.But this place has a very nice selection so get ready to like more then one pair.It was less the 2 weeks and I received a call that my glasses are ready for pick up. When I tell you I love my new glasses I love them.The prescription is great I can see so much better.I have not had any problems no headache no none thing.So if you are looking for a nice and friendly place that won't hurt your pocket check out this place you will be very happy that you did.

7.description: I like this place because it's affordable and the people are really nice.  An eye exam for glasses is $52.  They don't have the best selection of frames (at least for what I'm looking for), but you can just take the prescription and find frames elsewhere with no problem.  You can't make an appointment but you can drop in whenever, so it's first come, first served.  One time I had to wait over an hour, but another time I just walked right in and got an eye exam immediately.  Most if not all of the staff are bilingual (Spanish).  I'll be back again next year!Update: I have now experienced newer, less sketchy eye places that are well lit, have good frame selections, and new technology, and this place pales in comparison. Here, the machine has to touch my eyeball, and I just can't handle it.  The price is hard to beat, though.

28.description: We dined in and were very pleased with everything we ordered.I would give these guys a lot more business and 5 stars if they had online ordering or grubhub. I'm afraid calling for delivery would be a chore due to language barriers.

1.description: We waited forever for the food By the time the food comes, all we want to do is leave Most of the dimsum we ordered was cold By far the worse dimsum I had so far But the lunch like noodles and others are good Order was less than 30 bucks so I think the price is very good but if I can add 10 bucks for better quality food in other places, I rather do that

9.description: Really great buns and turnovers at the bakery. Definitely try the pork and shrimp turnover.  They're almost tempura - like crunchy on the outside with a chewy gooey inside and a savory delicious core. I'm totally addicted. The restaurant side is spacious,  though a little drafty. Free lot parking is a plus. If you eat here for lunch, be sure to get the lunch special with the egg roll and fried rice. Not the lunch box special which comes with a pretty gross soup that is just water and lemon (?)

29.description: Two star. One star for easy parking, another star for clean restaurant. And that is it.  The Dim Sum really is not very good.Shrimp Dumpling: the smallest shrimp I have ever seen in all Chinese Dim Sum place in Chicago.You Tiao (fried dough):  how many times have you fried this?  So hard and over cooked.Shaomai: is it a frozen food bought from the Chinese supermarket?Will not recommend to other friends.

23.description: We came by to try their dinner offerings, and had their dinner-for-four for $46.88.  It was a great value and included:- beef broth soup- sauteed lobster- chicken with ginger and onions- pork chop with onion- yu choy with garlicAdditionally, this all came with four overstuffed bowls of rice as well as free tea.  None of it was piping hot, but rather warm (except the cold chicken dish), but one can't expect perfection at this price.  This place is off the beaten path as far as a "Chinatown" dinner time meal, but if you don't expect fancy, but rather a good deal for a good meal, then you won't be disappointed.  We left quite satisfied.  Otherwise, they have quite an extensive dinner menu.  Note that they are BYOB also.  They also have free parking in their own little strip mall, and which is getting to be a rarity these days in Chicago.

5.description: We just ordered a fish filet rice noodle from here and this is the amount of noodle I got.  This is only 1/4 of the normal amount comparing to what most other Chinese restaurant would give you when you order a rice noodle dish. I called them back and they didn't even apologize and simply just asked me to take it back. I asked them to deliver it and they said it will take a while. We order food from here at least twice a week and their food quality is very inconsistent but we never  complain about it, but this time is beyond ridiculous. We will not go back again.

31.description: It's nice to get away from the craziness that is Chinatown. Chiu Quon Restaurant offers a nice getaway in a small plaza strip in McKinley Park/Bridgeport area that offers up authentic Chinese food in a not so-crowded restaurant and neighborhood.There are multiple large round tables to sit parties of 8 or so, and there are TVs galore. Get your Chinese game and talent show fix here, if you like. In terms of service, it's pretty good. I just feel like we have to ask for everything you want. e.g., tea, water, different sauces, etc.Now for the actual food, what a delight! I've been here on multiple occasions, and have had wonton noodle soup, salty/spicy fish, Singapore noodles, pepper steak, and more. All of it delivered on taste, presentation, quantity, and more.This is a great place to bring family and friends for lunch or dinner, and the price is just right. Just be careful, if you're ordering over the phone. Not everyone there speaks fluent English, so you may want to order by the number on the menu.

25.description: Bad , we order something to eat, and the manager write down the name of the dishes, we waited about 40mins , nobody come here , and then I went to the cashier to ask . They said we didn't order anything, just say sorry, they forgot .oh my god , we waited here40mins!!!!! Bad bad bad. I was so hungry, they made us so disappointed .

12.description: It's nice to get away from the craziness that is Chinatown. Chiu Quon Restaurant offers a nice getaway in a small plaza strip in McKinley Park/Bridgeport area that offers up authentic Chinese food in a not so-crowded restaurant and neighborhood.There are multiple large round tables to sit parties of 8 or so, and there are TVs galore. Get your Chinese game and talent show fix here, if you like. In terms of service, it's pretty good. I just feel like we have to ask for everything you want. e.g., tea, water, different sauces, etc.Now for the actual food, what a delight! I've been here on multiple occasions, and have had wonton noodle soup, salty/spicy fish, Singapore noodles, pepper steak, and more. All of it delivered on taste, presentation, quantity, and more.This is a great place to bring family and friends for lunch or dinner, and the price is just right. Just be careful, if you're ordering over the phone. Not everyone there speaks fluent English, so you may want to order by the number on the menu.

21.description: Finally! An authentic Chinese restaurant that 1. understands and speaks English 2. Has courteous & nice employees & 3. Also has authentic delicious chinese food! It is very rare especially in the area to find a Chinese restaurant that has all 3 elements of hospitality.  I ordered the small shrimp egg foo young and was very good. It came with a small order of white rice and my waitress was nice enough to get me another side of rice after I finished the first one. I never thought I would ever get full on a $5 chinese meal but I did. Atmosphere is chill, decor is on point and comfy. Still yet to try more from the menu but so far has made a great impression on me. I also ordered a bean cookie from the bakery side and was also good. I will be coming back Chi Quion! A lot better quality and quantity for price than most restaurants in Chinatown no joke, and I have been to almost all the big restaurants in chinatown too!

16.description: After our first time, we couldn't wait to return. And return we did, 4 times in fact. Had wonton noodle soup, beef noodle soup, pork chop, sweet sour chicken. We kept on thinking where did the flavor go? Soup are bland like water. Assorted dim sum were just not good, meaning they don't measure up for a Hong Kong style restaurant. Sticky rice had no flavor, again. It's like we were expected to add flavor ourselves!  We thought maybe the chef from our first time is no longer there. We want to keep liking this place, but food can't keep us coming back. Price is cheap, but the total lack of flavor can't justify another visit. We lost faith and quite confused about the huge drop in quality

17.description: We liked it! The Bakery turned full service restaurant was very nice. We had some dim sum and one fish fillet with vegetables over rice and a few boas.The food was good. I hope they will add options for more hot noodle soup dishes. I would return and eat there with my family and friends. It is a little escape from having to go to Chinatown for Chinese Food and bakery goods.

10.description: Been to this restaurant a few times.When it first open, food and services are great.Couple of month after it open, food and services become ok.The most recent time we been there, we decided we will never go back.Here is the story: We ordered 3 dishes even we only have 2 people, with two dishes over $10, which is consider expensive in this restaurant. When the dishes arrive, only one dishes was done right. One of the dish suppose to be cooked with veggie and pork in 1:1 ratio, but when the dish arrive, they put the veggie on top, we search through the dish and only found pork fat underneath the veggie, with no meat, then we know they try to use the veggie as a cover for their fault.The other dish, I look up the name of that dish on the internet right after it arrived, it is suppose to be done with pork intestine cooked in sauce (usually hot and spicy, but depends on the chief). But when the dish arrived, it was 12 pieces of pork intestine done in deep fry with no sauce what so ever (not even the dipping sauce for this particular deep fry style.) And this dish cost $13. How could they make such a mistake if they are Chinese?So we called the manager (a man in glasses to be exact) over, he start to treat us with an attitude, and question us rudely "what do you want us to do about it." With no apology at all.Conclusion: they will never see me again, period!

11.description: Bring back the original cook! When it first opened, the rice and overall food was tasty. Now, the rice is bland (mall fast food) and Mongolian beef is practically grizzle. The rice is eatable, yet forgettable. I will be incline to only order the dim sum in the future.

26.description: What a pleasant surprise ! I ordered some food, fried rice, Mongolian shrimp, & egg roll. It was good. The rice was not too greasy & everything else was good. Compared to other places here in Mckinely park this is the best Chinese food in the area. Quick & prompt delivery plus the driver forgot my pop & he was nice enough to come back & bring it to me. So whenever I feel like a fast delivery & good Chinese food this is the place for me.

27.description: I've waited a few weeks to write this review. I feel awkward leaving a bad review but I think that it is necessary so that others can make an informed decision before coming here. We tried to come here once before but there was construction on Archer and we could not get there. We decided to call to check that the construction was over before trying again. The woman who answered the phone obviously spoke very little English and did not understand what I was asking. She proceeded to hang up on me after several tries to explain my question. We called back to ask if the restaurant was byob. The man who answered also did not understand our question and hung up on us. Okay, so they don't speak much English. We were surprised that when we got there the man who greeted us spoke perfect English. Why doesn't this man answer the phone?? I can only guess that this place is geared for people who appreciate authentic Chinese food. I generally try to stay away from Americanized Chinese food so I would never order orange chicken or Mongolian beef. We did order egg rolls which were possibly the worst egg rolls that I've ever had. I think that they were not fully cooked because the inner part of the wrap tasted raw. I think that if they had stayed in the fryer longer they would have tasted fine. I ordered hot and sour soup which was probably the best thing that we had though the 'hot' was basically about two tablespoons of red pepper flakes dumped into the soup. Not really how I like my hot and sour soup. My husband ordered a noodle with vegetable dish. It sounds simple and it was simple but it should have some kind of taste. It was as bland as bland could be. Very unmemorable. I ordered chicken with ginger scallion sauce. The sauce was very tasty but the chicken presentation was a bit shocking. I am not squeamish but my husband almost lost his appetite when he saw the chicken. It was basically a half chicken, that was once boiled with the skin on, sliced into chunks and served cold. Not at all appealing. It seemed to have some warm broth on the bottom of the plate so the pieces of chicken sitting in the broth were warm. Otherwise it was cold. This is where I think there is a difference in taste between Americans and Chinese people. I am sure that someone would love this dish but we didn't. We were also disappointed that the bakery wasn't open yet as this was one of the reasons that we wanted to try the place. Only a few of the tables were occupied. The servers were friendly. I had high hopes that we would like this place but we won't be going back.

35.description: I've been going to Chiu Quon all my life and I have to say this addition to the chain does not disappoint.

8.description: Awful. Ordered the House Specialty "Mushroom Combination", at $11.95. Mushrooms were hacked up, barely cooked. And no black or any other type mushrooms, just white, including big stems. The whole dish was Brown and bland. Shrimp not deveined. It was like they just hacked up some mushrooms, threw them in the wok with precooked chicken and beef, threw in a few shrimp, and put some oyster sauce on the whole brown mess.

0.description: I love coming here for a quick grab of breakfast, lunch, or dinner. My favorite is usually the shrimp crepe, but depends on the chef. I once had a girl chef make it and maybe she was new, the skin was too thick... on another occasion, the shrimp was fishy tasting and was dampened by pepper... I was disappointed on several occasions, but it really depends on the day of the week I guess? The waitress has a good memory of my order so she will remember to add a chili oil for me when I order my crepe :DFor dinner, I recommend the salt and pepper pork chops, salt and pepper string beans, or the japanese tofu with king mushrooms. Half an empress chicken (basically the dinner for two) is also something I usually order too. For the price of approximately $25 you get half an empress chicken, garlic veggies, a soup, and a salt and pepper shrimp. I've tried the minced beef fried rice and it was just weird tasting to me (maybe it's because I'm not a big fan of red meat). During family dinner, you get a dessert on the house. Do give it a try in the McKinley Park area. It's actually not bad.

20.description: Good prices, good portions, good flavors, and good customer service. Plus free toss-ins when your order reaches different prices. I'm proud to have Chiu Quon representing McKinley Park, and hope more places of this quality pop up in the future.

19.description: Thought, what a great addition to the community. Tried To call in an order for deliver. No one answers when it's busy (Friday night service is horrible). Dined in on a slow Sunday afternoon. When my egg rolls came cold, I was surprised haw quickly my replacement came. They are not cooking as the orders come. When the main dish came part cold part steaming it was obvious the cook is sloppy with his reheating.

33.description: My husband and I visited the new Chiu Quon location in McKinley Park for the first time in mid-March. It was a really good experience. Not too crowded, lots of light coming in through the wall of windows, and very clean. We were treated like kings (and ate like them, too) for a total of $15. One of those pork buns was thrown in for free and we found it very tasty.If I'm not mistaken this place leans closer to authentic Chinese than other Bridgeport/McKinley Park restaurants. Usually that's a turnoff for my Panda Express-loving American palate, but not so here. I could tell the ingredients were really fresh and not drowned in the sauces.We will be back.

2.description: *sigh* I have been awaiting the day to experience Chiu Quon Bakery ever since I moved to Chicago. I chose to spend my entire walking around Chinatown. I'm a huge lover and supporter of anything and everything Asian, so im shocked it took me as long as it did (1.2 weeks) to make it down. Chiu Quon was the first stop on my journey. I wanted/needed breakfast so I knew some baked treats would do the treat. When I first entered I was so overwhelmed by all of the options. Honestly, I almost cried because everything looked so delicious but I knew I couldn't try everything I did a little research (via Yelp of course) to see what other Yelpers recommended customers try, so with that I ordered 1 BBQ Pork Bun, 1 Egg Tart, and 2 mini mooncakes.Oh. My. God.Orgasmic reactions to all 3 items I ordered. 1st, that BBQ pork bun was like the better looking cousin to the Sloppy Joe. That BUN was the softest of doughs - very similar to the Hawaiian roll! It was perfect. The Portuguese Egg Tart was scrumptious as well. The custard was very light and frothy, and the vanilla extract was very prominent throughout. What sold me was the crust. Very flaky and buttery. The perfect contrast to the custardy filling. Last but not least, the mooncakes. I have been dying to try mooncakes for almost a decade and now that I have finally tasted them, I may have found my new favorite snack. What I loved was the red bean paste for the filling. It was unlike any dessert I have ever had in my life, because there was a very vegetable-like taste to the cake, but it was sweet, and the outer dough was very sweet. It was just perfect. My ONLY complaint about this place is that it is CASH ONLY! I was unaware so after I ordered I had to track down an ATM and get charged $3 to withdraw :'( its 2015 y'all, let's move forward with your Point of Sales transaction technology

34.description: We always go to the Chiu Quon Bakery in Chinatown and Argyle, so what a surprise when we see they had a restaurant near us. The first time we came in for brunch and ordered almost everything on the dim sum menu and some. We had the chicken feet, stuffed tofu, steamed spare ribs, pork and century egg congee (I constantly dream about this), salt and pepper wings, egg foo yong, etc.. etc..Everything was tasty and fairly priced!The only downside is that the food comes one at a time and it could have come quicker, but that's also because they had just opened. So I have a feeling this will improve in time.   We liked it so much, we came back again. This time the owner remembered us and said hi. We ordered different items like the Beef Brisket soup (big big portion), Lunch Special with fried rice and roll. It was still a little slow but the taste makes up for it.If you go you to order the siu-mai (BEST EVER), congee, stuffed tofu and steamed spareribs. The owner says the full Bakery will be opening in a few months!

32.description: My friend and I tried this restaurant back in February and we really enjoyed it. Since then I have ordered take out three more times. My husband is very picky with his Chinese food and has only eaten from one or two other restaurants ever and he says this actually tops those. The prices are very good and the portions are large. We will definitely be ordering from here more often.

18.description: Bad , we order something to eat, and the manager write down the name of the dishes, we waited about 40mins , nobody come here , and then I went to the cashier to ask . They said we didn't order anything, just say sorry, they forgot .oh my god , we waited here40mins!!!!! Bad bad bad. I was so hungry, they made us so disappointed .

13.description: been meaning to try this place for a while.. finally got the chance to and it was let down.. went inside to order my carry outs.. after ordering it in english.. i notice they knew very little so i repeated my order in chinese which they speak.. even then they messing up the order.. had to repeat my order a few times for them to get it right.. i ordered the mongolian beef over rice and chow fun with beef brisket and veggies..mongolian beef was eh.. was spicy at all and there was not enough meat.. mostly onionschow fun with beef brisket and veggie was very bland and oily.. didnt like it at all..overall i didnt enjoy the food here and would drive a little further to chinatown to get those dishes..

4.description: I had really high hopes for this place i heard about it on tv... I also recommended it to my best friend... who invited me this evening to this place.... I love Chinese food also worked in 2 Chinese food establishment so I know my Chinese food.... I order the chicken kung pow my friend ordered the shrimp egg foo young... the chicken kon pow didn't taste as fresh old chicken the old  sauce was cold I very much dislike that after two bites I couldn't see myself eating it anymore...my friend gave me one of his pattie the fried rice was just as bad....i will be back I love the restaurant atmosphere...but i will not order the chicken kon pow...

24.description: My husband and I LOVE Chinese food. We have eaten at various restaurants in Chinatown as well as Argyle up north. We were born and raised in Chicago so you can imagine the number of restaurants we have visited. I have to say that Chui Quon is one of the best! The food is always fresh and soo tasty. From the more American Chinese items such as eggs rolls to the more authentic items on their Chinese language menu everything is spot on. The service is very friendly and attentive.
