When it's busier they still only have 2 waiters so sometimes you have to wait a bit but nothing too long. Someone mentioned in their review that the people who work there do not speak much English and I would have to say that's true but guess what you are not in a hot dog and fries restaurant. Just have the patience and good humor to listen carefully and speak slowly. Pointing to the items you are ordering always helps!Favorite items: walnut shrimp, dumplings, sauted green beans, salt and pepper shrimp, pork dumplings, mongolian beef, orange chicken, pork buns.My only complaint is the loud, huge tvs. Unfortunately that seems to be becoming the norm in restaurants but I wish we could eat in peace. There are at least 3 huge tvs, one for each wall and they are always on. They aren't loud because I think they have the sound off since each one usually is showing a different station but they are annoying. I wish we could eat in peace to enjoy the delicious food. Maybe they can have one time a week where the tvs are off. We would eat at that time every week!Also I would LOVE to have the other menu translated. Not sure what language it is in because it could be Mandarin but it could be another language but I want to know what is on there! The one time we asked what another table was eating they told us that it was on the "other" menu so we ordered it and it was incredible. It was a lobster and thin rice noodle dish. Wow.

6.description: This place is pretty decent. The only bad thing was that I ordered the Mongolian beef, and almost bit into what looked and felt like a little piece of rock. Very strange. I think if I would've actually bit into it it would've broke my tooth. I've gone several times after and never had a problem like that before. Service is quick and servers are attentive.

22.description: Great flavors, nice waitstaff, fast, efficent and clean. I brought my 4-year old here and he loved the soup. I had yummy egg foo young.  Great addition to McKinley Park,

15.description: This place serves pretty decent food. I used to come here when they first opened. Now their prices has gone way up.... too fast for me to keep up. LOL. I just can't justify paying either same price or more at this restaurant than the restaurants in China town. The food quality is pretty standard (slightly below standard), which you can get from any authentic Chinese restaurants in the city. Being away from China Town center I would think rent would be cheaper here, hence the prices?I am back to eating at the restaurants in China town... which is a couple miles just north on Archer. The only thing they have going for this restaurant is the parking lot in front of the restaurant.

7.description: I stumbled upon this place when I was running errands with Papa Z. I like that they have a distinct eat-in area that seems spacious and clean. Prices are higher than the Chiu Quon in Chinatown. $1.00 for an egg custard tart at this location when compared to $0.80 in Chinatown! $2 for glutinous rice cake? Come on. I guess I'm paying for convenience?They have their own parking lot in the front, so free parking! No more crappy double parking in Chinatown.

36.description: We liked it! The Bakery turned full service restaurant was very nice. We had some dim sum and one fish fillet with vegetables over rice and a few boas.The food was good. I hope they will add options for more hot noodle soup dishes. I would return and eat there with my family and friends. It is a little escape from having to go to Chinatown for Chinese Food and bakery goods.

30.description: I've been going to Chiu Quon since I was a kid. It was great news to hear that Chiu Quon was opening up a restaurant and expanding their menu. Definitely adds some flare to the tradition cafe that sells pastries and dim sum. The place itself is pretty open with a lot of lighting and great portions for the price. Definitely recommend!

3.description: We came by to try their dinner offerings, and had their dinner-for-four for $46.88.  It was a great value and included:- beef broth soup- sauteed lobster- chicken with ginger and onions- pork chop with onion- yu choy with garlicAdditionally, this all came with four overstuffed bowls of rice as well as free tea.  None of it was piping hot, but rather warm (except the cold chicken dish), but one can't expect perfection at this price.  This place is off the beaten path as far as a "Chinatown" dinner time meal, but if you don't expect fancy, but rather a good deal for a good meal, then you won't be disappointed.  We left quite satisfied.  Otherwise, they have quite an extensive dinner menu.  Note that they are BYOB also.  They also have free parking in their own little strip mall, and which is getting to be a rarity these days in Chicago.

14.description: Sad to say it's not the gem it stared off as. They have had maybe 3 menu changes. I wish they would bring back the old chefs. The prices have increased greatly, but still fair. It's not the same place. The chicken wings are now mediocre , the wonton soup the wontons have no flavor huge change. I hope the owners read this and can correct corners that have been cut. It was the best place out of Chinatown including the suburbs not its mediocre at best. Makes me sad. But it is very clean, keeping it a solid 3 star.

1.description: Stopped here on a whim to get anniversary flowers for the wife.  Ended up with a really nice set of purple flowers which she LOVED since that's her favorite color.  Also the price was very reasonable.  They really did a good job on the arrangement.

9.description: This place reminds me of Mushnick's, the flower shop from "Little Shop of Horrors".Every time I drive by this place, I have a feeling that the killer plant --- "Audrey 2" --- is in there.

12.description: LOVED everything about working with Fasan!! Not only were their prices the best in town, but the flowers looked beautiful! Maggie was able to put all my ideas to life and I was so happy with how everything looked at our wedding! I would highly recommend Fasan to any and everyone!!

21.description: The people who own this place are the best!  This is the florist we use at work to send special occasion flowers (sickness, death, weddings, etc.).  The arrangements always arrive on time, fresh, and all that I've seen, perfectly done.   I have used them on personal occasions myself as well (I got a dozen yellow tea roses here last month-nothing says I love myself like giving myself flowers!) and have never been disappointed.  The ladies I usually place my orders with are always super friendly, and get exactly what I need when and where I want it.

16.description: Fasan did our flowers for our wedding. Mick Fasan is great to work with. He is sweet, very professional, trust worthy and very reasonable. He came highly recommenced to me. I've posted some pics.

17.description: I highly recommend Fasan Florist, after having such a positive experience for my wedding in March 2010.  The prices were the most reasonable I found in the city, and they were able to pull together exactly the look we wanted.  We've gotten many compliments on how beautiful the bouquets and centerpieces were, both from guests who attended, as well as friends who have seen out wedding pictures!   Maggie was a joy to work with, as well.

10.description: We recently worked with Maggie for our wedding, and the whole experience was really great. She worked really well with us to make sure things stayed within our budget (important in wedding planning!), and everything was gorgeous. High quality product and professional, friendly staff. Bonus -- I dried my bouquet afterwards, and it still looks gorgeous.

5.description: I ordered flowers for my wife, to be delivered at her work place, via Florist One, who sub-contracted the order to Fasan Florist. Fasan did a horrible job; some of the flowers arrived dead, while the others were completely disheveled in their arrangement. It was not the presentation I was looking for.

11.description: My wedding flowers exceeded my expectations!  They were beautiful!  We received so many compliments on our centerpieces and bouquets.  Maggie was so helpful and patient.

3.description: If you want to work with a trustworthy, professional team then choose Fasan Florist.  They take care of their customers and listen to your every concern.  My flowers for my wedding day were beautiful and on time!  Maggie is a sweetheart and she is very patient : ) Their prices as very reasonable as well.  Everything you need in a professional florist.

0.description: We ordered all our wedding flowers with Maggie from Fasan florist. Before the consultation I sent her pictures of what I wanted. She totally nailed it and made it even better looking than on my pictures! The delivery to the location and us at the hotel was on time and everything looked so beautiful!Thank you for making our day special and bringing the decorations to live with your floral accents!

20.description: I would absolutely recommend Fasan Florist to anyone, especially if you are planning a wedding.  They are extremely knowledgeable about all possible ideas and Cesar (our florist) was great with recommending bouquet options, centerpiece options, etc. for my fall wedding. The price is extremely affordable and they definitely did not try and oversell us on anything.  We received several compliments on how beautiful the centerpieces, bouquets were.  I will definitely return to Fasan for all of my flower needs.

19.description: I would absolutely recommend Fasan Florist to anyone, especially if you are planning a wedding.  They are extremely knowledgeable about all possible ideas and Cesar (our florist) was great with recommending bouquet options, centerpiece options, etc. for my fall wedding. The price is extremely affordable and they definitely did not try and oversell us on anything.  We received several compliments on how beautiful the centerpieces, bouquets were.  I will definitely return to Fasan for all of my flower needs.

2.description: I worked with Maggie at Fasan Florist for my wedding, and I could not be happier with the results. They're very reasonably priced. I looked at them and at another "higher end" florist in a trendier neighborhood, and I was quoted TWICE as much by the fancy florist for the exact same items. Maggie will work closely with you to get it right, and she's VERY good with communication. You will never feel neglected. I had very specific ideas about what my flowers should look like (I showed Maggie some inspiration photos), and with a few consultations, I was able to get exactly what I wanted. I ordered a bridal bouquet, (4) bridesmaid bouquets, (10) boutonnieres, (2) wrist corsages, (11) centerpieces, and (2) large arrangements. Every single item was gorgeous and carefully considered. The flowers have also really lasted. My wedding was three days ago, and my bridal bouquet and the centerpiece I kept still look as beautiful as when they were delivered. My mother brought the large arrangements to her church (2 days after the wedding), and someone actually bought one of them from her! Trust me, just go with Fasan Florist.

18.description: The people who own this place are the best!  This is the florist we use at work to send special occasion flowers (sickness, death, weddings, etc.).  The arrangements always arrive on time, fresh, and all that I've seen, perfectly done.   I have used them on personal occasions myself as well (I got a dozen yellow tea roses here last month-nothing says I love myself like giving myself flowers!) and have never been disappointed.  The ladies I usually place my orders with are always super friendly, and get exactly what I need when and where I want it.

13.description: Maggie was a delight to work with.  She even had a baby between our first meeting and my wedding and she still responded to emails and was very helpful!  She worked with my budget and made it beautiful.  Everything turned out great, and I would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a great florist without the ridiculous wedding prices!

4.description: Outstanding florist! Best delivery, always reliable. Did my wedding and everything since. My wife and I are always very happy with their products and their service. I cannot recommend them more highly.

6.description: Fasan florist put my flowers together for my wedding last Sat.  Wow, did they do a fantastic job!!  The flowers were so bright and smelled so good!  They really made my pictures pop! I would recommend this shop to anyone looking for a fabulous florist!

15.description: I never noticed this little flower shop on the corner of 35th and Ashland but have heard about them through work.  I decided to purchase a bouquet for my mom's birthday but had never bought from a florist so I didn't know how to order it.  I just told them the occasion, how much I wanted to spend and that I'd be there in 40 minutes (closing time) to pick it up and they got it done.  I started to worry that I wouldn't get a decent arrangement but was surprised to see such a huge bouquet with lots of lilies. Would definitely return for more!tip: save $5 by getting the bouquet without the vase.

7.description: Absolutely the best flower shop hidden gem you might say I never notice this flower shop i did an online search found this fairly close to my house after reading all the reviews I decided to stop by I'm glad I did !!!

8.description: This review is LONGGGGGGGGGGGG OVERDUE!!!!!!!!... My wife and I got married 11/4/2011. Maggie at C.M. Fasan Florist was the GREATEST!!!... First off let me say, that we wanted to use local, neighborhood shops for our wedding planning.  I must say that I am a little partial to C.M. Fasan because I got my corsage for my prom date from here.  The shop keeper then was Maggie's Grandmother....WOW.... But, we scheduled  an appointment online through the website. We met up as planned and she was a DELIGHT from the beginning!!!.  We looked at some books to get some general ideas though we knew was color palate we wanted, she helps us to bring the vision to reality.  Pricing was VERY affordable and she didn't push anything on you.  It was strictly about your visions and your budget and we appreciated that about her.  Flowers were delivered to the church ON TIME and as scheduled absolutely beautiful, she even provided the flowers for the cake!.... It was amazing day, and she was a amazing person.  Thanks again Maggie...

14.description: I live very close to Fasan, so when we were starting to book our vendors for our wedding a couple of weeks ago, they popped right into my mind.  We started late, too; flowers were one of the last things we booked.  Not only was Fasan uber helpful in helping me come up with the designs (i had no idea what I wanted), they got me extremely competitive pricing, answered all my questions, and worked with us through the proposal and making sure we had everything we needed.  Delivery was right on time to two places, and the flowers were even better than I expected.  I would use them again!!!

3.description: I go in for a cut now and then. There's a few workers there that can give you a good cut and are friendly. I don't go back because the owner (the one with heavily dyed hair) just doesn't seem like she cares about her customers. Like she takes them for granted.

1.description: Don't go! Patty messed up my cut and color even after bringing multiple pics to give a general idea of what I wanted. I made an appt to go back for her to fix my color and she did not show up. The stylists there showed no concern that I had an appt and my stylist was a no-show. One of the stylists that barely speaks English did come over and try to say that Patty was supposed to call me to say she wasn't coming but I received no call. So not only did I waste $110, I still have messed up hair and wasted time to go back for a fix and she didn't show. Patty is the owner so you would expect better customer service. Now I have to go somewhere else and pay more money to get my hair fixed. Don't recommend this place AT ALL.

2.description: I call, they are open until 7.  I bring my boy in for a haircut at 6:40, (he gets buzzed with razor, easy cut normally takes them literally 5-10 minutes), woman there tells us it is too late.  (Patty wasn't there.)Knowing my kid will get a mediocre haircut isn't so bad when I think how conveniently located they are.  Not getting the haircut when there was definitely time to do it, and I'd called ahead.... unacceptable.

5.description: I love my Patty! I followed her for years. I get a wonderful cut & color at an awesomely afforable price. The whole staff is friendly & pleasant. Elaina is wonderful. Very friendly, attentive & talented. She has done my hair as well in the past. Totally trust her. Today she gave me a gel manicure as well & I adore it!   Walk-Ins are always welcome..so in the mood for a cut...no need for an appt although they can be made.  The shop is clean & professional. The staff are extremely friendly. I have never felt like a customer as much as a feel so cared for. :D     If you're looking for a great afforable neighborhood salon..then Patty's is it!

6.description: This place is great! Perfect for the person that basic good hair cut for an affordable price! I used to go to salons where I would pay 50-60 dollars for a haircut and it would take forever and be an expensive ordeal. Patty is a great stylst. I didn't think there was a language barrier with her. She asked the right questions to find out exactly what style I wanted and then she gave me exactly what I asked for! So simple! Very efficient! And it's actually afforadble!! Only $25 for a good haircut! A+++ They only place I'm going from now on. I've found my spot!

7.description: I went here to take my 3 sons for a haircut. Let me tell you they charged me $15 for my 12 year old since to them he is considered an adult. Well all 3 of them came out a disaster. I think that whoever cut my children's hair that day either lied to the owner that they knew how to cut hair or simply is just a terrible hair cutter. She even used the machine, who can mess up with that?

0.description: I am looming between two and three stars for this place, so I will give them the benefit of the doubt in this case. I walked and noticed that place is well kept and really clean. Also was greeted in a friendly manner by the lady behind the counter. When I asked how much a haircut was she had me turn around to check my hair length and said it would be twenty dollars, seemed reasonable enough, and not having had a haircut in well over two years, I said "alright I'll do it" There was a big BIG language gap between me and my Spanish speaking hairdresser, I could not for the life of me get her to understand that I didn't want my hair cut in a way that it would be in my face. The lady who greeted me had to step in and even then she had to show me pictures and I was stuck choosing between the lesser of two evils from what she was showing me. She was quick and to the point though. One thing I don't like is that she used this really hurty tool that literally pulled out layers of my hair, maybe I am just very tender headed but my scalp is still, two days later, sore. The other thing is I can't say that I am entirely happy with this cut. It's not terrible or anything but It doesn't quite go with my face if that makes any sense. Though getting my haircut after well over two years made me feel like I lost ten pounds, and it wasn't as scary as I thought it would be.

4.description: Esther is amazing!  And you cannot beat the prices.  She really listens to what you want and asks lots of questions to make sure she's getting it just right.  Highly recommend.

3.description: Rosa is awesome... She works wonders with her "Skilled Magic" to make everyone coming in... leave stunning!!!

1.description: I have been coming to this salon for years! Not to mention every time I go to try out a new salon and they mess up, I always come back here to get it fixed. I have super straight fine hair, so I get it can be harder to style and cut sometimes. This salon is no fuss- most times I bring a pic and they cut it exactly and when I don't know how I wanna get it cut, they always figure it out for me. And for a cut under $20?Will probably keep coming here as long as I can!

2.description: The ladies working there are very nice and do a great job with my hair.  They know how to get my haircut right and they are very inexpensive too!

0.description: The stars explain it all

1.description: This place isn't here anymore it closed. So annoyed that i took the trip here to not find it. PLEASE REMOVE!!!!!!!!!!!!

2.description: The sales people and manager at this store are extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly! The manager (I think she was the manager) worked very hard to find an item that I needed in a different size from one of the other nearby stores. This store has a great selection of fashionable, inexpensive clothes and accessories! Make sure you sign up for their mailing list! You get great coupons!

0.description: I have shopped at this location several times and every time I always have a pleasant experience. I am always greeted by a woman whose name I cannot remember. You can tell that she enjoys what she does because she never hesitates to help. She even offered to look in the back for an item I could not find on the sales floor. She also gave me suggestions as to what jewelry would match with my new outfits. I know some people may not like to be bothered while they are shopping and may not appreciate this service because they want to be in and out of the store. I, on the other hand, like to take my time shopping and find it refreshing to get someone else's opinion on certain things. Overall, nice clothes, pretty good prices and friendly service. Two thumbs up! =)

3.description: Terrible customer service. I've been to other t-mobile stores where the employees are very informative and helpful. One should not receive attitude for asking a simple question. I ended up going to another t-mobile store and they told me the response this store gave me was not entirely accurate. The employees at this store should be better informed and more helpful.

1.description: Please save yourself the trouble and just go to the Tmobile store on Roosevelt and Canal. I have came here countless time because it is much closer to me than the location on Roosevelt. However, each time I come in here, they say to me that they cannot do that for me and I would have to pay. To me this store seems desperate for and they will try everything to meet their budget. I made the mistake of coming here to switch my contract back then to their no contract family plan. I specially told them I wanted to upgrade 3 lines for 3gb of data and the sales associate said sure. When I got my first Tmobile bill, I noticed my dads line got charged for data as well because she added it in their. Like I said, go to the store on Roosevelt and Canal. They will do a lot of stuff free of charge that this store charges for.

2.description: My experience was not the great at this location. The customer service I got from the agent Daniel was not the best. He took about 2 hours just to active a new line on my iPhone. Did not bother to ask if I wanted to type in my iCloud when he told me he was all done I had to transfer everything from my old iPhone to the new one at home because he wasn't able to help with that. Also he screen protectors he put on my phone is all bubbly and he said they will go away in a couple of hours but I still see the bubbles. Then I told him I wanted my old number to be transfer to my new phone and he said I had to call customer service for that and I said excuse me but I thought you were doing this for me. He was pretty much not able to help me in any way then I realized that he forgot to connect internet on the phones because they whole day we had no internet until we call the customer service to ask if it was a problem with T-Mobile or the devices and they said the agent forgot to add Internet. It was just such an I convince the next day when I went to the store to speak to the manager another agent said there was no manager and Daniel who was there didn't even bother to try to help or apologies for the inconvenience. He seriously needs some kind of training to make him a better sales person.

5.description: Desiree assisted me with all of the questions and concerns that I had and even did a wonderful job of explaining things to me... as I ask way too many questions! :)  The manager was great about transferring my contacts over as well.  I would recommend this location!

6.description: been here asked for assistance , but the associate told me to call customer service number instead. they were not willing to help if you did not buy anything from them.  I talked to the female sales rep that the one on Jefferson and Roosevelt helped me before.  then she told to go the the store at Jefferson and Roosevelt.  please save your time and Go to other stores for help.

7.description: Been here, it was so disorganized. The employees do not know how to tend to people in the order in which they came in. I waited for 20 min and left after other people were getting helped that came in after me. Been to other T-mobiles that had great customer service, this is a NO GO!

0.description: I've recently signed up for the new jump on demand promotion where I trade in an old phone for the new iphone 6s. Upon receiving my new phone, I did not get the RMA number for the return label for the trade in phone. I tried to call customer care, but they just sent me back to the store. And so this is the store I went to. Rick was the one that straightened out everything for me. He even printed the label out and packed my old phone up. All I had to do was drop the phone off at usps. A big thanks to Rick!

4.description: DONT TRUST THESE PEOPLE!!!!!!  I have been to this T-mobile a couple times because it is right by my house and  at least one young girl employed there was helpful one time but I cannot say the same for anyone else, however, the final and last time I ever went there I was assisted be a young woman who told me VERBATIM that I could only get the phone for the price I saw online if I bought "the package" which included a case and a screen protector.  I had been researching the phone I wanted online so I knew how much it was and I thought this was weird so I asked her two times very clearly if I would have to buy the package at another T-mobile store as well and she assured me that I would.  I also told her that it seemed odd as I checked the price online and she said if I didn't buy the package that I would have to wait for the phone to be ordered.  So, I did buy the phone and accessories which were listed separately on my receipt, not as a package.  Then I called another store to verify before calling T-mobile, both confirmed that I did not have to buy a package to get the price on the phone that I saw online, that was simply what the phone cost.  This is a HUGE deal to me, se actually LIED TO MY FACE TWICE, this is immoral and UNETHICAL!  I could not believe that she actually lied even after I questioned her.  After calling T-mobile I called the store and informed the manager of what happened.  First, he was extremely unintereseted from the start and secondly, HE SAID "THERE IS TWO SIDES TO EVERY STORY" as to imply that I was exaggerating what she had said or lying.  What could I possibly stand to gain from lying about this???  I was so shocked even if he thought I was making up the story, which I did not, he could have at least pretended to be the least bit empathetic.  I was also very calm and considerate when I called its not as though I was irrate or blaming him I just wanted him to know what was going on at his store, I would not be surprised if he was coaching them to push accessories this way, I'm sure he gets partial credit.  I wish I knew the girls name who lied, she should really not be lying to people.  Sales are all about persuasion I realize but this is so wrong!  I would never go back to this location and I highly suggest no one else does either!

3.description: I love it but the only thing that sucks is there's never enough workers.

1.description: I always go here every time I need something the people  are very welcoming I love it here I definitely recommend this place for everyone I know plus come on is Walgreens

2.description: This is my favorite walgreens in the city. The staff here has character and personality. They didn't have a product I used on a regular basis, I asked for the product, and now they keep it stocked regularly. I also love the fact walgreens have chase ATM. I'll get to name dropping on the next review.......stays clean and we'll maintained.

0.description: My go to store for kids medicine and things I need fast with no long waiting lines like other stores. Associates are always friendly and helpful. I recommend it

4.description: This is the only Walgreens I know of that doesn't open before 8:00 AM.  Also, this is the only one I know of that has the ATM AT THE BACK OF THE STORE!  obviously, this annoys me.The good:  a pharmacy and close store that does have pretty much everything.Smack dab in the middle between Jewel, Dominicks, and TargetWalgreens DOES have pretty much everythingThe not so good:Hours aren't convenient - typically 8a - 10pATM at the back of the storetypically (imho) more expensive than said mega-marts.I try to save walgreens for emergencies only, but I wish they tried a little harder!

1.description: Horrible customer service.. Went for a no chip in Monday and by Wednesday 3 nails were more then chip. Came to fix them and won't fix my design since it was to much work. never coming here again never had this probably when I get them done at the salon I usually go too. And they took another customer before me that came after me. Been here for over an hour.

9.description: I recently moved, so I've been trying out new nail salons. I'm very particular about salons because you can get serious infections if tools are not sterilized properly.  My manicurist took a cuticle pusher and cutter out of a drawer, and I was concerned that they had been used on someone else without being sterilized. So, I said I wanted to see new tools being taken out of the sterilizing machines. She refused, and insisted they were fresh tools--that was strike one.  Strike 2 occurred during the pedicure. I asked to soak for about 15 minutes and she said no, you can't hold up a chair. Uh, it's Tuesday morning, there are 5 or 6 pedicure chairs, and I'm the only person in here getting a pedicure--why are you rushing me? Strike 3 occurred later in the evening when I noticed that THREE NAILS WERE CHIPPED!  I chose an OPI polish, but it was really liquidy and thin.  I think they thinned it with acetone instead of an actual nail polish thinner.  Anyway, I would not come back here. They rush the services even when the place is empty, they are rude, my nails chipped the same day, and I suspect this place is not clean.  My search for a relaxing and clean nail salon continues...

23.description: went here for eyebrow waxing, they are great, very friendly, didn't wait long. Will be going back to try there mani/pedi soon

25.description: They are very sweet here, and you never wait more than a few minutes. They remember your name, what you usually get, etc. They do a good job at nails-not the best I've seen in Chicago, but the best at the price point they offer. And convenient if you live in McKinley Park/Bridgeport. Mani/Pedi is $32.00 . I actually prefer their pedicures.Go here, try it.

12.description: This is a good option if you are looking for a quick nail job and you don't feel like spending a ton of money.I called ahead of time, but they said I didn't need an appointment. When I arrived on a Friday afternoon, I was seated immediately for my pedicure. The place is clean, but it needs better circulation as it did have a pretty strong chemical smell.The woman that took care of me was very nice but a tad rough on my toes. And I wish she did a more thorough foot and leg massage. One important thing to note is that they skip the scrub and go directly for the lotion, so I felt like I was missing out on the "spa" part of the pedicure.The paint job itself was ok, and it was done quickly, but I waited forever for the paint to dry. My pedicurist was more worried about the Asian soap opera on TV than to check up on my progress.

21.description: Went to Tip Nails for a pedicure today as a walk-in.  I had a younger man, he did an amazing job!! The salon is clean and the price was decent--$22 for a pedicure.  $28 for mani/pedi Mon-Wed.  Will definitely be coming back again.

16.description: Ok, I know this is NoT an expensive salon, so I am not comparing this to a place with high end service, nor was I expecting it. 1. Horribly strong smell of acetone. Poor ventilation.2. Lady who did my nails seemed to not want to be there; she wasn't out rightly rude, but definitely unwelcoming. In fact, right after telling me where to put my hands to dry, she went off to the back corner and watched tv. 3. The worst part, she was rough on my fingers, filed them unevenly, and trimmed too much so that I ended up with hangnails later. She even nicked my left ring finger so that it bled and she didn't apologise! The other staff around the room seemed to be younger and more professional, so I don't want to judge the whole place by the one employee. But I AM judging this review on my experience there so that is why they are getting the first single-star review I have ever written.You've been warned.

17.description: Love it!I'm here every 2weeks for fill ins!

10.description: My friend comes here a lot to get her nails done, but the last time she went, Lisa's husband was doing her nails and he was very very rude. He asked how she liked her nails when he was doing it, and she said everything looked okay (just to be nice), except for one nail (that was really bugging me) and asked if he can redo it. Then he starts throwing a fit and telling her that he is very good at what he does and called her a difficult customer. Then he started talking shit in Vietnamese, thinking she doesn't understand. Very unprofessional and she will never go back again. On top of that, he did a HORRIBLE job. I hope he knows, this place is local and we do network nowadays and words do spread fast. Way to ruin your own business...

5.description: First patronage to this salon today for a (no-chip) mani/pedi. Very happy with the services rendered. No wait and attentive staff. Definitely coming back.

11.description: I found this place to be a standard cheap nail shop. The place looked pretty clean and had nice pedicure soak tubs. I had my eyebrows done when I was there. They complete that service in the main area while I was sitting in a chair. I noticed they put the wax on the strips and then put the strips on me. It still got the job done and I will definitely go back since it is the closest place near my house.

22.description: Got a no chip manicure here yesterday and it looks really awesome! I'm told this will last 3 weeks. Goodbye old boring basic one-week lasting manis!

0.description: I couldn't be luckier to have a place like this right around the corner from me.  They do a nice job for the prices they charge ($32 for a mani/pedi).  They're really nice, and the wait is never long at all.The best thing about the pedicures is their delux massage chairs.  You sit in this throne-like lounger that has rollers going up and down the length of your spine, kneading, pounding, and rubbing as softly or vigorously as you like (you get the remote control).I also like the diverse clientele.  I've seen Asian, Latina, African American and white women there, often all at once.  Clearly the search for inexpensive but good quality beauty services is something we all share.

20.description: I hated this place! Granted, the man who did my pedicure was gentle and  the foot massage was good. HOWEVER, the lady for my manicure was absolutely terrible! she was just the opposite, rough and not very polite to me as a new customer. She cut my cuticles so much that I had sores for at least a week! I noticed when another customer came after me, a customer who seemed to be a regular, she was so warm and chatty with her. ughim just disgusted with this place because i had high hopes given its one of the closer nail salons to me. The only reason i gave it the two star was from the service from the guy.Not the best pedicure ive ever had and CERTAINLY one of the worst manicures! i would rather go out of my neighborhood and pay $40 for a quality experience!My fellow yelpers led me astray this time.

19.description: I went in this nail salon on Friday, 12/21/12.  i was leaving on vacation to Texas the following morning so i needed a manicure, pedicure and facial wax.  The older Vietnamese lady who did my wax was being very rough and I told her but she kept on.  She burned my upper lip and my chin really bad.  i am not sure if the wax was too hot, or that she kept pressing really hard on my face even after i told her.  Or that she went over the same areas more than once.  i was on vacation looking like Scarface, literally.  As soon as I got back I went to see them, I was not rude in any way, I simply explained what happened and showed them pictures of my face while I was in Texas.  They immediately started acting very rude towards me and they all started speaking Vietnamese to each other so I could not understand what they were saying.  They admitted remembering me because I was the last customer there on 12/21/12.  When I asked them to issue me a receipt THEY FLAT OUT REFUSED, they gave me my $20 back but my face is all scarred up.  I mean seriously, this is my face we are talking about, my makeup wont even cover it.  **PLEASE BE VERY CAREFUL PEOPLE, I WOULD HATE FOR THIS TO HAPPEN TO SOMEONE ELSE.  I have filed a complaint with the BBB but I don't know what I can do without a receipt.  i am devastated and i am already feeling really self conscious about my face.  Please go to a reputable place, even if it costs you a couple extra bucks.  **I REALLY WISH I CAN ATTACH MY PICTURES SO YOU CAN SEE WHAT THEY DID TO MY FACE!

2.description: I went to get my nails done and I usually let Lisa do them, she does an alright job. This time I let the older gentlemen do it and he was extremely rough. When using the nail file, he would over do it and wouldn't stop till my fingers turned a bright red. He then proceeded to clip them way too short when I told him I liked them long. After all this, I got my eyebrows done and he ended up messing those up too, now I have to grow them out. I will not be returning.

18.description: Ladies, you know that scruffy couch surfer that you call every so often around 2am? You meet him at the 4am bar around the corner, buy him a couple of cheep beers, then take him home. The next morning you wake up unimpressed and full of shame. That's what Tip Nails is. A cheap, convenient option that's only good for the moment, but you'll regret the decision tomorrow.

13.description: I went here for the first time last week, in search of a mani-pedi and not wanting to go far from home. I was the first person there, shortly after opening. The salon itself is a little outdated, but it seemed pretty clean. They do have some O.P.I. colors, but also have tons of off-brand polishes, which made me a little worried. After picking my colors, my nail technician Minh gave me the best mani-pedi I have ever had. He took his time, was very thorough, gave a great foot and leg massage, and painted flawlessly. He also had a great balance of chatting with me and then letting me relax in silence. I will definitely be back and will request Minh every time. The price was great, too! It was only $30!

4.description: After reading all the reviews I decided to go and give it a try. My experience was awful! Customer service wise they are great as greeting you but the service is horrible my nails became on even and crucked also very thick. He was such in a hurry that no matter what I told him he will ignore my request I also did mood color which I guess there nail polish are to old that it doesn't change color he aas also being really stingy with the nail polish and put it on like a 5 year old would all mess up and not covering the whole nail. Never again will I wasted my time and money in this place.  He was still expecting a tip I'm like really....????!!

24.description: I couldn't be luckier to have a place like this right around the corner from me.  They do a nice job for the prices they charge ($32 for a mani/pedi).  They're really nice, and the wait is never long at all.The best thing about the pedicures is their delux massage chairs.  You sit in this throne-like lounger that has rollers going up and down the length of your spine, kneading, pounding, and rubbing as softly or vigorously as you like (you get the remote control).I also like the diverse clientele.  I've seen Asian, Latina, African American and white women there, often all at once.  Clearly the search for inexpensive but good quality beauty services is something we all share.

6.description: This place never disappoints... Always friendly and even when they are busy they take time to talk to you and help you. I've been going here for years and every time I slip and go somewhere else due to groupon or other specials I'm always let down.

15.description: I was so shocked at the service I received at this nail salon.  I had been wanting to get a no chip pedicure for a while and I randomly pulled over to this place, not wanting to drive to the northside or downtown, and I have never experienced such perfection from a nail tech.  Obviously, the place is a little out of date and the chemical smell is a little stronger than other nail salons but the work was worth it!  Also, this place is so inexpensive that I was really not expecting too much but the tech that did my toes was so careful with detail and professional it was a job well done and worth the money....worth even more money!

7.description: I am new to the area and i have already found a place to enjoy a mani and pedi. Place is a little outdated but nice ppl and establishment. They have been in the area since 95!! Strongly recommend!

8.description: Love their deal on Mani's and Pedi's (Mon and wed). Whenever your stressed, that's the place to go and relax. nice and calming atmosphere !!! Best part there is never a wait when I go!

3.description: I'm so glad this so is close to home. I am very pleased with the service. I was a walk in but I was taken care of right away. Very friendly staff. They greeted everyone just the same. I got to relax and enjoy all the little perks of my full set and pedi. The staff jumped in to help each other during a sudden afternoon wave of girls that came in. So excited to show off my new and cute nail art. Definitely will come back.

14.description: Came in for a simple pedicure and they did a good job. The place is a little messy and the color selection is lacking. However, Min did a great job with my pedicure.  He took his time; did not feel rushed at all like at other places. He spoke English very well and they had the Travel channel on. I rarely ever go to a nail salon with anything enjoyable on the tv.  There wasn't excessive talking among the workers either. By the way, the massage chair was very nice.

29.description: Targets are what they are, but this one is conveniently off the Damen Avenue I 55 entrance and well right off of Archer Avenue so it is really convenient. Seems to be clean all the time and they are really stocked with items and very rarely do you need to get a rain check. I am really impressed with the lay out and the fact that most of the employees are friendly which is a big plus when coming to a store that is so well known. I also like the fact that they have a good clearance section that is really clearance. I mean where else can you get a 20 dollar shirt for less than 5 bucks? Seriously not a bad deal don't you think.

42.description: I haven't been to this Target in a long time, but I forgot how much I liked it.  It's a huge Target kind of in the middle of nothing so it's gigantic.  The parking lot is massive (I have honestly never seen this many handicapped spaces - have you?) and there's never a shortage of space.  This Target is always clean and organized.  I've never seen such an organized $1 section in any Target!  How do they do it?!  I love the layout of this store.  It's a bit different than the others in the city - the pharmacy, OTC and pet sections are in the front of the store on the "right side" (right of the entrance) instead of the other way.  I'm not sure why, but this is more pleasing to me than the other layout.  My friend and I had a good time perusing the great sections of scrapbooking and stationary items.  Lots was on clearance so we were very happy with our purchases.  I'll be back here one day, but the Target on Elston is within walking distance of my house and this one on Damen is insanely far away.  If you live nearby, go!  Though, the one on Roosevelt is way bigger and cooler because it's a super Target with two floors.  I'm  just saying.

23.description: Love target in general, but this one is great because the shelves are always stocked with clearance items all the time!  Best part??? I have always had great luck with their cashiers-(yes I'm a coupon freak) and the cashiers don't bat an eye when I hand over a stack of coupons for my purchase.  Best deal so far??? 3 packs of diapers after coupons and Target GC with purchase for $4!!!!by the way...great clearance section for maternity items......in the summer I scored tanks, jeans and dress slacks for work  (that fit like designer!) for less than $9 each......not bad for only having to wear a few months!

47.description: One of the nicest Targets I've shopped in. The store is always clean and things are easy to find. Target's prices are so cheap I shop here for most of my groceries. Their selection of food is a bit limited but you'd be surprised how much they carry and for how chap compared to traditional grocery stores. This store gets busy but not nearly as bad as other Targets in Chicago. Shopping in the morning is the least busy time but also when the grocery section turns into an obstacle course as the shelfs are stocked. Overall a wonderful Target.

8.description: This pharmacy is terrible! So my doctor sent 2 prescriptions over to the pharmacy. I go with a third prescription only to find out one of the two prescriptions that were sent over previously was ready. Perplexed I asked the pharmacist, Kelly, why I wasn't informed that one of the two prescriptions was ready. She said in a snotty voice, "That's not how we do things here. We like to give the customers all of their drugs all at once" I said okay? That's dumb what if I really really needed the drug that was ready? I'd have to wait for the other one to get filled even though it wasn't going to be ready for another couple of days? That's nuts! It's not my fault they like to give customers all of their drugs at once, but seriously if one of the drugs is ready and the customer is there, common sense would be to give them their drugs that were ready. I am taking my prescriptions back to my original pharm. Screw you Kelly with your rotten attitude and your shitty policy.

31.description: WORD OF CAUTION TO PEOPLE WHO SHOP HEREI returned a $50 dollar space heater the other day that I bought 2 days prior..I told him I didn't like it when he asked why I was returning it.  He basically gave me crap because I had "used it" (read- plugged it in and used it for 2 nights) stating Targets "Policy" was no returns on used items.  I told him that sounded ridiculous and asked if it was a new policy and he said "no its always been that way"  (I know it wasn't)But now, sure enough, on the wall was written in their policy that items "must be unused"  Which is oh I dunno.....THE WORST RETURN POLICY I'VE EVER HEARDThe kid ended up giving me my money back but not without making it seem like he was doing me some huge favor because I returned a space heater I didn't like after 2 daysAnyhow with the holidays coming up, be aware of this crappy "policy" because you either1) won't get your money back OR2) be incredibly annoyed by the grief the Target staff will give you before you actually get your money back

34.description: It's really really hard to rate a Target. But as far as Targets go I liked my experience here. The layout was a little less confusing (actually WAY less confusing) Than other Targets I have been to. The isles were well organized with not a lot of things tossed around in random places, and things were fairly easy to find. I found what I was looking for plus a couple of random other things that we needed for our new apartment. Their Kitchen and home section is a lot bigger than the one in the south loop.I am also glad it is sorta nearby.

16.description: Rating is primarily the result of the pharmacy. Took three days to transfer my Rx. I had to call a total of 6 times before it was filled. The pharmacists lied to me about contact with my previous pharmacy numerous times. I was charged a "co-pay", that my insurance company stated was invalid. Name was entered improperly into the system despite a copy of the prescription, a copy of the insurance care, a copy of ID, and being present for the entry. Above all, the negative attitude of the staff when addressing the issues was the absolute last straw. Never again will I use this pharmacy. Otherwise, I love this Target for general shopping. Grocery store is priced very well and always clean. The store itself is well organized. The cafe area is gross every time I go. I like to do some studying and shop between breaks. Baristas make coffee well, a big deal for me! :)

13.description: This is not a store that I'd want to go browse around if I have the time to do so as it always seems very busy (mostly with parents and their kids wondering around with little discipline - sorry, take your kids to a park to play). It's typically stocked well. Update: There is a grocery and produce section (but it's small like all the other Targets grocery sections and not the highest quality of produce, but it's more of a convenience factor for their market, not something they specialize in). Cashiers seem pretty friendly, I had a manager joking with me pretty good at checkout. I was using a target tote where you save 5 cents if you use it at check out and I wasn't sure if I would fit everything in it and she said "If not, we can cheat a little." It didn't matter though, I ended up fitting everything in the bag, but thought it was cool that she was laid back about it.

11.description: Need a gift ASAP? Get yo arse off the eway and buy it you forgetful fart!Or before you get on go get in line while the old lady finds something.

39.description: This was the Target of choice for me when I used to live in Bridgeport.  When they first built this place at the corner of Damen and 33rd(?), I was somewhat surprised, but I guess it's doing pretty well.  This Target is LARGE.  Square footage wise, I'm not sure how it compares to the one in the South Loop because Solo's is split, but McKinley Park's is very large.  Even the parking lot is gigantic.  Never did I have to park more than 6 or 7 rows down because it's just so spacious.  The layout is clean and fairly intuitive, and I always went during off-peak hours so I had time to look around at all the interesting things that I might like to purchase while also shopping for the things that I needed.  For daily items (think cleaning supplies, laundry, dishes, bedding, etc) everything was always easily available.  Sometimes for specialty electronics, they wouldn't have what I was looking for.  For example, I had to go to the Target on Elston to find a bread maker because they were out of stock at the McKinley Park Location.I would probably just check online first if you have such an item you need, because usually they will list the stock they have left. Other than that, it's a great place to shop in almost the middle of nowhere with friendly people.

37.description: I like this Target. It's big and I like how it's one level unlike the South Loop one. Clean and usually well stocked. Prices a bit cheaper too.

0.description: Friendly staff, helpful associates, clean store, and they usually have whatever I'm looking for in stock.Associates here have gone above and beyond to help out for any kind of issue I've had.

38.description: I am anti Wal Mart, but I heart Target. Hey, you can't boycott everything!   I have to shop somewhere besides thrift stores.Anyway, this Target is pretty much laid out like any other Target.  The one on Roosevelt and Clark is confusing!   Don't go there. One of the reasons for going to a chain department store is because no matter which one you go to, it's pretty much laid out the same way.  You'll be able to find your way around here easily if you've never been to this Target.My cat's food is cheapest here, their Archer Farms brand of food is good and reasonably priced (the dry fruit can be kind of pricey though).  They sell AF soy milk too, and edamame.  They have a little frozen vegetarian section, and their brand of frozen flax waffles are vegan (as far as I can tell). So if I run out of waffles, I don't have to go all the way to Whole Foods (can't find eggless or milkless waffles anywhere else in the area).  Also, I can use their ATM for free (it's in the network of my online bank :-) ).Sadly, it sometimes takes them a while longer than other [ahem Northside?] Targets to get re-stocked on certain things (like 5 disc CD changers! le sigh).  Such is life on the Southside.

51.description: This is a newer Target that I was forced to try because my companion fears the thing you have to use to get your cart to the second level at the Roosevelt Target.  What a baby.  Anyway... I was impressed by this Target so far, its clean and there's not crap flung all over the store.  Yes!  It is a little oddly laid out in my opinion but once you figure it out, it's all good.  They have the Pizza Hut Express and Starbucks like most Targets.  Bonus I found a Jim Jarmusch movie for only $10.  Seems a little un-Target-like in a good way.

27.description: This is a well run store with a wide selection of items sold at or near the lowest available retail prices in Chicago in comparison to Walmart, Best Buy, Dominick's, Walgreens, Jewel/Osco, etc.A few minor complaints:  1)  This place is always very busy, typically with shoppers carting around their screaming children.  Don't go here if you already have a headache or are otherwise aggravated. 2)  Going to this Target is never a quick trip, and that is due to the layout of the store and parking lot.  The store itself is huge, and the parking lot does not have any spaces that are particularly close to the entrance, so running in-and-out for even one thing takes at least 15 minutes.3)  It seems understaffed.  That said, the staff on hand do a very good job attending to customer needs.

32.description: Sometimes to avoid the target in the south loop cuz it's such a pain in the ass in more ways than one- I take advantage of the fact that I have a car and travel to other target locations in the city for a more pleasant experience. Plus it's a chance to further explore the city. Whatever makes me happy I say. This location is kinda hidden- pretty clean even while busy, I like that. Also they had this sleepwear slip dress in my size I've been looking for since august! The other targets I visited either had none left or only huge sizes left. I also saw that they had the ripped off version of victoria's secret bra.. The push up bra that brings you 2 cups up. Cool colors. There were also some cute striped tights I found here that I really like. Great Target location.

48.description: It's kind of hard to review a Target store since everyone has pretty much been to one. This one is a run of the mill Target store. For the most part they do keep it clean and organized. I have been to some that you just can't find anything and the shelves are a wreck. But this one the employees that care of everything pretty well. I would recommend this location if looking for a Target.

44.description: this is my favorite target in the city.  in fact, i'll make the trip to get to it.  its never crowded, unlike the insanity that ensues at the roosevelt target.  this place always has everything i want and in the sizes i want which makes me happy.  plus its LEED certified!  who can say no to that?  AND its right off the highway?  this is why target consistently gets 15% of my paycheck.

24.description: Big target that is always full of people! I like the convenience due to location, and the gigantic parking lot.

7.description: I'm basing my review on my experience and passed experiences.Now I love the selection and products target offers, although, basing my review on that would be unfair. They have a great line of things I'd love to buy!First, I hardly got asked whether I needed help or not. There's a balance between asking too much or too little, and these guys went towards too little or not at all.Second, the way things are organized is haphazard.I try to look for a clearance rack and I can't seem to tell because many of the racks appear to be clearance rack because of the random items placed anywhere. I know it's common sense, but I'm not the only one who shops here. Lastly, the bathrooms were dirty. :o lil nasties.

49.description: I really enjoy this nice, clean Target that's hidden by the Stevenson right off Damen. Parking is not a problem, and it's much less crowded, more like suburb Targets. Tons of clothes were on clearance and the sale items were in stock (BONUS x2!!). However, the housewares clearance was a little sparce, but I guess the store is still relatively new...The best part of my trip today was a gift set of Neutrogena make-up I bought for the sale price of $7.50 (this included a full-size powder and full-size bronzer). Another Target I went to this week wouldn't give me the sale price because it was already a deal priced at $9.99 for the set. I even asked the cashier to check the price and her supervisor refused. So screw you Munster Target, you can kiss your lunch-time visits with me good-bye, I've got a new favorite Target :)

40.description: I live 5 blocks away. It's reliable and it's convenient and fast. The parking isn't so good though.

30.description: I sometimes wish this Target wasn't so damn close to my house that I pass it almost everyday. It is a regular hangout for coffee or shopping. Very clean restrooms (BONUS) great employees who are usually smiling and pleasant. Thank You Target... you warm my heart :)

46.description: Besides the Peterson location (Wayyy far north!), this is my favorite Target in the City.  Ample parking, well stocked shelves, and people actually help you here!  Inside the store, it's clean, organized, and nothing is laying around on the floor (i.e. clothes, purses, whatever people don't want anymore).

1.description: Greetings,As of just now, I was a frequent shopper at  your target store located on 1940 W 33rd St, Chicago, Illinois 60608.  I am just getting off of work to come home and find out my babysitter of my 2 year old son was almost arrested by your store and treated very poorly.  She was shopping at this store with 2 - two year olds.  As she paid for her items the security cornered her and brought her into the back room where they accused her of stealing.  After reviewing the footage, it clearly shows the one small child putting items on the bottom of the car, while my sitter was unaware of this action. While they still accused her of stealing, she was unable to go by the two babies that were crying and diapers needed to be changed, while security was trying to arrest our sitter for something that did not happen, they also neglected our children and I am pissed about it.  When the Chicago Police Department arrived, they reviewed the footage and told your staff they wrong for doing this and told them to release her.  I will be posted on yelp, facebook and other social media to bring awareness to this.  This is absolutely disgusting behavior by your staff at this store to allow this to happen after reviewing the footage.

9.description: I'm generally a fan of Target, but this one bites.  Staff is nonexistent when you need help.  After searching around for awhile for an associate, hubs and I walked over to the fitting room lady to see if she could help us (or call someone who could).  I waited while she helped another guest, a girl who walked out of the fitting room in her underwear (Wow!  Seriously?) and as she turned back to me, another women stepped in front of me.  Rather than asking the lady to wait her turn the associate acted like she didn't see me.  We walked away, irritated and pretty turned off, decided to go to the service desk.  We had looked up the item we wanted on the Target website, which said the store had it in stock, but we could not find it on the floor.  We explained this to the associate at the service desk, who spent several minutes trying to call someone to help her.  Finally she got an answer.  Then we heard her ask the other person to check for the item.  I assumed she meant they would check the stock room, since we'd already told her we did not see the item in it's designated place.  I guess they don't have a stock room here.  We heard them go back and forth about how the item was not in it's place on the floor (no sh*t Sherlock, didn't we tell you that already?)  Finally, 10 minutes after asking what I thought was a pretty straight-forward question, we were told that they had indeed confirmed that the item was not "in stock" since it was not on the floor. I asked why the website was saying they had the item.  "That means we had it at 8 am this morning.  Someone must have bought it since then."  (It was 2:00 pm).So take note.  Apparently Target does not use real time status of their inventory (And having worked in retail, I know for a fact is actually pretty easy.  And a little weird that Target can't keep track of their stock!!!)Thanks Target, for offering to check the online status of the item at other area Targets (which I had already done on my cell phone), so that we could potentially spend our Sunday driving around only to find out that their counts are also off, only to encounter unfriendly and unhelpful associates, rude customers, and only to end our day, again, out of luck.  We'll find it at another vendor instead and save ourselves the headache.

26.description: I like the proximity to this target but for some reason a lot of their merchandise costs more than the Target in the south loop. It's very difficult to get help and the cashiers look like extras from night of the living dead.

25.description: The Target closest to me is in Lincoln Park on Elston - that place is a nightmare!  This Target is an oasis compared to that madhouse!!  There is ample parking, you can walk without fear of being trampled to death by cars, carts or people and they actually have things in stock (go figure!).  I also found that they have a decent clearance section, and some of their items, especially in the grocery section, are priced lower than the Lincoln Park store.  Customer service has always been friendly, I hope it continues as this will be the Target of choice!

12.description: This Target was well organized, yet was a little crowded on Saturday afternoon. I went looking for shampoo and conditioners, and found a great deal ( buy 4 get a $5 gift card). They are fairly priced, and the store has a huge parking lot.

21.description: This is the best Target. It's never packed, even on a Saturday afternoon! And that's all I can say about it. I mean, it's a Target you guys.

17.description: The woman at the cash register was a Godsend....she was prompt, courteous and very kind

10.description: Love all Targets, but received great service from this staff last night (8/19/14). The beauty consultant (didn't get her name) offered great advice and even gave us free samples. Our cashier -a tall man named Christopher- was all smiles with a great attitude. Great customer service at this location.

5.description: This is my local Target that I go to when I have nothing better do with my life. It's usually pretty organized except for the women's section, but that's just because we're too busy hunting the sales to put things properly.It doesn't have a grocery/fresh produce section, which is a little sad.

3.description: This is my Target I like it. I usually can go there in the early mornings or late afternoons and find easy parking for myself. I know it's the best organized store since i believe the cliental there can be a bit ghetto. This store is located in Mckinley Park just outside of lovely Bridgeport we share this Target with at least two different neighborhoods.Customer friendly employees I haven't had a problem with them. I have had issues with the snack area being a little messy and dirty. The slurpee machines aren't always working and that makes me sad when I was all set to get a slurpee. I am probably going to this Target because the location is just convenient if it were my husbands option he'd drive all the way to Jackson in the West Loop to a Target.

35.description: love target, will be a forever customer. I went into this store and love it, its close by me, walking distance. Pharmacy is really nice and knowldgeable however sometimes the lines can take awhile at the register  because they usually only have 1 or  2 lanes open, but guest services has no problem ringing you up as well if you only have 1 or 2 things. Not much of a jewerly section, and you usually wait awhile for help at the jewerly counter but all in all a great store.

19.description: Love target in general, but this one is great because the shelves are always stocked with clearance items all the time!  Best part??? I have always had great luck with their cashiers-(yes I'm a coupon freak) and the cashiers don't bat an eye when I hand over a stack of coupons for my purchase.  Best deal so far??? 3 packs of diapers after coupons and Target GC with purchase for $4!!!!by the way...great clearance section for maternity items......in the summer I scored tanks, jeans and dress slacks for work  (that fit like designer!) for less than $9 each......not bad for only having to wear a few months!

28.description: I love this Target.  It is less busy than the nearby Clark Street location and much much cleaner.  A pair of shoes I wanted were out at the Clark Street one, so I came here and they had my size and they were on clearance!  I like coming here so much better.

45.description: This Target store has served many of my needs since I moved into the neighborhood nearby.  It is extremely convenient not only because it is close by, but also because it is just off the expressway and therefore ideal for errands on the way home or on the way out.But what compelled me to write this review today was the discovery of the absolute ease of processing digital prints through this store.  It took just a few minutes to upload the pictures and order the prints, and the best thing was: THEY ARE READY FOR PICKUP IN LESS THAN AN HOUR!!!  When I got to the store, the photo department "team member" recognized me from my pics, plucked my packet from where it was hanging on a hook, and got me checked out--with a smile.  It was perhaps the easiest transaction I have ever made.  And the price was $2 less than the estimate that I got online because 5x7 prints were on sale!  The price in general is very reasonable: 15 cents for each 4 x 6 print, plus coupons are always avaialble.  I really don;t know why I waited this long to get my photos processed this way.

33.description: It's not hard at all to rate a Target location.Was everything that I was looking for something that I was able to find?It actually was.Was it easy to find those items I was looking for?Yes, the areas of this Target are well-organized, stocked properly and clear of random items thrown about to confuse people.What about the staff?They were nothing but friendly, and I was even asked TWICE by passing-by employees if I was finding everything alright and if I needed any help.And the place itself in general?I like that the aisles here are fairly wide and can fit shopping carts comfortably with ample passing room.  There was no garbage or product strewn all over the floor like I've seen in other stores.  The parking lot is huge (almost TOO huge) and it's interesting to see not one but TWO food areas (Pizza Hut and Starbucks) by the registers for pre- or post-shopping snacks and drinks.Had I not been carrying over 30 pounds of items already, I would have contemplated a soft pretzel for the long walk home.Oh yea, bonus points for being within walking distance from the apartment.  This is my #1 stop for anything I can't find at Dominick's, which is much closer to the apartment.I WILL be back, Target.

43.description: Dear Target on Damen & 33rd,I've been shopping with you for the past three years and I can't find anyone who is as good as you. I can always rely on a wide variety of clothes and accessories and not worry about the posers before me who have cleaned out your stock. For some strange reason, you always seem to offer gems that other Targets don't, and that's why I just wanna say thanks for being you.My favorite part about hanging out with you is that you are right off the highway and you are never too crowded (except the first snow storm in 2007, but hey, everyone has a bad day). I owe most of my overcrowded apartment to you. You always make sure I'm the best I can be, and that I consistently spend on average 15-20 percent of my annual income at your store. But hey, it's worth it. Going to Gio's wouldn't be the same without you as dessert ;)I think about you all the time and I can't wait to see you again! xoxo,jess

2.description: Is there is a no star, I will definitely rate that for their poor management check out.  Cashier are not well trained and the no one pay attention on self check out to help when customer needed help. And even though there were long line, but they only open two machines. Customers cut lines while and no management come out to help to solve problems. Poor management.

18.description: This place usually have most of the items I am looking for besides clothes. If you're a common size it will be difficult to get some good clothing choices. You'll have to beat the crowd!I remember coming in here to look for some make up and the staff was really helpful to point me there to the specific brand. Sometimes, I just wish they carry ALL of the items online so I can pick them up here!

41.description: Bad parking, but typical target inside. I prefer the Pulaski store better.

50.description: I was sooo excited when this Target opened up right by my workplace.  I was so used to having a Starbucks right by my building when we were downtown, that when we moved, I went through withdraws.  So now that I can have my daily cup of liquid crack laced with caffeine, I am much better again.  Oh, did I mention, that there is a Target store attached to the Starbucks?  A really nice excuse to go leave for lunch and go shopping!  I like this Target, especially since it seems to have a much larger plus size department, and they actually sell shoes in my size!  And since it is fairly new, it is not yet trashed.  The cashiers are really nice, I have yet to have someone give me a reason to complain.  So far, my favorite Target!

4.description: Not much different than your other Targets. Huge parking lot, lots of customers (went on a Sunday afternoon). I knew exactly what I wanted so it was a breeze getting in and out. The cashier was very friendly as is the case with the others in the city.

6.description: I stopped in yesterday with my boyfriend to get a few things on our way else where . While in a rush looking down the aisles up to two employees asked if I needed help ( my boyfriend was asked three times).  Something as simple as that shows a lot. Everyone seemed nice , willing to help  un like the TARGET AT THE BRICKYARD=laziness . The cashiers had a genuine smile and one even ran out after us because we forgot a bag. All 5 stars, customer services goes a long way!

22.description: This place usually have most of the items I am looking for besides clothes. If you're a common size it will be difficult to get some good clothing choices. You'll have to beat the crowd!I remember coming in here to look for some make up and the staff was really helpful to point me there to the specific brand. Sometimes, I just wish they carry ALL of the items online so I can pick them up here!

15.description: My first on-line order was a disaster! ! I placed the order and I received no notification  through email. I called the store to check the status so I can send my husband to pick it up on his way home. However, the rep putted me on hold for abt 30 mins (unattended) so I hung up and called again, this girl (did not get her name but she was an Africa American) I told her that someone putted me on hold for a long while and I needed to know the status of my online order, i could not even finish the sentence and she bumped into the conversation and kept insisting it was not their fault for not having the order ready and they can not access to the info cuz its in the back stockroom. I was mad, i told her I did not call to complaint, all I wanted to know was the status. She kept saying "eh ha, eh ha" ~ few mins later while I waited, she said we don't have the 2 items you ordered so that was why you didn't get an email and hung up on me!!! What da.....Most importantly,  I called back trying to speak to a manager, no one is available to talk!!! This target is falling apart!!

20.description: Worse pharmacy. Cheap on generic but if I'm using my insurance no one seems to know how to process. Yes they offer me savings but I shouldn't  have to go this route. Called the insurance myself thought I took care of the issue for future but I was sadly mistaken. They gave me a dozen possible reasons to what could be wrong w/my card. Used the same card at Walgreens and I was walking away 15 minutes later w/my meds. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

36.description: For a new target, I love it.  It's close and keeps money in the area.  not once have I gone in and not been able to find what I'm looking for.  The store is clean, and except for the random kiddies every now and then, I love it.  They do now carry [some] alcohol, and I love the bulk products in the back.  I've been able to find all sorts of stuff for hella cheap!

14.description: The Target closest to me is in Lincoln Park on Elston - that place is a nightmare!  This Target is an oasis compared to that madhouse!!  There is ample parking, you can walk without fear of being trampled to death by cars, carts or people and they actually have things in stock (go figure!).  I also found that they have a decent clearance section, and some of their items, especially in the grocery section, are priced lower than the Lincoln Park store.  Customer service has always been friendly, I hope it continues as this will be the Target of choice!

1.description: This place is pretty bad. I went to get my dad a coffee, and there was a dead fly in his cup! The employees there are unfriendly and unprofessional.

2.description: Never had a bad cup of coffee here but someone needs to train the employees in how a make a sandwich. I had the bagel egg, cheese and bacon this morning and the bagel was almost black and hard as a rock.I tried to eat trust the egg, and bacon but I stashed bad without the the bagel very rubbery.

0.description: Nicest, Fastest, Coffee shop in CHICAGO!! Nicest staff I know!  They take care of customers like PROFFESSIONALS

The customer service in here is mixed. Some days better then others. My recommendation is the Pineapple Sweet & Sour Chicken. For $6 you get a pretty good portion of Chicken with s&s sauce filled with bits of pineapple. You also get some white rice.

28.description: I ATE LIKE A KING for like TEN BUCKS!!!! Lmao!!! No,seriously.What a great deal!!!! Not only that but the food is delicious.They're fairly new at this location.I've driven by a few times and had my eye on them.Finally popped in tonight.And I GUARANTEE YOU that it won't be my last time.Im a NEW CUSTOMER.Will a repeat customer for sure!!!! Im glad I made it in there tonight.

1.description: Very disappointed in our experience at Zaytune today. My co-workers and I often frequent here for lunch and although we usually wait about 10 minutes for our food, today was out of control. There was only one order ahead of us (just 2 of us came in and ordered very simple meals of hummus, soup and a side order of chicken for my co-worker) and it took 35 minutes for our food to come out. We returned to work very late by the time we finished eating. In addition, our order was lacking. My lentil soup had no lemon (which is how it's served according to the menu and the only way I like it. Had I been informed I would not have ordered it) and when I requested some I was told that they didn't have any. Really? You opened your (Mediterranean!) restaurant less than an hour ago and you have no lemon? Also no soap in the bathroom. Also they changed their usual presentation of hummus to contain chunks of un-tasty tomatoes vs the usual fresh olives. This place is not cheap, but due to the lack of healthier food options in the area it is certainly always busy. I would love to support them but management needs to get it together. Have an adequate amount of staff at lunch times during weeks days. Don't change/eliminate the little things that make the food appealing (especially when you wait a ridiculous amount of time for it). I won't be back unless I'm desperate for food. It's just not worth the hassle.

9.description: This place is just as good as its bridgeport location.  I try and make a stop at one of these locations at least once a week.  I have yet to find a place with fresh pita that can compare to this place.

29.description: The food is excellent, fast, and well priced for what you get. Best Mediterranean I've had in a while.

23.description: Zaytune: translation is Olive.Olive equals delish.Let me start by saying I love the fact that there is finally a Middle Eastern restaurant with good food near work. This specific location has been open since October 2014. Went in there for the first time today. Met the owner, Dan. Nice guy. Parking situation sucks because its street parking but there were plenty of spots available when a few coworkers and i went.I had the chicken shawerma sandwich with fries. Pita bread is made on site daily. It is warm and delicious. Sandwich is huge, but mostly because of the lettuce used in the sandwich. Nonetheless, it is still a big, tasty portion. Fries were seasoned well and also a large portion. The peach iced tea was probably the best I've ever tasted in my life. Yeah, that good! The seating area is just ok. Nothing fancy. Clean!! It gets pretty busy around lunch time. I've recommended this restaurant to a few co-workers and they too have enjoyed it. Give it a try. Not bad at all.

5.description: This was a cozy restaurant, delicious food (tried Hummus, Falafel and a wrap).  In addition the service was friendly and helpful.
