31.description: Nothing makes me more excited than Mediterranean food. It's rare to see a good restaurant open up in the south side. Especially a restaurant that has halal meat. Trust me it's a big deal!  There should bee an option for six stars :) I wish the business the best of luck.

25.description: Just tried the new location the other day. I haven't been to Zaytune since last summer. Not sure if it was because I had take-out or not but the steak was a tad dry. Everything else was fresh and tasty as always. This place is a go-to when trying to eat healthy. However, I'm probably going to stick with the chicken wrap for now on since the steak has changed.

12.description: I came today to eat with my husband and the food was amazing. The portions are huge we ate full. We had a side of hummus and omg it was sooo good best one I had so far. My husband had the steak wrap and he was happy with his meal. I had the steak platter and wow it was just to die for. We will definitely be coming back. I highly recommend this place.

21.description: Yelp directed us to the best roasted red pepper hummus I have ever had.  Followed that up with a grilled wrap with lamb that was prepared to perfection.  The veggies in the wrap were fresh and crisp.  And the herb fries were amazing.  The chef came out of the kitchen and gave us some insights on the preparation methods, as well as let us try the falafel.  I will definitely be back for more.

16.description: Awesome food!! Best Mediterranean food I've had in a LONG time. We the salad with grilled chicken, steak wrap, and steak platter. The salad was so good- def didn't skimp on the chicken or veggies. Wrap was great too- love how they use flatbread instead of pita. Lastly, the platter. everything was good but the steak had a strange spice to it, not that I disliked it. It was just different! And the sauces that came with it were BOMB. Will definitely be back.

17.description: Thank you for opening this location.  I have came there every Tuesday & Thursday since a co-worker told me about this place.  I LOVE the chicken breast wrap, so HUGE.  Yummy as yummy can get.  The mix with that chicken, lettuce, small bites of tomatoes and that mild sauce in that awesome grilled flat bread makes me feel so much better about eating.  It truly is the BEST.  I tried the cucumber salad too and WHOA another HIT.  Thank you and you will see me every week.  Thank you by the way to the awesome gal up front who let me try the lettuce mix because I was afraid I wouldn't like BUT I loved it.  Always friendly.  Thanks again.

10.description: This place never fails. Every time I go I have the steak schwarma and it is always delicious and juicy. I recently had the lamb platter and you get what you pay for! The meat is never dry. I also recommend the fries. And the staff is always friendly. I will keep coming here for a long time.

11.description: This is a great spot to get some great food, and it's a good lead-in to Mediterranean food if you've never had it before.Everything is good here, and I had never heard of herb fries until this place (they're freaking amazing, btw). You can eat like a king for under ten dollars, because they give you some pretty decent sized portions here, which is great.You should definitely check it out when you can. You won't regret it at all.

26.description: I really love this place. I live a block away, and I am very happy to see a new type of restaurant  in the neighborhood as opposed to your normal fast food. I am a bicyclist so after my long bike rides to and from downtown, I am hungry like a wolf! and go straight to Zaytune. I've worked at Mediterranean restaurants, and ate at Mediterranean restaurants. but nothing like this one. The veggies taste fresh, and the meats are great! Very tender! I love the lentil soup, especially when I don't want to eat heavy before a bike ride. Believe me, a grilled wrap can feed two! But trust me, you won't wanna share! I love the fries! They are seasoned beautifully. Not to mention the purple sauce that comes with it. I don't know what is in that purple sauce and I don't wanna know. I am a visual artist and I consider Chef to be artists as well. So I like to keep things a mystery jaja. But really, great place, great food. Oh, and I know this is not on the menu, but the coffee is even awesome too !

27.description: Love this place! So excited they opened a new location close to home. Service is great and food is Yummy!!! Welcome to the neighborhood! I had the grill steak wrap and the meat is seasoned well and nice and tender. Everything is great! You won't be disappointed.

0.description: Thoroughly enjoyed the food and the service. The staff was accommodating, knowledgeable, and friendly. The food was fresh, made to order, and delicious. A wonderful gem in the neighborhood.

20.description: We were really craving some Mediterranean food for dinner and looked on yelp for a good place for take out. I ordered a grilled chicken shawarma wrap and my husband ordered a falafel wrap. We both also shared some herb fries. Everything was pretty tasty. The sauces are very good and some are spicy. The hummus is delicious. My wrap was pretty good for the most part. Some of the chicken tasted a little bitter like it was burnt or something, but other than that I have no complaints.

19.description: Let me start off by saying that I love the food & idea that Zaytune offers. However, at the Western location the woman manager really needs a refresher on what good customer service is. There has been two separate occasions where she has been rude to me. First time was when they first opened & being a regular at the original location I wanted to support the second location & even more since I moved a block away from the Western location. I went with my friend who was a first time guest & the woman took our orders with some attitude but I figured she was having a bad day. Our orders (2 wraps) took over 20min & left our food on the counter without informing me that my orders were ready to go until I asked her. My friend was disappointed in the customer service & I was embarrassed. Second time was tonight when after the gym my sister & I wanted a salad so we went to this location since it was on our way home. It was 9:30pm they close at 10pm & the door was open. I checked on Yelp to see there hours & it said they close at 10pm & like I said the door was open. When we walked in & asked if they were closed she simply looked at us and said "yeah" & went back to cleaning. I drove to the Morgan location where the guys happily toke our orders & even remembered us! I get that it must be annoying having customers walking in 30min before closing but an explanation that the kitchen closed early & an apology would have been great. She obviously doesn't like her job & I wouldn't be surprised if this location doesn't make it. I still love the food & would recommend ONLY the Morgan location. The guys at that location are funny, fast & delivery amazing customer service.

2.description: The food here has so much flavor and is always delicious. The herb fries are a must! So far I've eaten from here twice and no complaints. For about $7 per person you get large portions. I will continue to come and eat. I'll have to try the other locations that they have

32.description: Sooo excited they put a zaytune on western. It is much of a easier commute the Morgan street where there's lots of stop signs and one lane streets. I am not dissapointed at all!! I always get the grilled wrap with lamb and this time I got the chicken shawarma sooo delicious and the chicken was extra tender but not dry. The flat bread is amazing!! Excited to see if new things come to the menu and making this a weekly fast food spot

18.description: I ATE LIKE A KING for like TEN BUCKS!!!! Lmao!!! No,seriously.What a great deal!!!! Not only that but the food is delicious.They're fairly new at this location.I've driven by a few times and had my eye on them.Finally popped in tonight.And I GUARANTEE YOU that it won't be my last time.Im a NEW CUSTOMER.Will a repeat customer for sure!!!! Im glad I made it in there tonight.

13.description: I love this place but I need to mark them down after my last two visits. The food is great, its some of the best food in the area and I will probably go back for more, BUT the management of this place is really slipping, and customer service is suffering.After several visits when the place was bustling with sufficient workers, I came on a day where they seemed to be understaffed, the efficient lady who was normally in charge was nowhere to be found.The hat-on-backwards cashier (ChrisJ according to my receipt) mumbled everything he asked and then got mad and raised his voice when i misunderstood what he was asking. He was rude and acted like he did not want to be there. He also forgot the extra sauces we asked for. I was annoyed but my food was good, so it didn't stop me from coming back about a week later for more.This time ChrisJ was the cashier again, he was still mumbling but he seemed to have received an attitude adjustment, or maybe it was because my wife was with me this time. He was a bit more polite but still looked miserable. Another uniformed worker was out cold on one of the tables sleeping. No big deal, we thought, maybe his shift was upcoming or he just got off. We had a somewhat large to-go order, so we expected it to take 15 minutes or so. We sat down and waited. ChrisJ and another teenage looking worker seemed to be the only workers on duty. After 30 minutes of waiting, they come out and struggle to wake sleepy guy, who finally gets up moodily and goes in the back. After 45 minutes of waiting, we're getting mad, we go and say "what gives!?" Sorry, he says, we're cooking more rice and vegetables because we ran out. We were like, if you had told us, we'd have said forget the rice and the like 3 vegetables you put on each plate. We are super late! He apologizes sincerely, throws in some free dessert. We have to tell him make fresh fries since the fries have been sitting out done this whole 45 minutes and are now cold and soggy. I couldn't help but wonder if sleepy guy was summoned to prepare the rice, and why it took so long to get him back there. I don't expect two teenage workers to be the most organized or efficient (i wasn't at my first jobs!), I was glad that they were apologetic and trying to be nice about it. I don't really blame them! It seems like a manager should be on hand to stop things like this from happening. Kind of a shame, the food is so good, i'd probably still go back, but this kind of service is pretty disappointing.

4.description: They have quality food point blank. No matter what you order it is good. I love the plates, I like to mix it together gives you a burrito bowl feel. It is all made to order and fresh and hot. Well worth your time and price paid. The falafel is great, and the herb fries are worth the trip alone, get them well done and savor the dipping sauce or better get order and extra, you will be glad you did.

24.description: I ordered the Kefta Grill Wrap and it was delicious!!!! Huge portions--I can't wait to go back and try everything.

6.description: On Wednesday evening 1/6/15 I ordered a veggie kebab salad and a steak platter via delivery. I woke up in the middle of the night with the most severe food poisoning I've ever had. I am certain it was E. Coli based on the timing and severity. I missed two days of work and couldn't eat or move the entire next day. I wrote them an email and received NO response. Apparently, they don't care about food safety or their customers.

22.description: a great new twist on pita, good falafel,hummus,baba,kefta-kabob. awesome addition to the neighborhood.  welcome.

15.description: Freshly prepared food. I had the chicken shawarma grilled platter and the vegetables that was served along were very fresh and juicy unlike other restaurants where it is pre-cooked. Chicken along with the unique sauce tasted great. Went back to try the herb fries and they were delicious..I can have those without any sauces.

7.description: Steak Shawarma, chicken shawarma, hummus, herb fries, tahini sauce, salads, are all very tasty.  It all tastes exactly the same as the B-Port location.  If carrying out, call ahead.

8.description: Zaytune: translation is Olive.Olive equals delish.Let me start by saying I love the fact that there is finally a Middle Eastern restaurant with good food near work. This specific location has been open since October 2014. Went in there for the first time today. Met the owner, Dan. Nice guy. Parking situation sucks because its street parking but there were plenty of spots available when a few coworkers and i went.I had the chicken shawerma sandwich with fries. Pita bread is made on site daily. It is warm and delicious. Sandwich is huge, but mostly because of the lettuce used in the sandwich. Nonetheless, it is still a big, tasty portion. Fries were seasoned well and also a large portion. The peach iced tea was probably the best I've ever tasted in my life. Yeah, that good! The seating area is just ok. Nothing fancy. Clean!! It gets pretty busy around lunch time. I've recommended this restaurant to a few co-workers and they too have enjoyed it. Give it a try. Not bad at all.

30.description: Delicious, just like the Bridgeport location.  Thank you for bringing something healthy to the neighborhood!

3.description: I figured since this was closer to my new place I could just come here instead of the Bridgeport location. Wrong! Yelp let me down on this. I ordered the Grilled Chicken Shawarma Platter, which is what I always get at the other location. It tasted different from the first bite, but it is honestly not bad. It is just not as tasteful as the Bridgeport location. I also ordered herb fries and it came with so little and lacked flavor. Everything here just taste different, so I will not be coming back here. Even though this is closer, I will definitely go to the one on Morgan St. It is 10x better there!

14.description: We were really craving some Mediterranean food for dinner and looked on yelp for a good place for take out. I ordered a grilled chicken shawarma wrap and my husband ordered a falafel wrap. We both also shared some herb fries. Everything was pretty tasty. The sauces are very good and some are spicy. The hummus is delicious. My wrap was pretty good for the most part. Some of the chicken tasted a little bitter like it was burnt or something, but other than that I have no complaints.

1.description: This place has the home made tamales that remind me of the  old days growing up in Wicker Park in the 60's.  Not the Mexican variety but like Tom-Toms (just yellow corn meal with a chile filling.  I think they were .60 a pc and Mike (the owner) from 3rd generation will sell as many as you want.  He stocks a full line of catering and picnic foods too, but the tamales are home made.  It's a little store front so you have to watch for it closely.  Take out only.

2.description: Awesome tamales!!!!!!  And what a deal as far as the price goes!  You can't go wrong stopping here and stocking up your freezer.  The only drawback is that they sure could use a parking lot.

0.description: I've had Veterans tamales since I was a kid and Mike sold them on the ĉorner of Aberdeen st.I no longer live in Bridgeport but travél there often to get my supply of freshly made tamales.

3.description: I really hate this place. For the most part the employees are friendly and helpful but that is all overshadowed by "Ms Rita" First of all what kind of elitist person has them put Ms. on their name tag? I've been to other Party City stores and they have never asked me for an ID with a credit card purchase. This lady always does. I sometimes do have an ID because I don't always have a need for it. I have the unfortunate luck of always getting this lady. She is rude and sarcastic. I thought that it was only me but apparently I am not alone.They are overpriced on several items but they are convenient. You have to pay attention to the prices because I had a situation where they tried charging me more than an item was worth.

1.description: If any stars at all....I walk in looking for one item and no one that worked there wanted to help! After two employees telling me they were busy, I asked an elderly customer and she helped me!  It's too bad the previous female manager isn't there anymore...she had that place hopping even if it meant she shouted across the floor!

2.description: Avoid this place. Incompetent employees, hanging up on customers, bitching about having to work. This is where high school burn outs go to die. Took em 20 mins to ring me up and inflate 5 balloons. Fuck this place.

5.description: Party Favors everywhere! Even a section for costumes.  Great place if your on a time crunch and don't have time to go to 5 different stores to get everything for your get-together.  (Plates, cups, toys, candy, games, balloons, table cloths, adorments etc) Prices are a bit high for many items but very convenient one-stop shop.

6.description: This location is rather large (though I think that's "average size" for the Party City chain) and I was able to spend only about a minute wandering before I was asked by a sales associate if I was looking for anything in particular.  I wasn't - so they let me browse in peace.I think 90% of the clientele here has to be in the "my child is having a birthday party and I'm not making 3 stops to get supplies" group.  Likewise, the majority of their merchandise here seemed to be in the "pick a theme/cartoon character/TV show/merchandise mascot and here's a bunch of supplies in that style" variety.  Yes, if my daughter loves Dora the Explorer, I can set up an entire party with Dora hats, cups, tablecloths, piñata, goodie bags, toys, cake decorations - you name it and they have it.The problem is the rest of the merchandise, I guess.  I mean if you're having a party, this place can sell you the cups you'd be better off buying in a restaurant supply place, costumes you'd be better off buying at a real costume shop or for cheaper at a drugstore during Hallowe'en, and candies you can get just about ANYWHERE when they're holiday related.But sometimes their prices are better.  And sometimes you just don't want to make 3 stops.  And sometimes you've got a child who won't be satisfied until they're eating a Spongebob cake and drinking milk from a Spongebob cup that will spill on the Spongebob tablecloth and you'll have to wipe it up with Spongebob napkins and then give out a Spongebob whistle in a Spongebob gift bag to stop the crying over spilled milk.  Spongebob.This would then be your go-to place.

7.description: All the folks working there were very friendly and helpful.. it was the end of the night so I was surprised. I got in and out without too much wait or problems.. I will be back for more Halloween shopping.. they just had too much to take in all in one visit.. great location for parking and CTA

8.description: The selection is good. They do stock for just about any kind of event you could think of. The best is going there when things are on clearance the day after a holiday. Huge Savings. The only drawback to this location is sometimes its hard to find a sales person for some help.

0.description: It's the place to go to for Halloween! It was a bit disorganized when I came in for my wig, but that's typical when it's the week of Halloween.I like that they extend their hours during Halloween, so they're open until 10PM. However, I think they charge a little bit extra on other things like candy and decorations. I think you could definitely find better deals somewhere else.Also, you can only get store credit on Halloween merchandise that hasn't been used.

4.description: This place rocks!! I was there on Saturday March 8,2013 and the girls who were working the balloon counter was doing their thing. They had a billion orders and had them all under control. The cashier was super nice even after ringing up customer after customer. This place is huge and they have everything. They always speak when you come through the door and always asking you what you need. These girls and the guy are great. This is my go to party store for any and everything! Way to go. They could teach the people at the Party City on S. Cicero a thing or two about customer service. Thank you for being rock stars ALL THE TIME!!!!!!!

12.description: We work in Pilsen and has a lot of choices around us. Yet we order Chinese from here for a few reasons:Huge portions even the lunch specials!! You can get two meals out of it!Fresh and hot when delivered and ON TIME. We work in a school with so little lunch time, they are always on time. and so far I like what I ordered: orange chicken, beef and brocoli, beef over pan friend rice noodle, mongolian beef, and szechuan dish. egg rolls are huge and one last thing, the special came with SHRIMP fried rice!!!

7.description: Best. Chinese. Ever. The Good: The food is cheap and the portions are generous. Lunch specials are $4.95 before 3pm or $5.95 thereafter. Served with shrimp fried rice and a huge egg roll. Nothing is frozen!!! The veggies in my Kung Pao Chicken were soft and tender without feeling like they were defrosted this morning. The chicken was tasty but the shrimp fried rice killed it. Fresh juicy little shrimps and fluffy rice. *insert drooly face here*The Bad: The counter guy is kinda, well, rough. Haha his English is hard to understand and if you're ordering delivery I suggest online to make sure everything is right. The Ugly: Parking. Parking in Chicago is TERRIBLE. But you knew that. Don't park in the gas station because I watched them tow a car. Just look around for street parking if you aren't in their delivery area.

3.description: I wish I could give this place negative stars. We ordered some fried rice from this place and it looks great. WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!! Get get half way through the rice and guess what we find?! A freakin band aid!!!!!!!!!! Almost threw up when I saw it. How can you not notice when you lose a bloody band aid and not know where it is. Please be careful next time you order from this place.

1.description: Taste of food: pretty good run of the mill greasy American Chinese food. I live down the block so it's super convenient and I've pick up a few time before today. I WILL NEVER RETURN.Seriously do not eat at this establishment. I just stopped in and ordered a meal, I go to sit down and there is a GIANT cockroach crawling all lover the chair. This cockroach was HEALTHY and about the size of a quarter. It had no feared being seen and it just crawled up and around the chair I was almost about to sit in(thank god) and then climbed the wall to the ceiling. I can only imagine what is going on the kitchen. If you have any self respect for your body, please I beg you not to eat here. They are very friendly and the food is great and greasy.... But not worth the conditions. I am unnerved that I even live down the street from this place.

2.description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. I order from here very often and they have been great until today. I ordered Mongolian beef and received it with only 5 pieces of meat literally, and the rest was all onions. I called to inform them that my order had no beef and the owner which is the lady stated that it's per ounces. I explained that I understood that but all of the ounces were of onions and she said she understood that but that's what they sent. I asked if she would fix it and she said no that that was her Mongolian beef even if it didn't have many pieces of meat. By far the worst service I have ever received and do not recommend anyone to go here. They cheat you out of the food you order(stingy). Very disappointed.

9.description: I suppose that after getting lunch from here on average twice a week for about 5 months, I should write a review of the place.Frankly, the only reasons why I got lunch from here in the first place are 1) that I'm daring and 2) that most of the other places for lunch in a 3-block walking radius from the office were closed down for "renovations".  So when Jazzy Bean bit the big one a while back, I walked a little farther and found this place.  And I'm frankly never going back to Papa Freddie's if I can help it.Being a Fat American, this place has all of the staple "this is what 'Chinese food' is to Fat American" menu choices, and they offer a lunch special that comes with shrimp fried rice and an eggroll.  Done deal.The first time I got food here, I was dismayed that there was no Governor's Chicken lunch special here.  So I went with my backup, Sesame Chicken.  Which was pretty much 60% chicken, 10% watery sauce, and 30% broccoli.  Now I'm not at all a fan of vegetables.  When I get chicken, I want chicken.  I didn't ask for a salad.  That being said, the chicken was satisfactory and the broccoli was not so satisfactory.Next time, I tried the Mongolian Beef.  This was 30% beef, 20% sauce and 50% vegetables.  Not at all beneficial. in my mind.I bounced around the menu, invited co-workers to adventure with me, and finally I hit upon Lunch Special #21: Orange Chicken.  0% vegetables.  The sauce was not at all watery, and had good flavor.  The chicken was... well, what you would expect from a hole-in-the-wall Chinese joint.  But it got the job DONE.  And I've never turned my nose down at the heaping pile of fried rice with the little tiny shrimpies.  And they make a darn fine eggroll to boot.So that's my go-to now.  It's lunch (and occasionally there's enough leftovers for a 2nd lunch the next day) and it's quick and painless.  In fact, my "lunch bunch" and I will stop in, order up our lunch specials, pay the guy (who now recognizes us on sight and remembers that one of us always requests white rice instead of fried), and then head over to Walgreens for some drinks and whatever else we need - then we head right back to pick up our completed lunches and head back to the office to chow down.Why only 3 stars?  Well, they're inconsistent.  I finally hit upon The Lunch for me, and yet randomly the sauce would change in flavor or viscosity, or the chicken would taste like it was far more sub-par bits o' meat, or it would be overcooked and stringy.  It's like they have 4 difference chefs back there and you never which one is gonna make your food (or one chef with wild mood swings or multiple personality disorder).  And then next week, back to the stuff I like and it tastes fine again.But it's not enough to deter me.  The food is really not great.  But the Orange Chicken Lunch Special has gotten me through some very stressful days, and I admit that it re-heats well (or rather that re-heating it doesn't affect the flavor/texture very much).Only other major problem?  They're closed on Mondays.Too bad - sometimes Mondays are the days I MOST need some Orange Chicken Lunch Special...

18.description: The portions are big, but more importantly taste good. It isn't the fanciest food but certainly better than anything else anywhere close. The more basic dishes (Mongolian Beef, etc) were better than the "specials." They are pleasant on the phone and inside. I will certainly order again.

10.description: This place has awesome orange chicken, fried rice and their crab ragoon is really tasty. It's a take out joint, not a sit down place. It's annoying when people give take out places poor reviews expecting high quality food for as if it was a 4 star restaurant. It's a take out place and you pay dirt cheap.

13.description: If you live in China Wok's delivery order, I have to recommend that you get delivery from Jim Ching's instead.  The prices are a little higher but the food is way better....Triple Kung Poa was missing the Poa here (where was the price) and the Curry Supreme was missing the beef.  In addition, they forgot the smoothies?  We have just called for them to deliver free smoothies so maybe that will make things better, but we kind of wanted them when we ordered the food a few days ago.

16.description: I ordered Pot Stickers and Beef Lo Mein from here, along with one Strawberry Banana smoothie. The Pot Stickers and Lo Mein were BLAND, hardly any flavor. The smoothie was way too sugary and very small. Really generic stuff here, I would suggest driving to Chinatown since it isn't that far from this location. It'll be around the same price but it'll actually be worth it.

17.description: Used GrubHub delivery. Lots of food for the price. Plenty of food in the $8.75 appetizer tray, and it's all good. The watermelon smoothie tastes like a real watermelon. The orange chicken lunch special is a lot of food for a cheap price, too, and it's yummy, too. Will order again, especially since given a menu with coupons with the order!

15.description: If only their smoothies had tapioca balls!  It disappoints me when Chinese places show pictures of smoothies, some with the tapioca, but don't actually have bubble tea.  It's a dirty trick to lure me inside.They have some meatless items, the portion sizes are enough for leftovers and it's reasonably priced. I bought Chinese broccoli (I try to avoid Asian brown gravy).  So good!  Then again, I added some stuff once I got home (sesame seeds, soy sauce).  A standard Chinese place, but good enough for me to return one day, especially because so many Chinese places in my neck of the woods don't have a lot of meatless stuff, some not even tofu.  What a difference from the northside!

0.description: Your traditional neighborhood chinese restaurant with good prices and good sizes. Their szeschuan veggies are delicious

5.description: SEE UPDATE!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS FILTHY PLACE!!!!Ordered here before and was pleased with the food, quantity, taste, and price. I decided to come back for more soon after, but this time around, I was cheated. I was billed for a size large and they packed a small sized order. To add insult to injury - no plastics, nor napkins were included. The food tasted completely different in comparison to the last time. It tasted horrible! - I ordered the exact same thing! Disgusted. I'll go elsewhere from now....be warned!Update: I was starving and figured I would try the place again to see if things were better (it was within walking distance of the McKinley park library). Big mistake!!!! I ended up contracting viral gastroenteritis from contaminated food!!!!! I was admitted to RUSH as I was in pretty bad shape - this has never happened to me in my entire life!!! Forget this place...!!! I will never step foot in here if its the last thing I do. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!! Do not chance your health by eating at this dump.

11.description: China wok is unfortunately a great place to order from when I blow off making dinner, which is really counter-productive!  Their food is great, hot, and FAST.  I can order the food, put my shoes on, and walk over to China wok and the food is ready.  And it's a five minute walk.  I figure the walk saves me the delivery fee and tip, PLUS I can work off the impending calories first.I've not had anything I don't care for here, and we've been trying new things to branch out.  Between an appetizer or two and one big entree, I have food for like three days!  I don't spend much time in the restaurant, but there is a waiting area if your food isn't quite ready yet.

8.description: It's an ordinary Chinese restaurant for a workday lunch. Their speed is fast. Street parking. Only visa and MasterCard accepted.

4.description: FAST! HOT! DELICIOUS! FRIENDLY! ACCURATE!I'm not crazy about the soup, and haven't tried the smoothies.  The orange chicken, egg rolls, crab rangoon, and chicken fried rice hit the spot! Been ordering here over a year and have never had a bad experience. Do it up!

14.description: Well, let's jump into it.  This place serves food that is bland, bland, bland...  Yes, the second time I ordered (we were desperate) I asked them to spice it up a bit more.  Nope.  First, I had the Curry Chicken dish.  The curry sauce was so watered down it was barely recognizable as such.  I mean, it was a waste of money, truly.  A flavorless mess with only one positive - the chicken.  Had there been any more spices, or sauce to flavor those chicken chunks up, we might have been able to enjoy the dish.  When I asked them to make it spicier, I got the same thing.  The person I ordered with, had the Sweet & Sour Chicken dish.  They said it was just "alright" and nothing special.  Oddly enough, I saw one other reviewer write about how bland the pot stickers were.  I would say that's not entirely true.  I actually enjoyed mine and the addition of the sauce made it a nice light and tasty treat.  It is on the basis of the pot stickers that they earned a second star.  I actually have a taste for them at times!  Maybe I should just order two of them and eat as dinner and a snack?The pork fried rice was standard fare.  The BBQ pork was not good at all.  It just tasted "off" to me.  The one very positive thing to note is the service.  When I went in there, they did tell me if there is a certain way that I want things done or have a special order - let them know.  I thought that was very nice of them.  And, I may try another dish and call in some special instructions the next time.  If they strike out again, I will just indulge in the pot stickers from time-to-time and leave it at that.

6.description: Food: Excellent! Always steaming hot with heaping portions.Prices: You can't beat it! Lunch specials are a steal and the regular entrees are well priced anyway.Service: Wonderful. The owners are so nice and I always look forward to seeing them. The lady is such a sweetheart!Recommendation: Orange chicken lunch special, crab rangoon, and (in the summer) a watermelon/honey dew smoothie.China Wok is by far my favorite quick Chinese restaurant, and I've been to many all over the city. I have been frequenting this place for over a year now and have never had a bad meal. The owners are nice and the shop is cute with an ever-changing display of fish in their aquarium. Plus, they have comfortable seating (booth style) if you want to eat-in.

3.description: This is a new location in the Riverside Square plaza right next to Subways. First time went fine (hair cut, body parts intact.) I was pleasantly surprised on my second visit of which I checked in online that they had my information from last time (i.e., what haircut I got last time.) Checked out the new doo, and I was pleased with how it turned out. Actually better than the first time!

1.description: I was not at all satisfied. First- I only went here because it was close and I needed a desperate trim. I got there and the wait was fine.. The staff was friendly and the facility was clean! I checked in at the front desk and asked for a wash and cut. When it was my turn - the last took me straight to the chair without washing my hair at all! (At the time it wasn't a big deal because I had showered the night before.) my haircut took about 5 minutes (which is unusual because I had hair halfway down my back and it's super thick). At the time it looked fine but who really knew.. I got home and went to put my hair in a braid and BAM!! My hair is uneven and all these hairs stick out and aren't long enough to complete the braid. The next day I straightened my hair and could see the unevenness and physically had to take scissors and even it out. Needless to say I will never be going back here and I suggest you just stick to a salon that you know will provide you with a great service.

2.description: Be warned! Checked my credit card statements and I was overcharged several times at this location. The hair dressers steal from patrons by billing you more than the allotted tip! Disgusting. I've already logged a complaint with corporate. Stay away from this place!

0.description: I've taken my 4-year-old daughter three separate times. Each time the wait was minimal and the staff were very friendly. The ladies who have cut my child's hair have been very patient with her and have made an effort to engage her in conversation. The prices are reasonable and the location is convenient. I appreciate, also, that there is a parking lot.

4.description: Where else in Bridgeport/Pilsen can you get a haircut for 13 bucks?  No appointment necessary and my stylist told new next time I can use their app and check in online so I only have to wait a few minutes at most.  Everyone there is friendly and welcomes you and your kid and give great service.  This is the place.  Will keep coming.  Great parking and a Mariano's in a few months.   Yeah.

0.description: I just purchased a Samsung phone from this location.  Great phone and service plans.  Andy gave me a knowledgeable  service and a free gift too.  I'll be adding 2 more family lines for my wife and kid next week.  Thanks Andy.

1.description: One of the worst things about this place is the customer service. The cashiers are usually ok, but if you ask any of the other employees anything, they usually give you a mumbled answer. We shop mostly for produce and certain things like granola. They pack their own granola, seeds and nuts which are usually a lot more inexpensive than other stores.Recent bonus: They just placed an Amazon locker in the exit area. This is a great alternative for us, at times we have problems receiving packages in our building, so having them sent to the locker is great.

9.description: This Cermak Produce doesn't pass the smell test, literally.  It stinks!  When I walked in the door, the smell was noticeable.  As I moved through the produce section, the smell only got stronger until I got to the meat department.  Yikes!  I passed on all the meat and deli items, and wound up only buying some lettuce and cilantro, neither of which were particularly fresh or good.  I came here years ago, and had a similar reaction.  I gave it a second chance recently, but I won't be going back because I wouldn't trust a thing from their stinky meat department or their produce section.  I'll make this real simple: do NOT shop at this Cermak Produce.

23.description: I love this place and shop here regularly (though I also love Stanley's).  Their ready-made guacamole and salsas are awesome (much better than Stanley's).  Being a vegetarian, I can't speak to the quality of their meat counter, but their produce is definitely prefereable to the big supermarket chains.  My only gripe is I wish they would stock some organic produce.  But of the items I purchase here regularly, I can't say enough about how much I appreciate that they have them: an uncomparable selection of tortillas; terrific variety of Mexican cheeses, authentic tortilla chips, dried and powdered chilis (though they seem to be out of some of these lately); imported Cokes (yes--they sometimes have Mexican-made Cokes made with sugar instead of corn syrup); several kinds of ready-made flan, and even decent-in-a-pinch baguettes!  As I mentioned above, I am a huge fan of their guacamole and salsas, especially the tubs of Salsa Roja.  Lately, however, they have not had the creamy one that is smooth and pink, which makes me sad, but maybe it's a seasonal thing?The other great thing about this Cermak Produce is the Apache Grill next door (see separate review).  If you're not up for cooking and you want a super-casual dining experience at a taqueria/pizza place that's cheap/no-frills but also sells cold ones, this is the place for you!

5.description: It's a little Mexican grocery store with lower prices but kind of limited selection. Customer service is not something they have heard about. Pretty ignorant staff and I always hear comments behind my back.

25.description: Cermak Produce has the cheapest prices in the McKinley Park neighborhood and the quality is REALLY GOOD!  Dominick's and Jewel doesn't compare many times with both the quality and prices.They're butcher selection has some of the best choices of meat. Very lean with very little fat on them.There is also a great variety of mexican products here that will not be carried by the big chains.

12.description: Some people enjoy getting all their shopping done at one store. I don't. I enjoy a variety and seeing what the city has to offer. If you are one of those people this Cermak Produce probably isn't for you.  It's a relatively small store but definitely has an upside.  I did, however; learn one thing while at this store - I will never set foot in a Whole Foods again. Well not never...they do carry some items on sale but I think you get the point. Let me explain... 12.5 oz jar of hot sauce made in Mexico $1.19 9 oz of Queso Fresco cheese $1.99 5 heads of garlic $1 2.36 lb of bananas $1.16 1 lb bag of carrots $0.43 1 bunch of celery $0.69 3 lbs onions $0.99 Total, including the 17 cents in tax (yes, that's a 2.25% tax rate and no, I have no idea how they get away with that), was $7.62. I think I've made my point. This store does have a meat counter and a variety of other items in their aisles. But I feel this store really shines in the large vegetable department and the spice/chile area.  For these items alone I will be back. Saving money isn't a bad thing either.

21.description: They have good prices on produce and meats.I usually get the pica de gallo and guacamole sometimes.The meat selection and prices are great.

16.description: This is my one stop shop for most of my grocery needs. Produce is great here and the deli has a huge selection for everyone. They have great sales and specials and always have a great stock of other items. You can get yer milk and eggs or some carnitas and fried fish also.. what more could you ask for.

17.description: Depends on the day or the week there are sometimes good deals here, however, parking is always crazy.

10.description: They have good prices on produce and meats.I usually get the pica de gallo and guacamole sometimes.The meat selection and prices are great.

11.description: I am really torn about this place. You can find some damn good deals on produce here, probably some of the best in the city that i have seen. It is a tiny little place and they set a very festive atmosphere with the music cranking. I found myself several times wanting to shake my booty in the aisles but I resisted the urge and just kept it to tapping my feet. I do have a possible HUGE matter of concern with this place. When we got back to the meat section, there was an AWFUL yet somewhat unrecognizeable odor. Lara thought it smelled like urine and i thought it smelled like something rotting. I am hoping that this odor was just emanating from an unsanitary, unwashed customer and NOT the meat case!

26.description: This place is great!  It's so cheap and quality isn't bad at all.  This is THE place to get limes!  They are soooo much cheaper here than dominicks or jewel!

22.description: I'm giving them 4 stars because they got rid of the cantaloupe soy milk that they used to carry...Good selection for a small grocery store, focus on fresh foods and for people who cook at home. not much in the way or prepared foods, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

0.description: Nice little grocery store. They have some pretty good deals and its appearance is well kept. They have a good selection of fruits and veggies as well as poultry. I did notice they had some meat called "Aracherita" Baby skirt steak. I've never heard of this. I don't know if they dubbed the steak themselves and it's actually outer skirt steak but now I will have to try it to see if they make great tacos. Some of the employees that work there are not that knowledgeable as to what they stock. I asked a stocker (of all people) where I could find some squash blossoms and he responded with "you're actually the second person to ask me, we don't stock any". 2 aisles over I found the canned squash blossoms with the vegetables. Had this stocker known what they stock, I would have given them 5 stars. Other that, it's a nice place to shop for a quick few things.

20.description: This is the place to go to if you need cheap produce, but that's about it.  Their produce section is where you'll find the bargains.  The jicamas here are large and of better quality than you'll find at most other supermarkets.  The chiles and peppers are a better selection here.  Deals on things like onions make this place great, and some fruits I just don't really see that often.As for the meat counter, I could take it or leave it.  Most of the stuff you can identify without speaking a word of Spanish, but there are some products there which require a little bit of "la lengua" to ensure that you don't wind up with cow's tongue (lengua) when you wanted a steak.  Also, come here if you'd like a place to purchase parts of animals that most Americans wouldn't fathom ever allowing to touch their plates, let alone their mouths.The bakery is a good choice, for the range of tortillas and authentic chips and salsas.  Their sweetbreads smell delicious, though I've never bought one, but I can attest to delicious homemade flan found in their refrigerated section.  Oh, and they have a good selection of authentic Mexican cheeses.Lastly, the churros.  If you've been to this store and haven't found them, you have to pick your checkout aisle carefully - the box with fresh churros is hiding near the middle lane, right behind the conveyor belt.  $1.50 for a fresh strawberry churro is worth coming here, even if I haven't bought anything else.A trip to this Cermak Produce isn't complete without gorging on said strawberry churro in the parking lot and on the way to the #35 bus back home.

19.description: Good produce and good meats at a very good price.  I always buy their raw pollo en adobo.  Just take it home, open the package, and plop it on the grill.  No additional prep work required, and the final product is delicious.If you want a shopping cart, make sure you have a quarter for the Aldi-esque locking mechanism.

2.description: The service at this store has decreased once the new manager took over. The cashiers are extremely rude and ignorant. They look at you with an attitude when they packing your groceries. Ivonne and Rebeca are the worst. I have already complaint about them but the manager does do anything about it. I hope one day I come across the owner because I will express my feelings.

18.description: I'm giving them 4 stars because they got rid of the cantaloupe soy milk that they used to carry...Good selection for a small grocery store, focus on fresh foods and for people who cook at home. not much in the way or prepared foods, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

13.description: What a crazy deal! Maybe it's just that I'm used to downtown grocery store prices, but I was truly impressed by the prices. Let me enumerate the deals:2 lbs of steak $41 pack of queso fresco $1.501 pack of chorizo(2 links) $1.50Fuji applies .99/lbonions .99/lblimes 10 for $1.50small avocados .392 lbs of short ribs $4tomatoes .39/lbcilantro 3/$1I got a bunch of stuff all for $23!!! It would have at least twice as much at a regular grocery store. AWESOME!!!

4.description: DO NOT BUY CHICKEN HERE!!!!!I used to shop fruit and vegetable at this store a lot. Yesterday I grab one pack of raw chicken and big surprise when I opened it....Chicken still in shape but smell so bad bad very discussing!!!! So gloss...,I went back to store right way and return to cashier. She ask me when did I buy??? Hello Girl!! you not even look on receipt!!! I have to wait till one guy came out to look the package... No one say sorry or feel guilty about sell spoil chicken to customer at all. Shame on you!!!

24.description: often a better fruit selection than stanley's.  Vegetables are mostly oriented towards latin cuisine, which is great, if that's what your cookin, otherwise it's a little limited.margaritas? hello 20/$1 limes

6.description: I've been here a few times as it is the closest grocery store to my house, but this morning was the last time for me. I went for 2 things: a drink and something to take to work for lunch. First I went to the freezer for something frozen to take to lunch. There's barely any selection, but I settled on a frozen lasagna meal. I go to take it, and it's stuck to the box below it. I look a little closer and see that the pile of frozen lasagna had obviously been left out to melt because all the boxes were stuck together. I decide to try the chicken fettuccine, but got the same thing. Gross. Won't this make people sick? Keep frozen items in the freezer. Instead I had to settle on Hot Pockets. Meh. Then I went to grab a drink. I took a can of Starbucks Refreshers and checked out. Once on the bus, I took the can out of the bag and went to open it. There was a thick layer of dust and dirt on the top of the can. I'm not gonna put my mouth on that! I waiting until I got to work to wash the can, then poured it into a cup. Disgusting. They obviously do not adhere to whatever safety rules grocery stores are supposed to abide by. Nearby alternatives: Jewel a few blocks south on Archer or Dominick's at 32nd and Ashland. There's also a really nice and clean Cermak Produce on Halsted, around 29th Street.

15.description: The good news is, it's cheap.  The bad news is, it's small.  Well, you can get Mexican produce here (cactus leaves, green onions with the bulb, peppers...) and sometimes even harder to find stuff like persimmons, but it's still not as big as Pete's.  And you sometimes get what you pay for in terms of quality. I only go here if I'm going to Target and realize I need some fruit too, so I stop in. I don't make any special trips.Sometimes the fruit and veggies are fresh.  But last time I went, oranges were 10 for $1.70 (yay) but I only picked out 4 (boo).  The rest didn't loook edible.  Again, hit or miss.  Fresh or nasty.  Like other fruit and veggie markets, unless you catch a sale, the other groceries are pricey.Go to Pete's if you can.

7.description: I drove 4 Asian friends to this place to shop here. They each wanted to buy a total of 5 bags of rice, which were on sale. Since, they were elderly, I helped them load the bags of rice onto a cart and pushed it around. Then the Mexican manager appeared out of nowhere and put his hand on our cart and said, "No, I won't let you buy so much rice. I will only let you buy 2 bags. Its limit two bags. Look at the sign. Limit 2 per family."1st, I pointed out just cause my 4 friends were Asian, it doesn't mean all Asians are related. 2nd, I can read and your since does not say anything about a "limit." 3rd, your sign says nothing about a "family limit"The racist fat  piece of crap kept arguing with us and refused to let us by the rice. I informed my elderly friends to leave the cart and to take our business elsewhere.After informing other friends of what happened, we heard multiple reports of similar things happening to other Asians at that store.This store likes to pick on Asians and refuse them service. They are blatantly racist.Unless you're Mexican, don't bother shopping here.Boycott these Racist Assholes and Don't Shop here. It's 2010 and racism is well alive at Cermak Produce.

8.description: This is a very large store for being considered a "fruit market".  There are rows and rows of fruit and veggies.  The fruit always looks (and tastes) great.  I have not purchased veggies yet; they do not look as fresh as the fruit does. I come here for their 10 cent produce sales.  It's also a great place to go when looking for the hard-to-find ingredients needed for making authentic Mexican dishes.

3.description: We used to shop here a lot for produce and meat but we've transitioned to mostly organics and they don't have any organic stuff here.  The deli counter is still a pretty good deal.  The guac is good too.  The banda music that plays in there is too loud and is offensive to the ears.

14.description: This is the place to go to if you need cheap produce, but that's about it.  Their produce section is where you'll find the bargains.  The jicamas here are large and of better quality than you'll find at most other supermarkets.  The chiles and peppers are a better selection here.  Deals on things like onions make this place great, and some fruits I just don't really see that often.As for the meat counter, I could take it or leave it.  Most of the stuff you can identify without speaking a word of Spanish, but there are some products there which require a little bit of "la lengua" to ensure that you don't wind up with cow's tongue (lengua) when you wanted a steak.  Also, come here if you'd like a place to purchase parts of animals that most Americans wouldn't fathom ever allowing to touch their plates, let alone their mouths.The bakery is a good choice, for the range of tortillas and authentic chips and salsas.  Their sweetbreads smell delicious, though I've never bought one, but I can attest to delicious homemade flan found in their refrigerated section.  Oh, and they have a good selection of authentic Mexican cheeses.Lastly, the churros.  If you've been to this store and haven't found them, you have to pick your checkout aisle carefully - the box with fresh churros is hiding near the middle lane, right behind the conveyor belt.  $1.50 for a fresh strawberry churro is worth coming here, even if I haven't bought anything else.A trip to this Cermak Produce isn't complete without gorging on said strawberry churro in the parking lot and on the way to the #35 bus back home.

3.description: Comical one Barista pronounces ESPRESSO as "EXPRESSO"..snicker. A customer  next to me said "That is the pronunciation in 'the hood". Okeedokee

1.description: This Starbucks is located inside the Target store. Its at the corner of 33rd/Damen. I normally do not like Starbucks coffee (I think it is way too strong). I was given a gift card by a patient, and decided to try something else other than coffee. The barista was very nice in describing the iced coffee flavors. I decided to try the caramel frapp and was hooked. Since I had $50.00 to spend, I downloaded the Starbucks app and had the value added. The caramel frapp is not strong and is creamy because I asked for extra whip cream. The barista asked me if I liked the flavor and seemed genuine when she asked. When I paid for my drink the first time, I used the gift card. After downloading the Starbucks app, I added gift card value onto the app and left the gift card at home. Update: When I went on another day, I tried using the Starbucks app and was told that I couldnt use it. When I asked why, the barista replied that she was not aware how to use an app to pay, even though I showed her it was indeed a Starbucks App.Altho the Baristas are very good, I am giving them 3 stars because they should be able to take the Starbucks App.

2.description: Who doesn't like a good Starbucks, customer service is always stable and always friendly. Their products are top notched. I like their caramel flan frappe' so delicious all I want for a dessert or a sweet treat. It's not cheap but it's a good treat for me and my husband.

5.description: Decent Starbucks located conveniently in a Target. The staff is usually friendly, but the lines can get pretty long here.

6.description: This is a decent Starbucks pretty much the only one in my area that gets the job done. They usually get my order wrong which is frustrating but I still keep going like an idiot to get my fix.

0.description: Excellent service here this am for my first coffee of the day!! Place is located in a target and the staff is quite fast!!

4.description: I always use my Starbucks app to pay for my drinks since it's much more convenient.  But I couldn't use my Starbucks app to pay. Their register wouldn't except it and the cashier made no effort to figure out why the register wouldn't accept it. My friend had to pay for my drink (embarrassing). Ordered a caffe latte which tasted like warm milk. Don't plan on coming at this location again.

58.description: The food is a million times better than the Huck Finn down the street.  Try getting soup from Hucks @ 11 PM..they won't have any.  Archview will never tell you that the soup has run dry.   I recommend the Chicken Quesadillas, Breaded Pork Tenderloin, Turkey Melt the Godmother, and even the meatloaf.  Stay away from the pasta though..the sauce is not good.  Anything on the breakfast menu is a winner as well.  Those reviewers who moaned about grease and death need to look themselves in the mirror because there are many healthy options to choose from as well.

56.description: Now....had I written this review a few visits back it likely would have gotten 4 stars, however, considering I may end up with some terrible hacking cough I'm giving it 3. Though it should be 2, the extra star is for the yummy omlette and hasbrowns. One of the waitresses was sick and I watched her actively cough repeatedly into her hands, then switch to using a napkin to cough into and then back to her hands. She casually wiped them on her apron and then picked up some toast, buttered it, placed in onto a plate and served it to some unsuspecting guest. EFFING GROSS LADY! She also had giant long green painted fingernails. St. Patty's day is over lady, cut those things. You work in a restaurant, do you have any idea what sorta germs live under your nails when you're not coughing like you have SARS? I'm gonna guess probably not! It appeared as though she didn't even give a second thought into her coughing fit right near all the food....ugh!!Thankfully Mike and I had another waitress and I watched her like a hawk! I also watched to make sure the SARS lady was no where near my plate when it came out. Bacon and cheese omlette was yummy. Had to ask for a refill, though, they were busy. Ordered cake to go, after we had already paid. The cashier seemed annoyed but EF her, she had just arrived a mere 10 minutes before we were paying our bill. I'm totallly bitter while writing this review....ugh just grossed out. It should also be noted I was here about 3 months ago and ordered the same bacon and cheese omlette and found a hair. Not mine, it was a beard/moustache hair of some sort and last time I checked I was clear in that area. Hmmm why do I go back....24hrs? Hard to come by on the southside. You may lose me, Archview, and I've visited you about 5 times over the last 6 months.

29.description: Archview is a diamond in the rough. This place is open 24 hours, has a cozy feeling and you always see it full of regulars. Is it 5 star downtown dining? No, absolutely not and you shouldn't expect that from a 24 hour diner on the south side. However, it is a place where you can get a bowl of soup, a good sandwich and cup of coffee any time of the day or night for cheap. The servers are friendly and you can tell most have been there a long time. It is a neighborhood place that has been there forever. The food is good and the staff is friendly. You shouldn't expect anything else from any diner. If so, cook for yourself at home then or stick to downtown dining and pay for it. My favorite is the regular BLT or the BLT on a croissant!

42.description: I love the food here and for the price it's perfect. Their breakfast skillets are amazing! and the price is just right.My only problem is that the service is too slow. I mean i've stared at empty coffee mugs for more than 5 minutes, and tasted my coffee go cold fast. As long as they step the service speed up and keep my coffee warm, i'll give it a better rating.

23.description: Food was decent. Had a blt sandwich, crispy bacon cooked prefect. Bread was toasty and not soggy at all. Great overall. Girlfriends gyro was tasty as well, but just like my food. Good but nothing that blew me away. I'll have to come back and try other items from the menu.

47.description: The New Archview Restaurant,  has been a diner I've been dining at since I was in high school, and over the years I felt the food hasn't been the same, either my taste in food has grown, or their food just is not as quality as it has been in the past.The service is good and friendly,

8.description: Good food, good prices, good atmosphere. They're not open 24 hours anymore which is kind of sad, but doesn't take away from it being a good place. It rivals Hucks down the street. Service is nice and quick.

31.description: I always go here when my family wants to have a meal out but doesnt want to travel great distances. Since its in our neighborhood Arch view is always our first choice.  My favorite waitress is Heather. Shes so sweet. Mostly every worker Ive encountered had good customer service skills with the exception of a waitress beginning with A. I didnt catch the rest of her name. Breakfast, The summer sandwiches, The hot lamb sandwich with mash potatoes on the side and daily soups are delicious and recommended.  The menu is very extensive so it can even satisfy a very picky eater, like myself.

34.description: I always get great service here! They are awesome and friendly people. My breakfast dish is chocolate chip and pecan waffles!

16.description: Went in last week for breakfast and when I opened the coffee creamer there was mold inside it!  Completely lost my appetite!  To make things worse when I told my server, she reacted very nonchalantly.  I will NEVER visit Archview again!!!

13.description: There's not many 24-7 spots in the south side, but I highly recommend going here if you're having a late night craving. (Would not recommend Huck Finn)The service is always quick, attentive, and respectable. Whenever I go here, I have not had any problems with the service nor the food. From their breakfast selection to lunch and dinner, a lot of their items are delicious. Whenever I go in for breakfast, I order pancakes with chocolate chips. I would recommend anything on their menu. This is definitely my go to spot if I'm craving late night American.

11.description: Archview is a pretty typical dinner. The food is decent, the prices are eh, and the staff is sometimes grumpy, but usually very nice. The decor is okay if you like seaside murals. The burgers are good insomuch as what comes on them and the breakfast food is all very standard. The coffee is bad, but the cup is endless (good enough for me). The Malibu croissant (chicken, bacon, mayo, croissant) is delicious and one of the most redeeming savory plates. The desserts and soups are usually a hit or miss, but a shot I'm willing to take.Go here over Huck Finn's unless you prefer a belly full of grease.

39.description: better food than Huck Finn. and there's a full bar. nuff said.

37.description: K, so this place is always packed with locals & cops; the food is your typical diner food & the place is open fairly late.  I've honestly never been wowed by anything there but I have always enjoyed my meals.

0.description: Definitely a bummer that they're not 24 hours anymore. I live in the neighborhood and this was always the "after a night out spot."Anyways, I never leave dissatisfied with this place. The soups are usually great, service is your typical Bridgeport/Mckinley Park diner vibe, and the menu is extensive. I might argue that the prices are flirting with being too expensive for a diner, though.The breakfast skillets are always satisfying and so are their burgers. I've tried much of their ever-changing menus and those are the two items I usually go for.

38.description: I came here instead when I discovered nearby Huck Finn closed early on Christmas Eve. Can't fault them for taking care of their employees, but I was hungry! Fortunately this place was still open and I found the food to be of a similar quality as its nearby competitor. Admittedly I have only been here a handful of times, but have never been disappointed with the quality of the food and the courteous service. I may have to stop in more often!

51.description: Been there once and I don't think I'll ever come back, even if it's 24 hours. I'd rather go to Huck Finn. Sorry, the food quality just isn't there.

27.description: Was pleased to have found this place earlier. Another reviewer had called this a "diamond in the rough". That's a nice way of looking at it. Surrounded by , well, garbage, sits this cozy little diner. I was starving earlier and was in the area for work. I pulled out my handy Yelp app and it directed me here amidst a plethora of Mexican restaurants. Just wasn't in the mood for burgers or tacos. I found myself eating a wonderful Cajun Chicken Pasta smothered in delicious tangy "new Orleans inspired sauce". Graced with luscious chunks of perfectly seasoned chicken chunks. Maybe I was simply really hungry? Nope. I brought it home and finished for supper. Tasted just as good after heating it up. I should also mention the Clam Chowder was also delicious.Service was above average for a diner. The waitress boxed my food for me. That's a rare thing for this type of establishment. Cons:The bread they served with the soup came pre packaged. I didn't try it so I cannot rate it but bread in a wrapper doesn't look appealing.

32.description: Here every 3 days.Great food. Great prices. Great service. Jinni is the best waitress anywhere. She is quick in both service and witty come backs. She has a huge heart and knows her menu from top to bottom. I must say, I am sad they do not have the jalapeno poppers but it's okay. The wraps are top and their veggie burgers are a must. Also they have awesome banana splits. Yum!

54.description: After further review, its nothing like George's. Good but not great, professional cranky waitresses who fit every waitress stereotype you dreamed of, including the waitress who coughs up a lunge before bringing your food then goes out to have a smoke. There's more good than bad to this place, so i'll be back.

48.description: Decent breakfast fare -- nice waitress -- clean establishment.  Period.

44.description: Usually the dining is quite easy and satisfying here, but for some reason we were rushed from the sit down. Rushed as in the waitress pulled my menu before I finished, asked if we wanted a box while we were still eating, and not offered dessert. Come on now, if you want a bigger tip, you have to sell appetizers, dessert, and after-dinner coffee. Food quality was on par with the norm here and prices matched accordingly.Open 24 hours is a plus!

24.description: This is really a good place to eat but I have to give it 2 stars because of the management & a situation that I witnessed. My husband & I were eating lunch when all of a sudden we heard a loud woman's voice saying " you got a problem with me? Come over here then ." A manager or whoever she was, was talking to her bus boy like this which was totally unprofessional in front of the customers. She then proceeded to keep being loud & call people stupid & other derogatory names. It was such an unpleasant scene to watch & she made everyone feel uncomfortable. You don't treat your employees like crap in front of your customers- you take them to the side or the office & address any issues. I refuse to have my meal ruined over bitchy managers with attitude problems.I don't know her name but she has a small tattoo on her neck behind her ear.

7.description: I love the soup from here. The dumpling soup is amazing. Deni and I always enjoy the food when he is on lunch from work. We have great conversation over dinner all the time. The cakes are AMAZING !!! The staff is very friendly

49.description: Dont get me wrong...the food is great...ITS REAL GOOD BUTTTTTT, I always ask for pop refills and they never charge me for more then one pop, i went the other day and they charged me for like 3 or 4, when i told the lady cash register lady she said they have always been doing that. and if she found out ...THATS A LIE, I wanted to talk to a manager but she said she was the Manager... So i just paid my bill and left

40.description: This is definitely a place I would've driven by without noticing it. There isn't anything outside to attract the customers but the great service and diner style food will keep me coming back for sure! I am a northsider and was meeting my friend for breakfast. I was greeted with a warm smile and friendly staff. My coffee was served promptly and kept warm the entire time with constant refills. The food was as expected, delicious and appetizing, by far the best hashbrowns I have had in a long time - not shredded but sliced in small pieces and very crispy!!!!!!!!! Definitely worth the drive!!!!!! THe parking lot next to the restaurant is very small so there is one across the street next to a house.

53.description: Came here for breakfast/lunch. Wow, been years since I've been back. Guess it's been awhile since I've gone clubbing......anyways.....I ordered the BLT and it was good....as usual. Guy got the breakfast. Food here is good......for a diner. Waitress we got was nice and friendly. I know back then some were not as friendly. Thank god the bread are individually wrapped now. God knows what (drunk) people did to the ones they use to serve.

30.description: Perfect for breakfast & sandwiches. I'd skip the entrees, except the corned beef, it is tasty. Prices are reasonable & the waitress are nice. Breakfast & lunch menu is served 24-7.

46.description: This place has been around for a while...I love that they are open 24 hours! Greasy food and lack vegetarian options.

1.description: They are no longer 24 hours. I love diners and used to really like this place. After some time and trying different menu items I realized what they serve is not worth the price. And most of the time just not good. I love the Greek salad, but that's about it. Everything else I've had leaves me upset that I have to pay for it. Sorry Archview! I still love your super 90's interior and your service is just fine, but I won't be back for a while.

55.description: Good old reliable. This is my usual stop for breakfast, lunch, or dinner with my husband when we have no other plans or are too lazy to cook. I prefer it much more than Huck Finns.The food is always good. Typical "Greek" diner menu choices with variety, and breakfast is served all day. Service is ok - what you would expect at a diner (take it as you will). Great deal on the prices.

9.description: The food consistently sucks here. Had dinner here (breaded pork tenderloin) with mashed potatoes about a month ago. It was marginal at best.Yesterday, I had the Florentine Benedict for breakfast. Awful. The eggs were so runny they just got lost in the english muffin into mush, and the hash browns were barely even cooked. I told the server to take it back and re-do, when it got it back the hash browns were burnt not crispy like I like them.I can remember coming here back in the day and the food was always decent, they must've changed owners or something because the quality of the food just sucks now!I give this place 2 stars because the service has always been very good. But I won't be coming back here.

26.description: Archview is always good for a quick meal. They have a huge selection of food and the service is great. My water glass never goes empty and I greatly appreciate that. You can't go wrong with the breakfast foods and there's plenty of parking in the back. I've never tried something on the menu that I didn't like. They don't rush you know that you sit there and talk with your friends.

25.description: For an old school diner, the Archview is pretty much as good as it gets! Good food, huge menu, excellent service, open all night.... If you want a quality non-hipster diner, this is the place to be. They clearly strive to do a good job and are constantly improving their food and service.

12.description: I was There this morning after not going There for a year I realize why I stopped My waitress was  nice but the food was horrible I order the soup cream chicken I taste it And it wasn't so good I didn't eat it my coffee cup was dirty I had to tell my waitress if I can have a clean cup my omelet  was ok later on she came back to clean the table and didn't even ask why I didn't eat the soup Or anything she time the soup away and my friends soup as well I think they should care more about their costumers never going back again

59.description: it's a typical s. side greasy spoon---don't eat it often or you'll die an early death!  it's good  hangover food (salty, fatty and processed) and drinks from the mini bar will knock you on your ass!

21.description: Tried Archview out once, was not happy and will not be back. The hostess was very rude and shot me attitude. The food was just ok, not terrible but certainly not great. I watched the owner yell at one of the servers. That was awkward and shouldn't be handled out in the open for all to see. Not very professional. If I want to hear yelling I can just attend a family get together.

17.description: Great food great service super friendly staff love this place breakfast lunch and dinner all great club croissant  is amazing

10.description: Great menu, great selection. And they have crepes  quick service. Had the Mexican skillet and it was very good. The coffee tastes better than many breakfast places I've visited before. Will definitely come back!

5.description: Archview is one of the better diners in Chicago. Their food's good and they have an enormous menu.

3.description: Nothing too special about this place. Always home to great staff and tasty food, but there isn't anything that sticks out in particular. Doesn't help that they aren't open 24 hours anymore. Well, there's always Huck Finn's...

35.description: I have been coming here for years and the food has been pretty much the same. They have a huge selection of diner food to chose from, which is good if you like options. I would say the food here is pretty much average diner food. My personal favorites are the breaded mushroom with the meat sauce, omelets, benedicts, french toast, and the burgers. The chicken wings used to be pretty good, but the last few times I have gotten them, they were just okay. This is a good spot to come during the late hours when everywhere else is closed and you are hungry. Parking is never an issue here because they have so many parking lots. The service here is okay for the most part.

19.description: Amazing cheeseburger!!!! And I've been to Kuma's! Seriously so good. Great value, large portions and comes with soup. Good fries and best of all they serve alcohol! Yummy mudslide :)

28.description: Lunch with a group of 4.  BBQ beef & steak club were awesome. Oh and the fries were one of the best I've ever had!  Tons of specials along with a menu that has everything. Nice cozy feel with plenty of parking.

45.description: I've passed by Archview literally hundreds of times on my way to work as I take the 50 Damen bus and every time I remember seeing a fleet of cop cars park in front and groups of elderly people in the window chatting away over coffee. There was something about this imagery that made me keep this place in the back of my mind as a place I had to visit. Well I finally got to put my curiosity to rest this weekend as I ventured in for the first time and I am happy to say it was an absolute pleasure.  From just skimming the reviews I see a lot of comparisons to Huck Finn. It's the same basic gist: homey diner feel with an array of comfort food that's good for the soul, but not for the heart. I haven't been to Hucks in years, but my visit to Archview pretty much reminded me of what Huck was which is a pretty good thing in my opinion. The staff was very friendly and quick though they can be a little bit pushy (in a gentle way) in trying to get you to try other menu items. The food portions were moderately generous depending on what you ordered. I ordered the Clock Special which came with 4 pieces of french toast, 2 eggs, and your choice of bacon or sausage. My philosophy is that you can't go wrong with breakfast foods so my meal was perfect. The bacon was nice and crispy so I highly recommend working bacon into your meal. My friend got one of  the Saturday specials which was a HUGE meatball sub with fries. What made the meatball sub even more extraordinary is that instead of 2 flimsy pieces of bread sandwiching the 2 giant  (and I do mean GIANT) meatballs, they used thick pieces of garlic bread. Yes, that's right garlic bread! Needless to say  my friend definitely got the better deal, but I was still happy with my breakfast item (I have an intense love for breakfast foods so whenever I can get it you bet your side of hashbrown I am going to order it). Both of our meals were 7-8 dollars bringing out total bill to about 16 bucks which is quite a deal since we both left really satisfied.   Conclusion: I like to group Archview in special category of restaurants I like to call "Old people restaurants", which means delicious home style foods served in a comfy (carpeted) dining room that makes you think you were eating at grandma's house. Plus  50% of the patrons are probably collecting social security. I love these types of places since they give you good food in a quiet/calm environment so I give Archview a thumbs up. Added bonus: The UNIQUE thrift store is a block or two away so after you enjoy you meal you can walk off those calories by looking for a bargain. Old people restaurant + thrift store shopping=one relaxing Saturday afternoon.

33.description: What's there to look for in a diner? Not service. The food was mediocre. The waitress was sour and only friendly to the regular cops who eat there. I feel so out of place eating there with my date. I'm not sure if I have been spoiled about eating out in other diners but food that I ordered will usually get placed right in my face instead of at the edge of the table where I had to scoot to get it.The "good" thing about eating here is the appetizers are doable. They're really average for the average price. Not really sure if it's worth the drive to come out here to eat besides them being open 24 hours.Good luck and enjoy your food.

43.description: I've been coming here since all the waitresses were allowed to sit at the counter and take their smoke breaks. Used to come here every Friday night with my best friend and share the nachos or potato skins, a bowl of New England clam chowder and a cup of hot tea with lemon and honey while gossiping about people and deciding what movie to watch. See, Archview is that kind of restaurant. Not fancy, no frou frou drinks, entrees or desserts. Just simple stick-to-your-ribs comfort food in a relaxed atmosphere. Service is a mixed bag. Sometimes you get that sweetheart that smiles and calls you "Hon" and cracks jokes to make you smile. Sometimes you get the one who asks if you want anything to drink but walks away before you can answer, takes your menu before you're done ordering and just makes you feel like you're bothering her.You want no-nonsense food and service, come here.

2.description: They are no longer open 24/7 as of Sept 2015. They are open every day from 6 AM - 10 PMI usually come here when I'm craving for their taco or julienne salad and tuna club. It's only 5 min walk from my house. I prefer Archview over Huck finn because of the menu.

18.description: What's there to look for in a diner? Not service. The food was mediocre. The waitress was sour and only friendly to the regular cops who eat there. I feel so out of place eating there with my date. I'm not sure if I have been spoiled about eating out in other diners but food that I ordered will usually get placed right in my face instead of at the edge of the table where I had to scoot to get it.The "good" thing about eating here is the appetizers are doable.
