They're really average for the average price. Not really sure if it's worth the drive to come out here to eat besides them being open 24 hours.Good luck and enjoy your food.

41.description: I've been a long time customer here. i was introduce to this place back then by my friends because they said there is a smoking section there in the restaurant (yes i am a smoker). all these years I've been here.. the service been pretty consistent so that's a good thing.I've tried almost every burger/sandwich and most of the food on the menu here over the years. all i can say is the food is nothing special.. everything that I've tried either taste average or a little below average. some of the food that's worth trying if you never been here would be fried mushrooms, chicken wings, and t-bone steak just to list a few. also beware of their soda, there was a few times that it tasted very flat.after Illinois ban smoking from indoor places, i have came here less and less. good thing about this place is that it opens 24/7. altho the food is just alright, i do enjoy coming here once in a full moon with some friends to eat.

52.description: For one of the old fashioned joints, this place has it going on. With its vintage (dare I say 70's) look, it has one of the best mashed potatoes (yes I said it) and gravy I have had in a long time. I am defintely coming back for seconds here. They also have a good array of liquors *(Say it all sophisticated). Worth a try if your tired of IHOP.

50.description: Being new to the McKinley Park area, the hubby and I were looking for a good neighborhood diner. And boy, we found it. We tried Huck Finn first, but the food and atmosphere were just mediocre. Huck Finn makes a big deal about its donuts, but other than the size, they're well below average.Archview, on the other hand, has a nice, warm atmosphere and great service. With a 7-page menu ranging from pancakes to kebabs and everything in between, the selection is a little overwhelming. But so far, everything we've tasted was fantastic. And for a pretty decent price, you get huge portions. We've definitely found our new favorite diner.

4.description: It's a solid standard, great neighborhood place. The prices have risen sharply recently, has been gradual over the years but the last one was a big jump. $24 for a skirt steak seems pretty steep for the Archview. Breakfast is my girlfriends most favorite meal and the Hawaiian omelet is always calling her. It's a great go to, the police are always eating there, and I would never turn my back on her.

6.description: Definitely prefer over Huck Finns. Bigger menu than Huck Finns. Food is good. I have been going here for years and the food isn't the best but for a local diner you don't expect 5 star cuisine. Waitresses are always nice. Love their sandwiches and Alfredo pasta.

22.description: I've been eating here since I was a kid, and every meal I've had here has been great. Before, they used to have the bread baskets with bread that wasn't put in a wrapper, and they used to have a variety of bread sticks, but I didn't really eat those anyway because the servings for every meal was huge.When I was younger, I loved eating the kid's spaghetti with meat sauce.  Years later, it's still one of my favorite dishes (except from the adult menu), but I've also gotten around to trying other dishes. The French Onion soup served on Sundays are excellent. I will purposely make room in my Sundays to have a bowl or quart of French Onion soup there. The amazing thing about it is that it's different from all the other French Onion soups! The Chicken Stir Fry and their Chicken Caesar salad is pretty decent, but the skirt steak is amazing. It's always cooked perfectly with potatoes that are pretty great too. And this is all at a reasonable price in a very homey environment. Highly recommended... And if any of you guys eat the spaghetti with meat sauce there, can you guys try to figure out the recipe for me? I've been trying to master it for some time now.

15.description: They have good breakfast's and there breaded pork tenderloin is very good. The burgers aren't bad either.

57.description: I've been going here for awhile now, and I gotta say, I appreciate the place.  The 24-hour ness is something I've never had to use, but I do appreciate.  Especially since there are cops in here all the time, I always feel safe as I'm staring into my coffee waiting for my eggs, pancakes, or what have you.I've never been here for anything besides breakfast, but I still love it.

20.description: Very sweet people who works there. Main dishes are always so much I share with my friend. They're kind enough to always be able to split it for us. We are full for tw people just under 20$. They're breakfast menu is all day long, which I adore since there's not really an ihop near. They have daily specials which are great with discounts. My favorite are their cream soup, though bacon cream soup was a but too much, the broccoli cream soup was magnificent.

36.description: The food at Archview is average at best, but I don't think most patrons come with expectations of a high quality meal. If you do, you will be sadly disappointed. It is what its is- a convenient, cheap place that somewhat-satisfactorily meets your craving for a variety of greasy foods with huge portions. And that's just what you need sometimes...but not most of the time.

14.description: This is really a good place to eat but I have to give it 2 stars because of the management & a situation that I witnessed. My husband & I were eating lunch when all of a sudden we heard a loud woman's voice saying " you got a problem with me? Come over here then ." A manager or whoever she was, was talking to her bus boy like this which was totally unprofessional in front of the customers. She then proceeded to keep being loud & call people stupid & other derogatory names. It was such an unpleasant scene to watch & she made everyone feel uncomfortable. You don't treat your employees like crap in front of your customers- you take them to the side or the office & address any issues. I refuse to have my meal ruined over bitchy managers with attitude problems.I don't know her name but she has a small tattoo on her neck behind her ear.
